event.text: The civilian ship is grateful for your heroic actions and pays you in scrap.
The civilian ship is grateful for your heroic actions and pays you in ammunition.
The civilian ship is grateful for your heroic actions and pays you in fuel.
The civilian ship is grateful for your heroic actions and pays you in drone parts.
"This sector has become increasingly dangerous for friends of the Federation. I think my crew can patch up some of your hull damage as thanks."
The ship you saved was badly damaged in the battle. Most of the crew accepts your offer to be dropped off at a nearby station. One offers to join your crew.
The survivor gets on board the ship.
Little survived the explosion on the station. You scrap the hull and move on.
The smoking husk of the station's hull provides little for you to scrap.
A quick search of the station reveals it was a medical facility that was combat ready. You find some medical supplies to take with you.
Some searching around the station shows slaves were kept here. In the fight, many of the slaves were killed. You free the survivors, and one offers to stay with your crew.
Some searching around the station shows it was an armory. You grab one of the military grade weapons and some missiles, and scrap the hull.
A quick search of the station reveals it was a security checkpoint. You find a bucket of fake ID's, though they've all been marked as such. You move on to scrap the station.
A quick search of the station reveals it was a standard Rebel outpost. With little of value, you scrap its hull.
It seems the turrets still had some juice in them after all. They lock onto your ship, pelting your defenses and causing some minor damage. You pull away before they can do anything worse.
It turns out the colony was harboring a pirate fugitive. Now that their cover has been blown, they protect themselves and attack you.
Luckily the turrets remain offline and no ships rise to meet you. You take all that you can gather from the wreckage of the colony.
It turns out the colony was harboring a pirate fugitive. Now that their cover has been blown, they protect themselves and attack you.
Luckily the turrets remain offline and no ships rise to meet you. You take all that you can gather from the wreckage of the colony.
Scans show the turrets are still connected to a functioning backup generator. It's too risky to approach while they're active.
Seems a known pirate fugitive is hiding in the colony, but they haven't seen you yet.
Realizing that their cover has been blown, the pirates protect themselves and attack you.

choice.text: Avoid the pirate and scrap some of the debris.

event.text: Scans show no ships detected and confirm the turrets are offline. You take all that you can gather from the wreckage of the colony.
Before you can reach the wreck, a Militia ship comes swooping in to stop you. If you want to continue with your salvage mission you'll have to take care of them first.
It seems you've made a miscalculation. The wreckage is still populated, not by its original crew but rather a bunch of angry Ghosts who aren't pleased by your attempts at breaking apart their ship.
You are undisturbed as you scrap the wreckage.
The Rebels are too delusional to listen to you. They won't believe anything you say and eventually become so enraged they decide to attack you.

The Rebels are beyond insane, and it's clear they must have PTSD of some sort. They accelerate, oblivious to the fact they're about to collide with you. You try to steer out of the way, but your hulls still collide. The Rebel ship takes the brunt of the hit and is compromised. Your ship still takes damage, but at least you can get some scrap out of it.

The Rebels can't comprehend anything you say, and it becomes clear they must have PTSD of some sort. Since you can't convince them the battles are long since over, you talk the captain into joining your crew instead to 'escape'.
You are able to retrieve a significant amount of data about the surrounding beacons from the scout before you scrap it.

You find the ship has a built-in method of warning the Rebel fleet of contact with your ship. You feed it some false data about your ship's whereabouts that should keep the fleet off your tail for a time.

You try your best to convey the notion that the approaching Rebel fleet has countless automated ships scouting for them. However, either the translation device has failed or they're simply not interested. They cut the channel and continue to absorb the ships.

You try your best to convey the notion that the approaching Rebel fleet has countless automated ships scouting for them. You're not certain if you were misunderstood but they appear to scoff at your suggestion. Most ships continue what they were doing but a single ship moves to fight you.

You try your best to convey the notion that the approaching Rebel fleet has countless automated ships scouting for them. They thank you for the tip and prepare to jump in the direction you came. That will hopefully delay the fleet. You scrap what remains of the Rebel station.
Your ship's dashboard suddenly lights up with warnings - a hull breach! Lanius were on board the platform and are now on board your ship. A hidden cruiser comes into view!
What seemed to be a brief respite turns into a Lanius trap... the first warning is an explosion from your engine room, followed moments later by detection of a Lanius ship at sensor range!
No one answers your hails. You run some scans and discover that the station has been recently abandoned, no doubt due to the threat of the Lanius. You empty their fuel reserves before leaving.

choice.text: (Upg. Sensors) Run another scan at maximum sensitivity.

event.text: You run an additional more focused scan and find one of the auxiliary refueling platforms has some unclaimed fuel.

choice.text: (Adv. Sensors) Run another scan at maximum sensitivity.

event.text: You run an additional more focused scan and find one of the auxiliary refueling platforms has some unclaimed fuel and drone parts.

choice.text: (Long-Ranged Scanners) Run another scan at maximum sensitivity.

event.text: You run an additional more focused scan and find one of the auxiliary refueling platforms has some unclaimed fuel and drone parts.

You take some damage trying to open the cache, but fortunately it's nothing too major. Inside, it seems it's mostly drone parts and schematics. You don't have time to pull apart the whole thing, but you do take back an impressive haul.
You make it to the cache without a scratch. Inside, it seems it's mostly drone parts and schematics. You don't have time to pull apart the whole thing, but you do take back an impressive haul.

You take some damage trying to open the cache, but fortunately it's nothing too major. Inside, it seems it's mostly ammo and weapons. You don't have time to pull apart the whole thing, but you do take back an impressive haul.
You make it to the cache without a scratch. Inside, it seems it's mostly ammo and weapons. You don't have time to pull apart the whole thing, but you do take back an impressive haul.

You take some damage trying to open the cache, but fortunately it's nothing too major. Inside, it seems it's mostly fuel and augments. You don't have time to pull apart the whole thing, but you do take back an impressive haul.
You make it to the cache without a scratch. Inside, it seems it's mostly fuel and augments. You don't have time to pull apart the whole thing, but you do take back an impressive haul.
You make it to the cache without a scratch. Inside, it seems it's mostly drone parts and schematics. You don't have time to pull apart the whole thing, but you do take back an impressive haul.
You make it to the cache without a scratch. Inside, it seems it's mostly ammo and weapons. You don't have time to pull apart the whole thing, but you do take back an impressive haul.
You make it to the cache without a scratch. Inside, it seems it's mostly fuel and augments. You don't have time to pull apart the whole thing, but you do take back an impressive haul.
You land on the platform and move to investigate, when a pirate vessel appears from behind the asteroid! It was using the platform as a trap!

The platform is more battered than you originally thought. The shield generator is running on fumes, and the crew are long since gone. You aren't sure why they left, but a substantial amount of fuel is left over.

You step aboard the station only to find a Rockman, a former resident of the platform, locked in the cargo bay. He's terrified when you open the doors, but you manage to calm him. He explains that a pirate raid slaughtered the crew, and that he was the only survivor.

You board the station only to notice the shield generator is still functional. You strip it of parts and use them to upgrade your own shields, though you're uncertain what led to the station being abandoned.

You reach the civilian ship using some cables and manage to correct their trajectory just in time to avoid collision. Their ship is toast, but you convince them to come with you until you can transport them to a safe location. One of them offers to remain behind to help you.

You reach the civilian ship using some cables and manage to correct their trajectory just in time to avoid collision. Their ship is heavily beaten up but they insist they'll be fine. They pay you for saving them.

You chase after the civilians, but several more asteroids strike your hull. You manage to reach their ship - just as it collides with a massive asteroid, obliterating it entirely. You pull away in time, but there's nothing to do but pick up some of the salvage and get out.

You reach the civilian ship and using some cables manage to correct their trajectory just in time to avoid collision. Their ship is toast, but you convince them to come with you until you can transport them to a safe location. One of them offers to remain behind to help you.

You reach the civilian ship and using some cables manage to correct their trajectory just in time to avoid collision. Their ship is heavily beaten up but they insist they'll be fine. They pay you for saving them.
You move closer to try and pick up some of the scrap metal, but it seems the ship has corrected its trajectory on its own. They don't take very kindly to you trying to screw them over, and open fire!

You move closer to try and pick up some of the scrap metal, but it seems the ship has corrected its trajectory on its own. "Damn Renegades! All you care about is scrap! Don't think we won't tell the Rebels about this!"
The civilian ship spirals away, crashing into a much larger asteroid. Nothing else disturbs you as you collect the wreckage.

The Rebels seem extremely cautious speaking with you. You start to catch on and decide to leave quickly. Chances are with the way that went they probably won't be very reluctant to give the fleet information about this sighting.

"You're a Renegade, no? I can't say we could see eye to eye on everything, but I can see the allure. Sometimes I want to leave this place behind too, but I have a duty to fulfill. Still, it's rare seeing someone like you who doesn't rush into combat. Take care, friend. May we never have to draw guns against each other."

"From the moment you jumped in I thought we were dead. Glad to see a friendly face, even if you are a Fed... Yeah, I know we're breaking the rules, but what's a little rock mining going to do? If you aren't too worried about the legality, maybe we could strike a trade?"

You fly in close and slice a hole to rupture the chemical containment. Your beam's arc manages to strike several of the tanks in a row, letting off far more than you intended. Since the warehouse is currently exposed to the vacuum of space, the gas is able to harmlessly spill out.

The mining crew are relieved that you managed to avoid their deaths. They seem disappointed that they lost so many of the resources that they had worked so hard to collect, but they're still grateful enough to reward you.

You fly over and sweep across the warehouse. Fortunately, you manage to just angle your Beam to slice open only the problematic tank. Since the warehouse is currently exposed to the vacuum of space, the gas is able to harmlessly spill out of the tank.
The mining crew are impressed at your ingenious solution. They offer to reward you with some of their resources and even a piece of mining equipment.
Nothing disturbs you while you scrap the ship. It appears the Lanius must have done some serious damage to their life support, and even the resistant Crusaders couldn't save themselves.

While salvaging the ship, several Rockmen Crusaders suddenly bust in through the door. "No one expects the Rock Inquisition!" Whether it was an ambush or they just really don't like you, it doesn't matter anymore. Prepare for combat!

Scans show the ship is empty. It appears the Lanius must have done some serious damage to their life support, and even the resistant Crusaders couldn't save themselves. You decide it's safe to salvage.
Scans show the life support on the ship has taken some damage, but the Crusader crew is still aboard.
You raise the weapons and attack the Crusader vessel while their oxygen is offline!

The Crusaders are surprisingly receptive to your questions. "We heard this sector contained relics of an ancient god race, which matched some ancient Crystal mythology. The Elders don't want any challengers to the Crystal race, so they sent us out here to capture one and bring it back... only to find a bunch of Lanius who wanted to eat us. Now if you'll excuse us, we have to get back to repairing this ship before we suffocate and die."
You raise the weapons and attack the Crusader vessel while their oxygen is offline!

choice.text: (Upg. Oxygen) Offer to dock and refill their oxygen.

event.text: The Crusaders agree, and you quickly dock with their ship and flood it with oxygen. They're considerably pleased, and while most of them feel the need to carry on with their mission, one wishes to stay behind with you, to which the others don't protest.

You fire your weapon, and after a moment the tech begins to cool down. Seems a self-destruct had been tripped, likely by the Augmented ship. With the self-destruct disabled, your ship and the Lanius are able to convene over the ruin.
You fire your weapon, but nothing happens. You beat a hasty retreat while the tech continues to heat to critical levels.
The moment you start your weapons, you are immediately boarded by a raiding party. However, the ship is undefended, meaning you can freely take the weapon once the boarders are dealt with.
The moment you start your weapons, the Augmented ship comes online. They intend to defend their harvest!

The moment you start your weapons, you are immediately boarded by a raiding party. To make matters worse, the Auto-ship starts up again. "Reinitialization: complete. Renegade detected. Hostile Lanius detected. New mission parameters: Eliminate all targets." It looks like they weren't done with disabling it!
The ship goes dark. Surprisingly, they have all chosen to die of starvation instead of destroying their own ship.

You swiftly contact the Lanius and instruct them to lower their shields so you can use your Beam to fix their integrity. They do so, allowing themselves to be repaired, and they calm down afterwards. "In fight. Won, barely. Have - we found this."

You swiftly contact the Lanius and instruct them to lower their shields so you can use your Beam to fix their integrity. However, your plea goes ignored - either due to mistrust or confusion, which is not helped by their panic.
"Identification invalid. True identity: Federation vessel. Activating combat mode."
"Rebel ship detected. Dispensing supplies."
As you approach the station, an automated ship comes flying out from its hiding place in the forest and attacks! You're forced to flee as the ship chases you.
The platform was better defended than you were prepared for. Several Engineers are beamed onto your ship, and a powerful artillery cannon penetrates your defenses.
The Engineers are sent scattering as you attack the station. Not prepared in any way for combat, they're forced to surrender.
Nearly a second after the Auto-ship finished repairing itself, the Auto-ship detects you as an enemy and attacks!
"Repairs complete. Thank you for your service. As promised, here is your reward. Glory to the Rebellion!" The Auto-ship spits out a drone and jumps away.
"Repairs complete. Thank you for your service. As promised, here is your reward. Glory to the Rebellion!" The Auto-ship spits out an augment and jumps away.

Even against the quick-witted beast, the drone does considerable damage. It does its best to protect the hunting party from the creature, but the clever beast manages to kill one of the Slugs before being subdued.
The beast is taken by surprise at how formidable the specialized drone is. Even focusing on it, the creature barely manages to destroy it before being subdued by the unharmed hunting party.

The assault drone does its job, both by taking the brunt of the beast's assault and by doing a considerable amount of damage in its own right. The Clansmen are able to win the day with a single casualty.

event.name: CLAN_FAUNA_MID_PYRRHIC
event.text: The beast mostly ignores the drone to focus on the squishy targets, but this proves to be a mistake, as the drone is able to punish this decision with its combat prowess. Unfortunately, the Slug hunting party takes serious casualties in the process.
The beast manages to outmaneuver the drone using its wits to focus on the hunting party. Unfortunately, by the time the drone finally manages to attack, it no longer has any Slugs to back up.
Your drone does its best to support the Clansmen, but the beast ignores it and tears the hunting party apart.
The support drone manages to help the Clansmen win the day, both by doing its duty and by acting as a shield, but there are some serious casualties along the way.

The beast immediately charges the Siren, identifying it as the biggest threat. Somehow, the creature's mental faculties seem to cloud in the presence of the Siren, who uses this to its advantage, fighting defensively as the Clansmen are able to get clean shots off at it. However, your Siren doesn't seem to care much for the lives of the huntsmen, and some of them are injured.

The beast immediately charges the Siren, identifying it as the biggest threat. Your crew evades its attack, as the Clansmen are able to get clean shots off. Eventually, the creature goes absolutely berserk, tearing the hunters apart, before the Siren finally pacifies it long enough for one of the few remaining Slugs to end its life.

Vortigon's zealotry breaks through even the psychic beast's powers. The beast can neither subvert Vortigon's will nor meaningfully hurt him. Vortigon pins the beast in a grapple, and the Slugs are able to take it down without a single casualty.

Vortigon's zealotry breaks through even the psychic beast's powers. The beast can neither subvert Vortigon's will nor meaningfully hurt him. It manages to escape his grasp, and does its best to keep away from him. Though the battle is arduous, the Slugs are able to take cover behind Vortigon's mighty girth.

The Slugs adopt a formation around Alkali. Thanks to his keen xenobiological insights, the beast is unable to break the formation. However injured they get, the whole hunting party is able to receive as much medical assistance as they need.

event.name: CLAN_FAUNA_ALKALI_SUCCESS
event.text: The Clansmen adopt a formation around Alkali. The beast is able to tear into some of the Slugs, but he manages to keep most of them stable just before they drop. However, one of the flanking hunters gets a little careless, and is torn to pieces before Alkali can help.

Turzil directs the Clansmen with measured precision. Once the beast is baited, Turzil calls in the entire squad on his position. As his protective field generates around every Slug, they are virtually invulnerable to the creature's attacks, leading to a triumphant victory. The hunting party hails their victorious general.

event.name: CLAN_FAUNA_TURZIL_SUCCESS
event.text: TTurzil directs the hunting party with measured precision. Once the beast is baited, Turzil calls in the entire squad on his position. As his protective field generates around every Slug, they are virtually invulnerable to the creature's attacks. It eventually learns of this, and breaks off the assault so that it can wait it out. After Turzil's field dissipates, the protection has faded, but the damage is done, and the beast is too hurt to capitalize on it properly.

The Cultist springs into action, taking their stimulants and rushing the creature. It is completely unprepared for the zealot's ordinary yet impenetrable mind, and cannot manage to attack. Even after the stims wear off, the beast is worn down and pinned, allowing for the hunters to finish it off.

event.name: CLAN_FAUNA_CULTIST_SUCCESS
event.text: The Cultist takes their stimulants and pursues the beast. With a savage zealotry, they rain down a barrage of blows, but as soon as the drugs wear off, the creature manages to get some distance between itself and your crew. However, at this point it is weak enough that the Slugs can handle it.

The Cultist takes their stimulants and pursues the beast. Despite your crew's zealotry, there is a small crack in their mental discipline that proves to be enough to let the creature avoid many of their strikes. Though the battle is eventually won with considerable casualties, your Rock was not able to give it their all.

Your Separatist goes nano-mode and swarms the creature. It wastes a lot of its energy just trying to fight the ghostly figure as it is pelted with the gunfire of the Slugs. Once a few blasts hit it, it ignores your Engi and starts wreaking havoc amongst the hunting party. Surprisingly, they still somehow win.

event.name: CLAN_FAUNA_SEPARATIST_FAILURE
event.text: Your Separatist goes nano-mode and swarms the creature. The beast completely ignores the apparition and instead follows its nose, rooting out and slaughtering the entire hunting party. As you recall your Engi to your ship, you begin to wonder what in the heck you were thinking with that move.

Your Defender takes point. The beast notices the shiny, seemingly defenseless figure and strikes, but their shield protects it both from physical and mental attacks. Your crew holds on tight to the creature as the hunting party fires upon the creature from afar. It's not too difficult for the beast to break free of the Engi's hold, but the damage is done. Unfortunately, it still tears the hunting party apart.

Your Defender takes point. The beast momentarily attacks, but quickly gives up once it strikes the shield. The hunting party is rendered defenseless against the creature, as it completely ignores your Engi. At least you were able to get your crewman back.

event.name: CLAN_FAUNA_OSMIAN_SUCCESS
event.text: Your Osmian ingeniously makes use of their hologram generation ability while staying away from danger. The beast has no idea of how to fight the holograms, as it can't properly fight them, but also can't ignore them. The Slugs hang back and pick their shots, though some end up injured eventually. Still, the battle is won.

Your Osmian ingeniously makes use of their hologram generation ability while staying away from danger. Their quarry has no idea of how to fight the holograms, as it can't properly fight them, but it is able to evade them. The beast is worn down by the holograms and the Slugs, but many lives are lost in the process.

event.name: CLAN_FAUNA_TECHNICIAN_SUCCESS
event.text: Your Technician sends down remote controlled drones to harass the beast while they stay at a safe distance. Their quarry is unable to ignore the drones, which keep appearing and striking when its back is turned. In conjunction with the hunting party's careful distance, the war of attrition is eventually won, though some Slugs were injured.

Your Technician sends down remote controlled drones to harass the beast while they stay at a safe distance. Their quarry is unable to ignore the drones, which keep appearing and striking when its back is turned. However, the drones are unable to attack fast enough to keep it from killing many of the Slug hunting party. The battle is bloody, but the hunting party returns victorious.
Despite your best efforts, you manage to hit almost none of the targets. In order to have another shot, you'll have to pay up.

event.name: CLAN_SHARPSHOOTER_KERNEL_SOLO_2
event.text: You pay up the money for another attempt. This had better be worth it.

Fortunately, with a previous attempt's worth of experience, you're able to successfully hit all the targets. A Slug Clansman approaches you from behind. "Congratulationsss on your sssuccessss. Here'sss your prize for doing it. Jussst don't asssk how we got it, can't have the Praetorium asssking too many quessstionsss here."

choice.text: Time to quit whilst you're still ahead.

event.text: You give it a good attempt, but though you manage to hit most of the targets, a few still remain unscathed. In order to have another shot, you'll have to pay up.

choice.text: Time to quit whilst you're still ahead.

event.text: Miraculously, you manage to hit all the targets on your first attempt. A Slug Clansman approaches you from behind. "Good going there. Not many people manage that firssst attempt. In fact, it'sss how we make mossst of our profitsss. Anywaysss, here'sss your prize. Jussst don't asssk how we got it, can't have the Praetorian asssking too many quessstionsss here."
Despite your best efforts, you manage to hit almost none of the targets. In order to have another shot, you'll have to pay up.

event.name: CLAN_SHARPSHOOTER_CRYSTAL_SOLO_2
event.text: You pay up the money for another attempt. This had better be worth it.

Fortunately, with a previous attempt's worth of experience, you're able to successfully hit all the targets. A Slug Clansman approaches you from behind. "Congratulationsss on your sssuccessss. Here'sss your prize for doing it. Jussst don't asssk how we got it, you have no idea how ssstiff the Cryssstalline people can be about thessse thingsss."

choice.text: Time to quit whilst you're still ahead.

event.text: You give it a good attempt, but though you manage to hit most of the targets, a few still remain unscathed. In order to have another shot, you'll have to pay up.

choice.text: Time to quit whilst you're still ahead.

event.text: Miraculously, you manage to hit all the targets on your first attempt. A Slug Clansman approaches you from behind. "Good going there. Not many people manage that firssst attempt. In fact, it'sss how we make mossst of our profitsss. Anywaysss, here'sss your prize. Jussst don't asssk how we got it, you have no idea how ssstiff the Cryssstalline people can be about thessse thingsss."

Most of the other visitors here are unwilling to do much beyond making small talk, but soon you find a Vampweed merchant trying to peddle their goods. You're not entirely sure why they're trying to do so here, but you decide to leave the gallery with them in order to browse through their goods back on their ship.

It seems your Renegade background has deterred most of the other visitors here from talking with you. However, you soon find company with a Militia soldier. They're not particularly forthcoming with why they're here, but they also seem willing to join your crew.

A Crystal soon approaches you, with something of interest on their mind. "Ah, a military captain! Just what we were looking for. Somehow, it would seem that we found some unusually eager Slugs earlier. There were a few... let's say, misunderstandings, and they just gave us some sort of repulsive weapon. I'm sure you'll have no quarrels about it though." The Crystals present the weapon in question to you as a gift, and it appears to be an Anti-Bio weapon.
Your crew mounts the Equinoid and gives it their best, but the beast is too unruly and your crew is flung face first into the dirt. A painful failure, and a loss of scrap for your mission.

Your crew mounts the Equinoid, and clings on for dear life while they're flung around. Somehow, they manage to stay on, and by the end of the competition it turns out they're the winner! The Slugs bring out the prize.
Your crew mounts the Equinoid and gives it their best, but the beast is too unruly and your crew is flung face first into the dirt. A painful failure, and a loss of scrap for your mission.

Your crew mounts the Equinoid, and clings on for dear life while they're flung around. Somehow, they manage to stay on, and by the end of the competition it turns out they're the winner! The Slugs bring out the prize.

Your crew mounts the Equinoid, and clings on for dear life while they're flung around. Somehow, they manage to stay on, and by the end of the competition it turns out they're the winner! The Slugs bring out the prize.
"Thhhhen do as you will. But don't hesitate to kill any Clansmen who get in your way."
"Thhhhen you are nothhhing but a neutral coward. Get out of here."
"If you aren't opposed to thhhhem, thhhhen you support thhhhem." The ship charges weapons!
"Do you have anybody to vouch for your claims...? If not, thhhhen we appreciate your support, but we must be cautious. Farewell."

You talk to the Shells and try to reason with them. Luckily, Shells are creatures of science and logic, and not usually stubborn or malicious like Zoltans or Slugs. They seem to understand they were mistaken and let you past.

You talk to the Shells and try to reason with them. Luckily, Shells are creatures of science and logic, and not usually stubborn or malicious like Zoltans or Slugs. They seem to understand they were mistaken and let you past.
In the end, it seems your reasoning doesn't work. The Shells still accuse you of being a murderer (of which you technically are) and attack!

The facility produces top grade missile launchers, as well as explosives. Your crew introduces the viruses given to you by your ally into their systems. After doing this, they steal the highest quality weapon they can find, as well as whatever missiles they can get their hands on.

The facility produces the thick hull plating that makes Coalition ships so resilient. Your crew introduces the viruses given to you by your ally into their systems. After doing so, they're able to steal some of the plating technology.

The facility produces the advanced reactors that end up in Coalition ships. Your crew introduces the viruses given to you by your ally into their systems. After doing so, they steal some power cores to install into your ship.

The facility produces the engines for the Coalition. Your crew introduces the viruses given to you by your ally into their systems. After doing so, they steal some of the technology to upgrade your own engines.

As you tear open the cargo bay, you hear a distinct clicking noise. You quickly try to get out of the way but it's too late. The trapped cargo explodes, damaging the ship and destroying all of the cargo and the rest of the Auto-ship wreckage.
You tear open the cargo bay to find excess amounts of resources for you to take.

The sudden appearance of an unaffiliated ship forces the Mantises to submit. As the hostages are freed, one of the Slug hostages privately contacts your ship. "I'm tired of living on thisss world of bloodthirssssty maniacsss. Pleasssse, take me with you."

The sudden appearance of an unaffiliated ship forces the Mantises to submit. As the hostages are freed, one of the Leech hostages privately contacts your ship. "Why did my government ever agree to this? I'm sick of it. Please, let me join you."

The Mantises must have a teleporter! They respond to your threat by boarding your ship, carrying whatever supplies they can bring with them. The settlement's law enforcement contacts you as your ship is invaded, telling you it's your problem now.

The Mantises immediately slaughter their hostages. The settlement's law enforcement breaks in to apprehend them, and the ensuing fight ends up with pretty much everyone either dead or dying. Your work here is done.

The sudden appearance of an unaffiliated ship forces the settlement's law enforcement to capitulate. The Mantises demand that the nebula go away, but you explain to them that removing nebulae is not an easy task. Resigned, they petition for resettlement instead. One of them offers to join your crew for your assistance.

The sudden appearance of an unaffiliated ship forces the settlement's law enforcement to capitulate. The Mantises slaughter the surrendering officers. and take over the city. "We finding out how to destroy nebula! Also, one of us wanting to join your crew!"
The Rocks are angered by your decision to help the civilians. They respond to your threat by boarding your ship! Out of gratitude, a Mantis teleports up to help you fend off the attackers.

The settlement's law enforcement calls your bluff and decides to raid the Mantis hostage room anyway. The Mantises slaughter the hostages, and both the hostage-takers and the officers are killed in the ensuing struggle. Your work here is done.

His shuttle travels up from the encampment. Being a basic, bare-bones shuttle, it's largely defenseless to your attacks; your ion weapon knocks out his engines completely, causing the shuttle to crash land. You manage to get to it before his allies do, finding a low amount of salvage, as well as his body. Thanks to his rock-like biology he is in critical condition, but might pull through with some medical attention.

choice.text: (Upg. Medbay) Give him some medical attention.

event.text: Fortunately, it doesn't take much to nurse him back to health. He looks angry that you almost killed him, but joins your crew all the same.
Fortunately, it doesn't take much to nurse him back to health. He looks angry that you almost killed him, but joins your crew all the same.

choice.text: (Medical Crew) Give him some medical attention.

event.text: Your crew is easily able to patch up his wounds. He looks angry that you almost killed him, but joins your crew all the same.

His shuttle travels up from the encampment. Being a basic, bare-bones shuttle, it's largely defenseless to your attacks; your ion weapon knocks out his engines completely, causing the shuttle to crash land. You manage to get to it before his allies do, finding a low amount of salvage. Unfortunately, he died in the crash, precluding your ability to recruit him.

His shuttle travels up from the encampment. Being a basic, bare-bones shuttle, it's largely defenseless to your attacks; your ion weapon knocks out his engines completely, causing the shuttle to crash land. Unfortunately, it crashes too close to the encampment, meaning that whatever salvage is waiting down there, it won't be yours to harvest.

Your Leech enters the center, where most of the staff and other trainees pay them absolutely no mind. When your crew returns to the ship, they mention that they couldn't find any opportunity to sabotage the center, but they managed to steal a bunch of stuff.

Your Leech enters the center, where most of the staff and other trainees pay them absolutely no mind. When your crew returns to the ship, they mention that they couldn't find any opportunity to sabotage the station, but they managed to take something from the hangar on their way out.

Your Leech enters the facility. They stumble into the treatment center, and are mistaken for the latest patient. They return to your ship woozy and numb, but they're an Ampere for the foreseeable future.
Your Leech enters the center, but their suspicious behavior immediately trips an alarm. They manage to escape with their life to your ship, but you detect something...
Your Leech enters, but their suspicious behavior eventually trips an alarm. They're unable to escape - and their lifesigns vanish. Looks like you lost a crew member.

removeCrew.text: Your Leech winces as it stumbles out of the Clone Bay. They're not keen on repeating that.

event.text: Your Ampere enters the center, where they're able to blend in with the staff and make their way to the storage. When your crew returns to the ship, they mention that they weren't able to do much, but they're not going to get the climate control in the center working properly for weeks.

Your Ampere enters the center. They don't find an opportunity to leave the hangar, but they do manage to find the hangar armory, where they manage to convince the armory officer that they're here on behalf of a Coalition ship.

Your Ampere enters the center. When they return, another Ampere is accompanying them. You ask your crew how they convinced them to tag along, but the only response you get is that "You wouldn't get it."
A carefully hidden Ampere vessel reveals itself from behind you. It looks like the Republic has stationed a guard at this facility!
A Leech vessel takes off from the surface. It looks like the Republic has stationed a guard at this facility!
The center immediately sends out a call for help, which attracts the attention of a nearby R.U.E.S.!
The center immediately sends out a call for help, which attracts the attention of a nearby Coalition ship!
It appears the prisoners did not survive the fight. There's nothing left for you to do except leave.
It appears most of the prisoners died or were severely injured during the fight. One lone survivor stumbles out of his cell, and with some help is healthy enough to work aboard your ship.

choice.text: (Upg. Clone Bay) Try to save some of the prisoners.

event.text: You manage to get DNA samples from a few of the injured prisoners and enter them into the Clone Bay. After reviving them, they thank you and pay you with what little they managed to sneak with them.

choice.text: (Medical Drone) Try to save some of the prisoners.

event.text: Your medical drone is deployed onto the scene, healing many of the other prisoners. After reviving them, they thank you and pay you with what little they managed to sneak with them.
Many of the prisoners appear to have survived. You'll free them all, but you can likely convince one of them to join your crew.

choice.text: We don't need any more crew.

event.text: You quickly move closer to the construction yard and pull apart some of the ships.
You quickly move closer to the construction yard and pull apart some of the ships. Seems some of them were even outfitted with equipment pre-emptively!

You quickly move closer to the construction yard and pull apart some of the ships. On one of them you even find a Leech engineer, who instead of raising the alarm begs to be taken with you to escape the 'insufferable work environment'.
"An interesssting offer yesss, but we mussst decline. We wisssh to atleassst sstay neutral with the Coalition, and trading with a Federation sssship isss not a good way to achieve thisss."
"Great. We come here to esscape from the Kleptocracy ssshithole and inssstead we run into an angry Renegade freak in the middle of Coalition ssspace. What the hell, man."
You ignore the peaceful Slug ship and do something onboard.
"Ah, well you've made an offer we can't refussse. If there wasss one ssssstereotype of Ssslugssss that alwaysss fitssssss, it'ss our love for trading."
"Wanna know sssomething cool? Thisss was all a dissstraction!" A Coalition ship uncloaks, and the Slug draws his blaster!
"You got an extra sssspacce on your crew? I kinda got booted out of my lassst ssship after I fell assssleep while repairing the life support and asssphyxiated the rest of the crew."
"Ssssweeeet man. You're doing me a real favor here."
"Laaame. Ssssee you never, losssers." He beams away, though you have no idea how.
"Hey man! Not cool. I wassss jussst asking for sssome help, and you gotta do me this way?"
"Ah crap, they found me out!" The saboteur teleports away and a Coalition ship uncloaks, weapons ready!
While plenty of salvage is left for you to collect, little remains of the gasses they were collecting, now released back into the nebula around you.
While salvaging the wreckage, you find a few canisters of the gasses, which you bring aboard. You can probably sell this at a store for a lot of scrap.
The pirate doesn't say anything as you end the call, and doesn't follow when you distance yourself from them.
The pirate stops crying for a moment to glare at you. "Well if you won't be charitable, we'll just take your ship and supplies ourselves!"
The ship you saved was badly damaged in the battle. Most of the crew accepts your offer to be dropped off at a nearby station. One offers to join your crew.
The survivor gets on board the ship.
Apparently the ship that was being assaulted was a transport vessel. They thank you for saving them and offer part of their cargo.
It seems the crew did not survive the assault. You take what you can from the remains of the ship.
They respond, "It's a good thing you came when you did; we'd be dead now otherwise. I'm a shipwright and I'd like to help you like you helped me."

choice.text: The captain offers to install a piece of equipment on your ship.

event.text: "This sector has become increasingly dangerous for the Federation. I think my crew can patch up some of your hull damage as thanks."
"Thhhen thhhhere's no choice... we'll have to join forces." The Scientists look bummed. One of them, resigned, decides to apply for a place on your ship.
After thinking for a moment, the other scientist decides to join you too.

"Fine... we'll have to joi-"
		
		"Thhhey're lying!"
		
		"What? Don't be paranoid."
		
		"We're just being abducted again!" One of them wants to join, but the other is attacking!
They can tell that you are being dishonest. Seeing no other option, one joins you, but the other is entirely non-interactive.
Sensing your dishonesty, they resist your attempt to take them onto your ship. Looks like you blew your chance at a reward.
By some odds, the station does not detect you as you sneak past.

Whether it was because their scanners were too powerful, or their Slug crew detecting your presence doesn't matter, because the station has detected you and raises its weapons. You doubt cloaking will have any effect now that they know exactly where you are.
There's no doubt the station noticed you, but you're long gone before they can do anything about it.
As you try to fly past, your engines immediately halt. They must be using a combat augment to limit your engines! Unable to escape now, you're forced to fight the station.
Your engine system is restored to full power.

The caretaker blinks, trying to process the information you just made up on the fly. "Uhuh... I'm not really sure what you're saying, but it sounds like you know what you're talking about!" The Orchids offer a gift for your 'help'.

"Everything you just said makes no sense. What the hell is a flagmin? A stephalimo? A lombone? Those aren't even real words! They... they don't even sound like they COULD be real! I was asking for real help, not cryptid botany." Frustrated, the Florals mute you and go back to preparing.

The Orchids are grateful for your advice, and offer you their sincerest thanks. "Here, the Confederates gave us a Spore Launcher to help protect ourselves, but so far we haven't had many issues. You can have it instead, it'll probably suit a military vessel better!"

The Orchids are grateful for your advice, and offer you their sincerest thanks. "Here, we were provided with map data for this sector to help us locate other local utilities, but it should come in use for you as well!"
The Orchids are grateful for your advice, and offer you their sincerest thanks. "Unfortunately we don't have too much to offer in ways of physical rewards, but we can provide some spare resources."

You send a team down to look for the Florals. Following their tracks, you eventually find they've set up a camp on the surface and are unconscious, their systems fully intoxicated by premium Confederate liquor. You report back their whereabouts to the terraforming team. "Damn it! I know I'm supposed to be... working with these people, but sometimes these Florals just get on my nerves! Ugh. I guess it's not like I haven't seen Vampweeds get as drunk too, but this is just annoying. Whatever, thanks for your help. I'll send someone to pay you for your time."

While searching for the monks, you find distressing amounts of sap and green blood on the face of some boulders. A little bit further leads you to the scene of several corpses and a Vampweed holding a blaster. "They think they can bring GREENLEAVES into our god damn sectors? Ivar has lost his MIND! The Confederacy is only as strong as it is clean from the taint of those communard zealots!"

choice.text: Leave quickly and report this to the terraformers.

event.text: It's obvious this man is unstable, and sticking around is a bad idea. The terraformers are distraught to hear about the slaughter. "Damn it! I... they're dead? All of them? Jeez, have we really come to this? Murdering unarmed monks on a diplomatic mission? This is going to be a PR nightmare... but thank you for handling this. If our teams had seen this, they might not have been able to control themselves.

choice.text: Try to take down the Vampweed on your own.

event.text: Completely outnumbered, your crew eliminate the madman quickly and easily. You report back your findings to the terraforming team, who are clearly distressed. "Damn it! This is bad... if the news gets out, this could ruin a decade's worth of diplomatic ties! Shit, shit... I wish you hadn't killed him! Taking him to court and making a display out of him might have been the only way to salvage this! Still, I appreciate you trying to help... Just... UGH! Shit, what am I going to do?!"

event.name: VAMPWEED_INJECTION_TEST_FAIL
event.text: A little while later you hear back from the Shell, who is clearly disappointed and upset. "It... it didn't work. Nothhhing happened at all! Thhhhe concentration must be wrong..." Despite the Shell's disappointment, you're just glad to have your crew back alive and well.

"YES! IT WORKED! Hahahah!" With such enthusiasm, you expect your crew to be returning soon. Instead, it appears they died shortly after the experiments began from the neurotoxins. The Shells offer only a slight apology, but are otherwise too caught up in their success to really pay attention to your woes.

removeCrew.text: For some reason, your Clone Bay doesn't seem to be registering your crew member. This must be something on behalf of the Shells, but you can't be certain.

choice.text: Attack the Shells to get revenge!

event.name: VAMPWEED_INJECTION_TEST_FIGHT
event.text: Enraged by the loss of your crew member's life and the Shells' indifference to it, you arm the weapons and attack!

"YES! IT WORKED! Hahahah!" With such enthusiasm, you expect your crew to be returning soon. Instead, it appears they died shortly after the experiments began from the neurotoxins. The Shells offer only a slight apology, but are otherwise too caught up in their success to really pay attention to your woes.

removeCrew.text: For some reason, your Clone Bay doesn't seem to be registering your crew member. This must be something on behalf of the Shells, but you can't be certain.

choice.text: Attack the Shells to get revenge!

The Shells offer only a slight apology, but are otherwise too caught up in their success to really pay attention to your woes.

The Shells offer only a slight apology, but are otherwise too caught up in their success to really pay attention to your woes.

event.text: "YES! IT WORKED! Hahahah!" With such enthusiasm, you expect your crew to be returning soon. Instead, it appears they died shortly after the experiments began from the neurotoxins. The Shells offer only a slight apology, but are otherwise too caught up in their success to really pay attention to your woes.

removeCrew.text: For some reason, your clonebay doesn't seem to be registering your crew member. This must be something on behalf of the Shells, but you can't be certain.

choice.text: Attack the Shells to get revenge!

event.text: The rioters don't even listen to the words coming out of your mouth, and instead turn to shout insults at you. As you stumble back to your ship admist the boos, you find a couple drunken Vampweeds smacking the hull and trying to pry their way inside!

Your attempts to soothe the crowd don't do much more than draw their anger towards you, but it's just enough of a distraction to allow the Zoltans to power up their ship and fly away while local law enforcement swoops in to control the crowds. You're paid for your efforts by the city law enforcement.

"I'M DONE! I'M DONE!" Suddenly, before you can even react, the Zoltan comes crawling out and stands on top of their ship. "I'M DONE! You're right, you're right! The Federation was a mistake! Hahah! Sweet freedom!" The Zoltan leaps into the crowd, where he is beaten until his chassis implodes and the remaining scraps of armor are scavenged from between the piles of bodies scattered in the explosion. It's a gruesome and deranged scene, and certainly not at all what you expected to witness.
		
		Despite the chaos, you're able to take some advantage of the situation and make away with some scrap from the hull of the Zoltan vessel.

You do your best to talk sense into the crowd, but suddenly a bomb goes off near the shipyards where you docked! Pandemonium takes control of the scene and the rioters scramble in all directions, trampling each other. The Zoltan peacekeeper sneaks out of their ship and approaches you. "Please, they'll never accept me back into the Ministry after this. You might be my only chance left to serve the Federation - and more importantly, find some way for the academy to forgive me!"

Your choice to fire on the crowd impresses no one, least of all city law enforcement. The rioters turn even more violent rather than dispersing, and the unprepared city defense rushes in against their better judgement to gain any control they can over the situation. You are asked to leave, "as soon as your last two brain cells can remember how to activate your FTL drive".

Firing on the crowd is certainly the most violent option, but it does force the crowds to disperse - or at least those who still have legs to run away with after being fired upon. Both medical officials and law enforcement arrive to evacuate those injured, and the city leaders aren't too pleased with you. Who is pleased, however, is the Zoltan you just saved. They promise to give a good report about your help to the Ministry and offers some supplies.
The Union ship was carrying a brand new Spore Launcher! You grab the weapon and take it back to the ship.
The Union ship was carrying a Vampweed drone schematic! You grab the schematics and take them back to the ship.
The Union ship's cargo unfortunately doesn't contain anything special. The trade must not have gone through, but you do find extra supplies to take with you.
The Confederate ship was carrying a standard Burst Laser! You grab the weapon and take it back to the ship.
The Confederate ship was carrying a specialized utility weapon! You grab it and take it back to the ship.
The Confederate ship's cargo doesn't contain anything that seems to belong to the Union. The trade must not have gone through, but you do notice some map data and resources to take back with you.

You brainstorm for a few moments and spit out a couple ideas for the Leeches. They appreciate your effort, but none of the ideas satisfy them. Panicking about what fate will await them when they return, they decide to abandon ship and ask if they can come with you.

You brainstorm for a few moments and spit out a couple ideas for the Leeches. "I... I don't think you understand what we're looking for. This is supposed to be a diplomatic mission." The Leech sighs, then rushes off again at high speeds to find a solution - or someone who can come up with a better solution than you.

You brainstorm for a few moments and spit out a couple ideas for the Leeches. "Hm... one of those could work. Yeah... I'm still not sure about this, but anything's better than a bundle of flowers, right?"
Inside the cargo container you find a Spore Launcher! You grab the model and bring it back to your ship.

While searching through the cargo, you're surprised to find a Vampweed hiding in one of the shipping containers! "Wait, wait! Please, don't tell anyone I'm here. I need to get out of this sector - I was a whistleblower that revealed corrupt practices in one of the local corporations, and now they want me dead! I can be useful, please just help me get out of here!"
Inside the cargo you find nothing except extra supplies. Not particularly exciting, but you aren't complaining.
Inside the cargo you find drone schematics for a specialized Vampweed drone. You download them to your ship.

"The Federation has sent assassins to silence me! I knew this day would come! I won't go without a fight!" The Vampweed pushes a button on a remote control device, and an explosion engulfs the building! All but one of your crew make it back, but there's countless casualties inside.

removeCrew.text: Fortunately, your Clone Bay provides insurance against explosions. Your crew member is revived shortly after.

event.text: Your crew barely manage to negotiate with the Vampweed at all. Eventually, talking becomes pointless and they're forced to shoot him, but not before he takes the life of several hostages. It's a terrible situation and the Vampweeds barely even recognize your efforts to help.

Your crew manage to talk the Vampweed into surrendering, but only barely. The situation is still precarious as law enforcement arrives on scene, but the Confederates recognize your efforts and pay you.

"Great work! I'm shocked there was only one drone protecting the area, but I guess the Rebels don't care too much about their Auto-ships, do they? I know I already paid you, but here. Have a drone schematic, on the house."

"Great work! I'm shocked there was only one drone protecting the area, but I guess the Rebels don't care too much about their Auto-ships, do they? I know I already paid you, but here. Have a reactor upgrade, on the house."

The ambassador is a young human woman, likely no older than her early thirties. "Oh thank god, I'm alive. I thought for certain it was only a matter of time before they executed me. This Slug, the one in charge... he was so furious. He called the ones who took me captive reckless. God... people think their actions just don't have consequences anymore, do they? This is the sort of thing that starts wars." 

		She dusts off her shoulders and sighs. "You're the Renegade from Universe 0, if I'm not mistaken. Thank you for your service to the Federation. Please, drop me off at the nearest allied station so I may contact the Federation. In the meantime I'll pull some strings and see if I can help solve some of your pressing concerns..."
Unfortunately, their supposedly valuable cargo doesn't seem to have survived.
Unfortunately, their supposedly valuable cargo doesn't seem to have survived.
Unfortunately, their supposedly valuable cargo doesn't seem to have survived.
You're able to find something in their cargo that survived.

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: You were asked to escort an unprepared vessel to these coordinates.

event.text: You escort the ship to the requested beacon. Much to your dismay you are ambushed by a Rebel ship. You walked right into their trap!

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: You were asked to escort an unprepared vessel to these coordinates.

event.text: Shortly after you arrive, the ship you were escorting jumps nearby. They thank you for your help and offer you a reward.

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: You were asked to escort an unprepared vessel to these coordinates.

event.text: The ship you were escorting thanks you, "I don't think we could have made it without your help. Let my friends patch up some of your hull and show you their wares."

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: You were asked to escort an unprepared vessel to these coordinates.

event.text: You arrive and the ship you were escorting jumps in behind you. "Thanks for the help. We work at a nearby fusion power plant, we could try to improve your reactor's output as a form of compensation."

You take a few careful shots but you expose a mineral patch in the rock that reacts violently with your weapon. A shockwave forces you back as debris pelts against your hull. When you regain control you find there is not much left of the ship.
You fire a few volleys into the rock and it starts to shudder and break apart. Without shields the pirate ship takes a beating but eventually pulls free. They thank you for your assistance.
You decide the pirate is not worth saving and fire a few volleys into their hull causing the ship to depressurize and break apart. You move in to loot the remains.

You decide the pirate is not worth saving and fire a few volleys into their hull. Before you can scrap the remains another pirate ship flashes on your radar. Perhaps they saw your deed, or perhaps they want to claim the spoils for themselves, but for whatever reason, they're charging weapons!
The ship here is no ordinary vessel. It's a massive Rebel carrier! It must have detected you, because its few remaining systems come online and it dispenses a ship to face you.
The ship that crashed appears to be a Federation Dreadnaught! There may still be crew alive, but the ship seems to be in a critical state.

choice.text: There's no saviors aboard your vessel to send over.
It's too late, we should go.

event.text: The ship appears to have once been a Federation carrier, but it's beyond repair. A good section of the hull has collapsed and it's very doubtful anyone survived.

choice.text: We aren't pirates, it would be disrespectful to scrap the ship.

event.text: Your crew returns with a single survivor. It appears the rest of the Federation crew were either killed in the crash or the following inferno.
You watch in horror as the carrier collapses, no doubt burying your crew inside.

removeCrew.text: Luckily your crew is already being cloned and is revived a short time later.

event.text: You are uninterrupted as you salvage the carrier.
It appears one of the Federation Auto-ships onboard is still functional! It detects your attempts at salvaging as hostile and attacks.
A brief exploration yields nothing of interest.
Scans reveal a number of asteroids with useful compositions. You extract some fuel.
You discover the remains of ship embedded into an asteroid. It still has some functional missiles.
You happen upon an abandoned mining site. A few mining drones were left behind and could be repurposed.
The asteroid field proved more dangerous than expected. Some asteroids managed to get through your ship's defenses.
A pirate ship hiding behind one of the larger asteroids attacks you! You're able to escape from the asteroid field, but you can't lose the pirates.
It seems your sensors are no more powerful than the terraformer's. You apologize and continue on your way.
You find if you modulate the feedback signal of your sensors to just the right frequency, you're able to get through the atmosphere and perform a complete scan!

After a complete scan of the planet, you find no life. The team is grateful and ready to get to work. The station scientists have a unique talent for life support units and offer to upgrade your oxygen system as thanks.

A complete scan of the planet reveals no life signs other than a single ship on the surface. The terraformers thank you for your help, and attempt to contact the ship. Just as you're about to jump away, the ship takes off and attacks, it's a pirate!
A complete scan of the planet reveals a simple mold as the only life present. The terraformers claim their terraforming plans are only hindered by intelligent life; they can begin their work.

choice.text: Tell them to stop. Any life is valuable.

event.text: "But our livelihood depends on this job! Who cares about some silly mold? We'll pay you to look the other way!"

choice.text: Offer to pay them to at least delay until the mold can be studied.

event.text: They see reason and accept the offer. The station scientists have a unique talent for life support units and offer to upgrade your oxygen system as an apology for their behaviour.

choice.text: Power your weapons and demand they leave at once.

event.text: They shut off communications, but you can tell they have begun an evacuation procedure.
You spend some time looking around but your scanners cannot pick up any trace of the Rebel ship.
After far too much time spent searching, you are finally able to track him down. You go into the fight pondering just how much of a head start you've lost on the Rebel Fleet...
After a short search you find the Rebel ship. Let's hope he's as easy to defeat in combat as he was to find.
You are able to quickly track down the Rebel. Let's hope he's as easy to defeat in combat as he was to find.
As you hail the freighter, it advances, weapons bristling from its hull! It's a pirate ambush!
As you hail the refugee ship, a Rebel ship jumps into the system... they must have been hunting these refugees, but since you're a Federation ship you've taken higher priority on their list.
As you hail the refugee ship, a Rebel ship jumps into the system... they must have been hunting these refugees, but since you're a Federation ship you've taken higher priority on their list.
As you hail the refugee ship, a Mantis ship jumps into the system... they must have been hunting these civilians but now that they've found you they've changed targets!

The slaver gives you a tour of the cramped dungeon that he considers fit for keeping living things. It's deplorable, but with some scrap, you can free one of these slaves to work for you instead. It's probably a better fate.
You acquire the slave and swifly leave before the slaver decides to pull any form of foul play.
You acquire the slave and swifly leave before the slaver decides to pull any form of foul play.

The slaver gives you a tour of the cramped dungeon that he considers fit for keeping living things. It's deplorable, but with some scrap, you can free one of these slaves to work for you instead. It's probably a better fate.
You acquire the slave and swifly leave before the slaver decides to pull any form of foul play.
You acquire the slave and swifly leave before the slaver decides to pull any form of foul play.

Once you get the cache open, you realize the entire thing is filled with explosives! It's for supplies, of course, but if you had tried to blow it open that would have gone very poorly. You take everything inside.
The cache looks to be filled with batteries and other various reactor parts. You could use these to improve the efficiency of your own reactor!
Looks like the cache is protected by some kind of complicated keypad connected to a bomb. Playing with it is too risky. You leave the cache behind, disappointed.
You open up the cache, only to find a band of malnourished and ravenous pirates trapped inside!
Your missiles detonate... only for the entire cache to explode a split second later! The force is so great it even damages your hull. That cache must have been filled with explosives!
The cache looks to be filled with batteries and other various reactor parts. You could use these to improve the efficiency of your own reactor!

The doors of the cache explode, revealing a band of ravenous pirates locked inside. Now exposed to the vacuum of space, they quickly perish. You shuffle past their lifeless bodies and find an armament inside the cache.

The rest of the civilians, having seen your brutal attack, flee in fear. This won't help improve the public view of Multiverse Renegades, but at least the Federation soldiers were saved. They reluctantly offer you some resources.

It appears your attack drove many of the Civilians to violence, and full-scale fighting has broken out in the streets. One civilian ship with a particularly nasty looking missile launcher tears through your hull, and you pull away quickly.

The civilians are forced to flee as the Federation soldiers take this opportunity to retake the block and drive back the protesters. The whole situation goes over with few casualties, save for the civilians you just murdered. The Federation staff is thankful for your assistance, though disapproving of your methods, and offer some supplies.

You land the vessel right in the middle of the conflict, careful not to squish anyone. Your crew exit and talk over the situation with the protesters. They manage to convince them not to resort to violence, and the crowds slowly dwindle away. The Federation staff seem pleased you were able to resolve the situation peacefully, and provide you a reward for your assistance.

The situation is too chaotic for you to land the ship nearby, so you pilot a short distance away from the main scene of conflict and drop off your crew. They're dragged into what has now descended into full on gun fire, and one of your crew is tagged straight in the chest with blaster fire! You give orders for the rest of the team to head back to the ship immediately.

removeCrew.text: Fortunately your Clone Bay is able to revive your crew member, but you aren't willing to risk sending them back in.

event.text: By the time your crew arrive the situation has already escalated. They manage to rescue one of the Federation staff, a medical unit who was caught in the cross-fire, and bring them back to the ship. Unfortunately, it seems a few of the protesters noticed and have followed you back to the ship!
The Zoltan shouts an insult or two at you, but eventually his ramblings go quiet and the ship jumps away. As far as you can tell, nothing bad has happened from this, and likely never will.

"Then let the curse befall you!" The Zoltan ship jumps away, and is immediately followed by a Rebel ship jumping in! Were the Zoltans working with the Rebels, or is this a pure coincidence? Hard to say, but one thing's for certain. It's time to fight!

"Then let the curse befall you!" The Zoltan ship jumps away, and is immediately followed by a Rebel ship jumping in! Were the Zoltans working with the Rebels, or is this a pure coincidence? Hard to say, but one thing's for certain. It's time to fight!
The Zoltan yells some more obscene nonsense, scoops up the scrap, and jumps away.
The Zoltan scoops up the scrap, and says something prophetic about your good fortune. He jumps away shortly after.
The hack goes off without a hitch. As the checkpoint guards wave you in, the smuggler passes through with you, undetected. "Thanks for the assist, that was going to be a real headache."

Seems like the hack triggered an alarm. Your ship and the smuggler are confronted at the checkpoint. The smuggler manages to escape without paying you, and you get a stern lecture by the checkpoint crew.

You manage to jam their sensors long enough for you to escort the smuggler. As the checkpoint guards wave you in, the smuggler passes through with you, undetected. "Thanks for the assist, that was going to be a real headache."

Seems like they noticed your weapon's activation. Your ship and the smuggler are confronted at the checkpoint. The smuggler manages to escape without paying you, and you get a stern lecture by the checkpoint crew.

Your crew take some time experimenting and working with the faulty shield generator. Eventually, they're able to get to the root of the problem, much to the Zoltan's delight. "All systems are nominal... Great! It should come back on once we jump. Thanks for the help."

Your crew take some time experimenting and working with the faulty shield generator. While they don't get it working, they manage to diagnose it. "Well, I guess it's better than nothing... Now we know what's wrong." They give you a small reward.

Your crew take some time experimenting and working with the faulty shield generator. It momentarily comes to life, then pops. Seems like they only got it partially working. "Well, I guess it's better than nothing... Maybe we can make do with this for now." They give you a modest reward.

Your crew take some time experimenting and working with the faulty shield generator. As one of your crew adjusts something, the generator pops and burns before catching fire. Seems like you completely broke it. "Way to go, jackass. Now we're completely screwed."

Your crew take some time experimenting and working with the faulty shield generator. Try as they might, they have absolutely no idea what's wrong with it. The Zoltans shake their heads. "How did you think you would know what was wrong if we couldn't figure it out...?"

Your drone begins to tinker with the broken shield generator. Before too long, the drone identifies the problem and the generator comes to life. "All systems are nominal... Great! It should come back on once we jump. Thanks for the help."

Your drone begins to tinker with the broken shield generator. It returns a report saying that there is insufficient resources to repair, but prints a readout of how it could be repaired. "Well, I guess it's better than nothing... Now we know what's wrong." They give you a small reward.

Your drone begins to tinker with the broken shield generator. It momentarily comes to life, then pops. The drone prints a readout of the problems that it identified but couldn't fix. "Well, I guess it's better than nothing... Maybe we can make do with this for now." They give you a modest reward.
Before you can express your interest, a Duskbringer hot in pursuit of the slaver ship jumps in and destroys the pirates. They waste no time moving in to destroy you as well!
"Now THAT sure is an unexpected sight. Come aboard captain, see if there's anything that... piques your interests."
"Really?! That's amazing! I wish to come with you, I cannot let this opportunity be passed up to meet actual Renegades!"

You quickly regret your decision when the Duskbringer asks a series of questions about the man that you have no idea how to answer. Eventually he starts to see through your ruse and orders the ship to attack!

You underestimate the Duskbringer guards, thinking you can quickly take them out. However, they're quick to the draw and one of your crew falls to the ground, injured. Fortunately, you're able to silently subdue them before anyone else can get hurt.

removeCrew.text: Fortunately, your crew is revived back at the ship and hurries back to meet up with you.

event.text: Your crew manage to subdue the Duskbringer soldiers silently. You proceed into the building...
This may go down as the quickest reconsideration in Federation history, but it's better safe than sorry.
You order the crew back to the ship, only to find a Duskbringer patrol ship surveying it! Looks like you'll have to take care of these guys before you can leave.
You attempt to break into the prison, but things don't go as planned. A defense system blasts a hole in your ship and soldiers beam aboard before you can pull away!
It's risky, but you manage to brute force your way past the security and make it inside the building.
Your attempt to follow the Rebels is unsuccessful. You're easily spotted, and the ship immediately jumps away.

The Duskbringers aren't having any of your threats. "In case you didn't notice, Renegade, this is OUR territory, and we decide who gets to come and go here! No one threatens the Duskbringers, especially not in our space!"
Startled to see they've been caught, the Duskbringers immediately surrender, forking over some paltry bribe before jumping away.

The monks are so terrified, that they're talking too fast for your translator to even pick up what they're saying. Fortunately, one of the Peacekeepers that was escorting them is holding together slightly more and offers you a reward for saving them.

It seems something malfunctioned in the Life Support of the escort ship, suffocating the entirety of the crew. Left unprotected, the monks have nowhere else to go and beg you to let them come with you.

The rest of the pirates flee, scattering away in different directions as soon as they spot you, but one particularly irate pirate hails you. "A Fed? Get lost! It's hard enough survivin' out here with them explosive nazi freaks, I don't need to deal with you too!"
Surpisingly, none of the pirates move as you approach. One hails you, demanding to know your intentions.
Most of the pirates flee, not wanting to take on a full sized cruiser. One however stays behind, confident in their ability to destroy you.

The pirates whisper amongst each other. You wait for a while and begin to consider leaving before the one who you assume is their leader speaks up. "Alright, we have thought long and hard about it. A little trade doesn't hurt, but the minute we suspect you of anything shifty, we'll blow you to smithereens." You consider it ironic for this to be coming from pirates, but you agree to their terms.

Your team returns, happy to report their mission was a success. Once the oxygen levels are stable enough, the remaining Zoltan crew seek out any Duskbringers who may be onboard and dispose of them. Once all is clear the Zoltan captain thanks you for your assistance and pays you a large reward.

Most of your crew return unharmed, but one did not make it. They report that they ran into Duskbringers on the way and were caught in a firefight. You apologize to the Zoltans for your failure, but there's nothing else you can do.

removeCrew.text: Luckily your crewmember was able to be cloned.

event.text: No matter how much you try, you simply can't open the cache. Whatever is inside shall remain forever a mystery. Or at least until someone with stronger firepower comes by.
No matter how much you try, you simply can't open the cache. Even worse, you've been spotted by a Dynasty ship, which moves in to attack!

You manage to pry open the cache. Inside looks to be some ancient, decayed weapon. It's nothing fancy either, just an older model of any modern weapon. Still, it's a weapon, and its accompanied by some scrap too!
No matter how much you try, the Alpha simply won't listen to you. You give up and apologize, explaining you don't have any other way to help.
You have no idea what you're talking about, but you try to sound as calming as possible. Your second opinion seems to coax the Alpha into submission. The staff of the station offer a paltry reward.
The Phantom merely laughs you off. "This is why we do not seek the help of the Federation for matters such as this."
Before the Ghosts can respond, suddenly the Auto-ship powers on. Looks like the Ghosts didn't do a good job of disabling it... and you'll have to help them or run!

event.name: DYNASTY_UNIQUE_HACKERBID_40_BID
event.text:
No way you're walking away with it still that low. An Engine Jammer does practically the same thing but worse for 45 scrap. The Dynasty raises again.
		Current Price: 40 scrap.

Maybe it's the fierce look in your eyes that tells the Ghosts you aren't giving up, or they just didn't come prepared, because they've quit. The Hackers declare you the winner. "Well then, pay up for your prize!"
The Slugs are furious, and immediately engage! Looks like you aren't getting that augment...

event.name: DYNASTY_UNIQUE_HACKERBID_45_BID
event.text:
You're now matching the price of an Engine Jammer. This is more valuable for sure, but it's quite a lot of scrap nevertheless...
		Current Price: 45 scrap.

Maybe it's the fierce look in your eyes that tells the Ghosts you aren't giving up, or they just didn't come prepared, because they've quit. The Hackers declare you the winner. "Well then, pay up for your prize!"
The Slugs are furious, and immediately engage! Looks like you aren't getting that augment...

event.name: DYNASTY_UNIQUE_HACKERBID_50_BID
event.text:
The Dynasty ship falters, but raises once again.
		Current Price: 50 scrap.

Maybe it's the fierce look in your eyes that tells the Ghosts you aren't giving up, or they just didn't come prepared, because they've quit. The Hackers declare you the winner. "Well then, pay up for your prize!"
The Slugs are furious, and immediately engage! Looks like you aren't getting that augment...

event.name: DYNASTY_UNIQUE_HACKERBID_55_BID
event.text:
The Ghosts are starting to get frustrated, but they won't relent.
		Current Price: 55 scrap.

Maybe it's the fierce look in your eyes that tells the Ghosts you aren't giving up, or they just didn't come prepared, because they've quit. The Hackers declare you the winner. "Well then, pay up for your prize!"
The Slugs are furious, and immediately engage! Looks like you aren't getting that augment...

event.name: DYNASTY_UNIQUE_HACKERBID_60_BID
event.text:
This time the Dynasty ship doesn't even have a chance before one of the pirates in the background raises instead. Looks like the bidding will keep going.
		Current Price: 60 scrap.

Maybe it's the fierce look in your eyes that tells the Ghosts you aren't giving up, or they just didn't come prepared, because they've quit. The Hackers declare you the winner. "Well then, pay up for your prize!"
The Slugs are furious, and immediately engage! Looks like you aren't getting that augment...
"Then you are of no use to us. Furthermore, you are trespassing on Dynasty territory, and must be removed."

"Federation vessel registered entering combat proximity. Forwarding data collection to Ministry." Guess your crime won't go unnoticed by the Zoltans, but they're too far away right now to do anything about it. First, you have to take out this Auto.
"Your methods are efficient, I shall give you that. Do not expect a reward however, for thou still are trespassing in a realm which is most displeased to host you."

"You put up a convincing argument. Is it common for individuals like you to speak volumes louder with actions rather than words? I would scoff had I not a gun pointed to my head. Take this money, you barbarian."
"Your methods are efficient, I shall give you that. Do not expect a reward however, for thou still are trespassing in a realm which is most displeased to host you."

"You put up a convincing argument. Is it common for individuals like you to speak volumes louder with actions rather than words? I would scoff had I not a gun pointed to my head. Take this money, you barbarian."

"I most often discard the mercenaries I first hire to do dirty work, but I admire your willingness to cooperate. Though my superiors would cry to the heavens at this sin, I shall slide you a parcel of scrap in exchange for your efforts."

As soon as it's clear that your intentions are anything but helping them, the rogue Dynasty ship turns hostile, trying to fight their way past! For some reason, the other ship isn't helping you, but instead sits back to watch the battle. Cowards.
Looks like the deserters have already given up. They hardly even protest as they are handed over to the other ship. The loyal Dynasty ship thanks you, and offers a reward.

As soon as it's clear that your intentions are anything but helping them, the chasing Dynasty ship turns hostile, trying to fight their way past! For some reason, the other ship isn't helping you, but instead sits back to watch the battle. Cowards.
You quickly usher the Ghost crew aboard, and by some miracle it appears you weren't spotted. You quickly fly away with your new crew aboard.

"T-thanks. Those gas bastards were chanting something about me being a demon maker or something like that. I would be dead if it wasn't for you. My training tells me I should shoot you right now... but I feel like that training is wrong."
