"T-thanks. Those gas bastards were chanting something about me being a demon maker or something like that. I would be dead if it wasn't for you. My training tells me I should shoot you right now... but I feel like that training is wrong."

Looks like the victim was just some civilians. "Thanks for the help. Is nowhere safe anymore? I chose to come here over a trip through the Hive, but it might have been safer the other way around. My ship is ruined. I think I'll come with you."
Looks like the ship was little more than a damaged Auto. Beyond the point of repair, it's best just to scrap it.

It appears the Dynasty ship's victim was a Rebel vessel! They put on a tough appearance, but it's clear to you that they're thankful. It's not hard convincing them to lie to the fleet about your location.
The ship transfers over the map data to your ship's computer.
The ship transfers over the map data to your ship's computer.

You briefly inspect the map but are confused as to what you're seeing. The data is warbled, and in many spots it's obviously incorrect. You doubt they intentionally scammed you, but this data is worthless!
"What! Those maps are perfectly fine. We aren't refunding you for perfectly good data!"
You arm the weapons and prepare to force the refund out of them, one way or another.

choice.text: (Mind Control) 'Convince' them to give a full refund.

event.text: "You are right. These are bad maps. You deserve your money back. I am very ashamed of myself. Boo hoo."

choice.text: (Mind Control Weapon) 'Convince' them to give a full refund.

event.text: "You are right. These are bad maps. You deserve your money back. I am very ashamed of myself. Boo hoo."
You fire everything you have, but the crystal barrier remains strong. After a time you give up and move on.
You fire everything you have, but the crystal barrier remains strong. After a time you give up and move on.
Against all odds, a lucky shot strikes an existing fracture in the crystal, compounding it into a crack that grows until an entire section of the barrier falls away!

choice.text: Unfortunately for you, luck cannot change the fact that you have no one to send to investigate the cache.

event.text: You ignore the cache and do something onboard the ship.
On arriving at the base of the crater, your team discovers a long-forgotten weapons cache. Most of the equipment is out of action, but not all of it!
Your away team is greeted at the crater by the owners of the cache, who are none too happy. You grab what you can and run back to the ship, but not before they teleport aboard!

You send a crewmember down to check out the cache. The comm goes dead, and shortly thereafter massive gravity readings are detected on the asteroid. You must have triggered some kind of singularity booby trap! We've got to leave now before we're pulled in!

You push the impulse engines to their limit and are able to break out of the gravity well. Your crewmember, along with the stockpile, is reduced to the size of a tennis ball - but you're left in one piece.

removeCrew.text: Luckily, your Clone Bay is able to revive your crewmember.

choice.text: Detonate your entire fuel reserves to escape with your crew and the cargo.

event.text: You swoop into the heart of the distortion and pick up your crewmember and the cargo. You then eject your FTL fuel and ignite it, sending a shock wave that thrusts your ship well beyond the event horizon of the singularity. That was close.

choice.text: (Upg. Teleporter) Beam your crewmember back on board.

event.text: You floor the engines to escape the gravity well while trying to get a teleporter lock on your crewmember despite the massive interference. You're barely able to get them back on board before the entire area is consumed into the singularity.

choice.text: (Adv. Engines) Rescue your crewmember and the cargo.

event.text: You swoop into the heart of the distortion and pick up your crewmember and the cargo. Your top of the line impulse engines are barely able to get your ship out of the gravity well before the whole ship is consumed. That was close.
"Very well, a payment in kind. I have these explosives that emulate our race's innate ability. Perhaps that would interest you."
"Very well, a payment in kind. I have an extra ship weapon laying around here somewhere. Perhaps you could make use of it?"

After a short time the scientist returns, "We... must regret... we have made a grave miscalculation. Your bodies are considerably more fragile than we expected and your companion is... broken. We apologize and offer a fine military-grade weapon as consolation."

removeCrew.text: You accept their apology and decide it's better not to mention that your Clone Bay is in the process of reviving the lost crewmember.

event.text: Your crewmember is brought on board their station and forced to undergo a few quick scans and tests. "Thank you for this opportunity! We hope to learn much from your kind." They transfer some supplies as payment.

The large Crystalline Beings escort your crew onto the station and gingerly help them into a scanning chamber. After a few seconds, they inform you they have mapped their entire genome and have everything they need. They give you a schematic as compensation.
"I see. That is a shame. Perhaps the next aliens we meet will have some respect for the advancement of science."
"I see. That is a shame. Perhaps the next aliens we meet will have some respect for the advancement of science."
"I see. That is a shame. However we must not let this opportunity pass us by. Submit and you will be treated reasonably well!" A military ship docked nearby detaches and charges you.

You speak at length about nothing particularly interesting. "Wow, thanks. Oh look, another alien ship! I wonder if they're as nice as you." Seeing the Rebel decals you doubt they're friendly. They spot you and move in to attack, while the Crystalline civilian jumps away.

You speak at length about nothing particularly interesting. "Wow, thanks! I don't know if this is of any use to you, but we have some supplies we can offer you. Perhaps you can use them on your trip!"
You speak at length about nothing particularly interesting. "Wow, thanks! Perhaps we can fix up a bit of your hull for sating my curiosity. We're pretty handy with repairs."
"What... is the name of the Mantis queen?"
"What... is the name of the grand Orchid Gardens?"

choice.text: (Orchid Crew) The answer is Rt'lak Et.

event.text: "What... is the name of the Zoltan religion?"

choice.text: The Church of the Great Eye.

event.text: You contact the Crystalline ship to hear, "We never should have returned. All around us, there is war and chaos. Do not speak to us again." They cut communications.
The Crystalline ship messages you, "You are among the Federation, yes? It was one of you bastards who opened the jump beacon in the first place!" They quickly jump away.
You contact the other ship, "Thank you for your assistance. It's good to know that not all of you foreigners are so barbaric. Take this as a reward."
The Crystalline ship hails you, "It's a good thing you came when you did. We appreciate the assistance. Please take this for your help."

The Crystalline ship messages you, "Thank you. We were not prepared for the savagery with which you aliens battle. We will give you one of our weapons if you intend on assisting our kind in the future."
"Thank you! We were sent here to try and recruit some Crystals to the Federation cause. We had no idea we would be received so poorly..." They transfer some excess materials for your trouble.
The ship looks battered and ready to break apart. You quickly move in to help rescue the survivors, but it looks like only one person made it. They offer to join your crew as thanks.
Unable to interpret it themselves, the Crystalline beings assume your data will mean something to the Rebels. It should see the pursuing fleet taking a leisurely cruise before they get back on track.
They take one look at your fake telemetry and realize what you've done. They apparently do not take being lied to well - they immediately attack!

event.name: CRYSTAL_REQUEST_CONVINCE_SUCCESS
event.text: The sight of one of their own kind on your ship seems to reassure them. Seemingly convinced you have their interests at heart, they agree to mislead the Rebel fleet and hand you a small sum of scrap as well. This should give you some extra breathing room.

Your Crystal tries to convince them of the importance of your mission. They seem sympathetic, but decline your requests. "Your crewmember may speak the truth, but I wonder if they have seen just what the Rebellion has done here. Though perhaps this small gesture may help you in leaving this sector behind, hopefully taking that accursed fleet with them. May your travels here be safe."

No matter how you try, you're not able to make a dent. Unfortunately, the fire starts to go out of control - it is too late. The sick Crystals can't escape the inferno. There's nothing more to do here.
Eventually you break through the lockdown, but by the time you do, most of the patients have died. The Crystals are appreciative, but it's clear that they are grieving for the ones that passed.

Your crew are able to find a weak point in the crystals and break through before the fire spreads. All of the patients are able to be rescued. "Whew. That was a close one. Thank you for saving the clinic. Unfortunately, the patient in question will still be difficult to treat in their current condition..."

choice.text: (Upg. Medbay) Offer to treat the lock-down prone patient.

event.text: While you were fighting the Crystals, the Vagabonds seem to have taken the time to escape. There's nothing else you can do here.
The Vagabonds seem to have waited around for you. "We cannot express the depth of our gratitude!" One of their number pledges to join your cause.
The Vagabonds seem to have waited around for you. "We cannot express the depth of our gratitude!" They offer you a weapon... although it looks like it has seen better days.
As you hail the refugee ship, a Crystal ship suddenly jumps into the system... it's clear the Crystals don't approve of their presence in this sector, and they don't approve of yours either!

You hail the outpost and deliver the bomb. The Crystals inside are deeply confused, but not long after Zoltan reinforcements jump in! It seems you've misunderstood - the Zoltans were here to attack the Crystals! The peace-keeper vessel approaching seems to think you're working against them and attacks!

You hail the outpost and deliver the bomb. It appears you understood correctly, because the Crystals thank you. Whatever attacked the Zoltans must have been a pirate, probably using the Crystal weapons so commonly found around here. As thanks for finishing the delivery, the Crystals pay you handsomely.

You sneak into the outpost and place the bomb where it looks like it'll cause the most damage, then detonate it from a distance. It has a disastrous effect, and the Crystals are obviously not pleased. You hear them shouting, "Damn it, pirates must have taken out the envoy, and now they're attacking us too! Prepare for battle!" It seems you've misunderstood the Zoltan's intentions.

You sneak into the outpost and place the bomb where it looks like it'll cause the most damage, then detonate it from a distance. It has a disastrous effect, and the Crystals are obviously not pleased. But before they can send a ship to defend themselves, Zoltan reinforcements jump in and destroy their hangar, forcing the Crystals to surrender. The Zoltans recognize your help, and extend a reward.

"Isn't it so! I see you are beings with an eye for true beauty as I am. While I cannot bear to part with this magnificent creature, I wish to offer a token of my respect. My crew do not share the same appreciation that I do and are waiting impatiently in our ship. Perhaps they will serve your mission better."

"Isn't it so! I see you are beings with an eye for true beauty as I am. While I cannot bear to part with this magnificent creature, I wish to offer a token of my respect. Seeing that I will no longer require my equipment in search of a more beautiful place, please help yourselves to some of my tech."

"So these are fools who refuse to acknowledge true beauty! Hah, you aliens are as uncultured as you are barbaric. I do not wish to preside with you much longer, for I have a better companion. Isn't that right, my dear?" The Crystal goes back to gazing fondly at the pond. You decide to leave this weirdo behind.

"So these are fools who refuse to acknowledge true beauty! Hah, you aliens are as uncultured as you are barbaric. I now consider it my duty to rid the galaxy of such dirty foreigners. I'll be back in a moment, my sweet!"

"What?? How dare you say such a thing! I shall show you the true form of the creature!" You expect the Crystal to attack, but instead he dives into the pond, attempting to "bring up the creature". A few minutes pass, and all of a sudden an Orchid taps you on your back. It seems they just appeared out of nowhere and have no recollection of their past, but they seem to be willing to work for you if it means they won't be stuck behind on this planet.
The Federation officer is thankful for your assistance.
As the human comes onto your ship, he draws a laser and shoots at you. Luckily, no one is hit, but a Rebel ship uncloaks nearby and attacks. It was a trap!
The other ships do not dignify your demands with a response.
The ships stop for a moment, and send you over a small tribute of materials. They seem too preoccupied to pay you any more attention.
The smuggler puts his hands up. "Okay, okay! Let's not get hasty! Surely a discerning Renegade like yourself would be amenable to an understanding. Perhaps you see something you like in my stock?"

choice.text: Take a free legal weapon off their hands.

event.text: "You have no eye for quality, Renegade. Even so, we appreciate your discretion."
"You're as shrewd as you are reasonable, Renegade. Pleasure doing business with you."
"Then you leave me no choice! Prepare to die!"
The smuggler screams, "Narcs get what they deserve! Prepare to die!" Meanwhile, the Federation ship makes a hasty retreat.
The Federation warms its weapons up. "You think you can just threaten my career and get away with it? I'll never give in!"
The smuggler is nowhere to be found. You radio the nearest Federation base and let them know that there is a smuggler on the loose.
You chase down the smuggler. "You law-abiding Federation types are scary! Please don't kill us!" You escort the smuggler to the nearest Federation base, where you are rewarded.
You attempt to transmit your ID to the ship, in hopes it will still be able to distribute supplies. However, it seems to struggle identifying your ship, and suddenly attacks!
Luckily, though the drone is heavily damaged, it is still able to scan your Federation ID and transmit some supplies.
While salvaging the drone, it suddenly turns hostile and attacks!
The drone remains mostly unresponsive. Its weapons even come online, but it remains unable to fire.

"That's.. hardly more fitting. Bah, what's even the point nowadays? I suppose this shows that as a civilization we've moved on and adapted terms as we see fit, as warfare itself took a new form and adapted in return. By obsessing on the past I came to forget our present rules... Here, take this for trying."
You point at one of the ships at random and accuse them of being the Rebel. No time to think, now is time for action!
You point at one of the ships at random and accuse them of being the Rebel. No time to think, now is time for action!
Your Defense Drone lands a glancing blow, but it's no use - the pod is too strong. You'll have to fight all of the crew that are boarding!
Your Defense Drone's first shot staggers one of the pods, and its second shot manages to knock it away, sending the boarding pod off course. You'll still have to deal with the other pod!
Your Defense Drone lands a glancing blow, but it's no use - the pod is too strong. You'll have to fight all of the crew that are boarding!
Your Defense Drone's first shot staggers one of the pods, and its second shot manages to knock it away, sending the boarding pod off course. You'll still have to deal with the other pods!
Your Defense Drone lands a glancing blow, but it's no use - the pod is too strong. You'll have to fight all of the crew that are boarding!
Your Defense Drone's first shot staggers one of the pods, and its second shot manages to knock it away, sending the boarding pod off course. You'll still have to deal with the other pods!

You draw your blaster and shoot the Duskbringer in the chest. Completely unprepared for a silent ambush, he dies before he can even activate his explosive vest. The guards on the side join in the fight, and you manage to clear out the Duskbringers surprisingly quickly. With the threat handled, the embassy staff pay you handsomely for your help.

The sudden reveal of your presence puts the Duskbringers offguard - but only momentarily. Before they can harm the hostages however, you put your hands in the air to show you don't intend to attack, at least not yet. The Duskbringer leader laughs and spreads his arms wide. "Well would you look at this! A Renegade clown has decided to come and entertain us today! Tell me, gunslinging brute, what words of wisdom do you wish to share with us?"

choice.text: Your ideologies are evil and go against everything a once better galaxy worked towards!

event.text: "To claim our ideologies are evil merely proves you fail to understand the goal of the Duskbringer movement! A simple minded Renegade cannot comprehend such a grandiose picture. We are those who work towards a better galaxy. If not us, then who else is?" The Zoltan smiles, despite the fact he never bothered to explain what grand picture he claims to represent. The message however is clear - he isn't going to relent.

choice.text: If you claim to be Zoltan supremacists, then why are you endangering the lives of so many of your kind?

event.text: There's a brief pause while the Duskbringer ponders this, but he seems to think he's come up with a clever response. "The nature of our movement is that we stand to make room for the superior lifeforms in this galaxy - to give them their rightful place. It is a fact that more often than not, the Zoltans are who possess these superior characteristics, but that is not to say ALL Zoltans do. Those we have found in this unholy temple of false peace have betrayed their species to work hand in hand with lesser beings, thus becoming lesser themselves." The Duskbringer smiles smugly, having dismantled your argument. It crosses your mind you don't actually need to win this intellectual war - you just need to distract him long enough that he drops his guard.

choice.text: But who can truly decide which beings are and are not superior? What makes you the judge?

event.text: "Hmph. We are the judges because we are the only ones willing to take action. If the galaxy could have made this shift sooner, then there would be no need for the Duskbringers at all. The galaxy should have already accepted the Zoltans as the superior race - we have the better tech, the better culture, and the better minds. Sure, there are species who are stronger, or better adapted to certain environments - but there is a place for them in our new galaxy. It just won't be at the top. But only the Duskbringers can see this."

choice.text: So you aren't judges at all - just radicals who've jumped the gun.

event.text: "WE ARE NOT RADICALS!" The Duskbringer pushes his fellow men aside and storms towards you. "HOW DARE YOU INSULT OUR MOVEMENT! Radicals are people who cannot support their ideology with facts, and so they resort to extreme measures! Nothing about the Duskbringers is extreme or unsupported. We are millions strong and growing, and our methods harm no one but those directly opposed to us. You are nothing but Renegade filth, who are you to say such things? You don't know politics, you don't know-" The Zoltan is cut off by abrupt gun-fire, as the guards open fire while the Duskbringers are distracted. The Duskbringers are wiped out before they can go for the hostages, and the embassy staff seem to recognize your help and offer a reward.

choice.text: Your tech is recycled from ruins, your minds are certainly not superior, and there is no metric for a better culture.

event.text: "All of our tech is lifted from the shoulders of our ancestors - our entire multiverse is built on the ruins of some ancient empire. What matters is we Zoltan were the ones able take advantage of it. Who else do you see with hard-light shielding, or mind uploading? And our minds are most surely superior, in that they are well rounded. A Shell may have a greater capacity for scientific understanding, but they fail to grasp diplomacy or philosophical matters. And as for culture - I simply think you lack any culture at all." The Zoltan chuckles at his own joke. It seems you've failed to put him off-guard, and unfortunately you're out of responses.

choice.text: That's just stupid! Clearly you're inferior for thinking such things.

event.text: "And so the battle of wits is short-lived! It's a shame, but I will take your need to resort to petty insults as an admission to your own defeat."

choice.text: Pick your nose and pretend you don't get it.

event.text: You stand there silently, making no movements at all except to pick at your nose and scratch your rear. The Duskbringer seems entirely confused by this. "Uhm... are you listening to me? Did your brain turn off or something?" You continue to say nothing, staring blankly forward. More of the Duskbringer group start murmuring with each other, all together utterly baffled by what they're witnessing. This gives the guards just enough time to rush in and take control of the situation. The Duskbringers are wiped out before they can go for the hostages, and the embassy staff seem to recognize your help and offer a reward.

The staff of the Embassy try to congratulate you on stopping the Duskbringers, but you ignore them and continue to gaze off into the distance. You do it for so long you forget why you were even there, and eventually your crew have to drag you back to the ship. The Zoltans are confused but deliver you a reward anyways.

choice.text: If you let these citizens go, we'll give you all a free cookie.

event.text: "While it is tempting... I'm going to have to turn down your offer." The Zoltan snickers. "A cookie, really? THAT's the best you can offer? Wow. That's kind of sad."

choice.text: I forgot what I was going to say.

event.text: The Duskbringer blinks, unsure of how exactly he wants to insult you. Instead, he just laughs. "You are truly the most pathetic thing I have ever seen. Renegades must have the collective IQ equal to the number of Mantis who can spell the word 'idiot'."

After a few moments of skepticism, the Federation relents and lets you harvest the ship in peace. Though not much remains, you find some usable equipment, and a small helping of scrap for your troubles.

"Hmph. You're still taking the remains, you Renegade vulture." They back off, letting you harvest the ship. Though not much remains, you find some usable equipment, and a small helping of scrap for your troubles.
"Sorry about that. Some Renegades aren't so well behaved. I'll help you out." Though not much remains, you find some usable equipment, and a small helping of scrap for your troubles.

"Well, if you were responsible for this, I'm sure we'd already be fighting. Let me give you a hand." Though not much remains, you find some usable equipment, and a small helping of scrap for your troubles.
"A likely story! Word has it that some Renegades will harvest any ship unlucky enough to cross paths with them. You'll pay for this!"

choice.text: Point out that due to game mechanics, you are unable to fight two ships at a single beacon.

event.text: The Federation ship immediately stops its aggression and apologizes. "I'm such an idiot. Why don't you just take the harvest, a little extra scrap and we both forget this ever happened?"

You shake the human awake. He coughs, then stands up. "T-thanks. I... I was working as a Federation spy, but the Free Mantis attacked the Rebel ship I was working on and killed my crew, then took me hostage. I can't thank you enough for saving my life." You don't have time to talk further because the Mantis are already upon your ship!
The Human pushes you off of him, and you notice for the first time his Rebel uniform. He thanks you reluctantly. He's too injured to fight, so you leave him and focus on the boarders.

"In... in all my years, I've never seen anyone do what you just did, rescuing a complete stranger and putting your entire ship at risk. I... I feel ashamed for what I've done to your Federation brothers now. Please, let me serve your crew."

The Rebel captain tries to act indifferent, but you can tell he's grateful. "I suppose I am in your debt now. You are still my enemy, but I am an honorable man. I will give the fleet false information, it should delay them for some time."
The Rebel captain backs away from you. "Federation scum, this changes nothing. I don't know why you did this, but I don't care. Release me, or suffer the wrath of the Rebellion!"
"Excellent choice!" Your crew call you insane, but you drop him off at the nearest station unharmed. You know he'll report your position to the fleet, but you aren't savages.
You draw your laser and shoot the helpless captain. His lifeless body hits the floor, and you drag him to the airlock and send him flying out into the abyss. All of that for nothing then.
It doesn't take long before your hopes at stealth are shattered as one of the larger ships catches you and attacks!

You wait. You wait some more. You find yourself startled awake by the sounds of gunfire. You were waiting so long a Rebel patrol ship has found you. The Free Mantis assume you must have been there to defend them, and are providing fire support.
Your waiting pays off, and eventually all that's left is one small Free Mantis scout. You move in to attack.

The Free Mantis are reluctantly willing to surrender. They hand over their cargo. As they fly away, you catch them yelling over the comms, "Damn you! We never forget this. We thought you were allies, but now we see truth."
The Free Mantis refuse to surrender. You have no choice but to keep fighting.
The cargo is a standard shipment of ammunition and a bomb launcher.
The cargo contains some additional scrap.
The cargo contains a drone and some additional drone parts.

Strange scratching noises come from inside the cargo. Your crew draw their guns and you slowly open the cargo. A Mantis soldier climbs out, gasping for breath. He explains that he was taken as a prisoner, but he never had an interest in fighting the Free Mantis. Now free from both his captors and the Hive, he is willing to join your crew and start a new life.
As you pry open the cargo, you hear a strange ticking noise. Luckily all of your crew manage to get out of the way in time, but it appears the Free Mantis trapped the cargo before handing it over!
The cargo is a standard shipment of ammunition and a bomb launcher.
The cargo contains some additional scrap.
The cargo contains a drone and some additional drone parts.

Strange scratching noises come from inside the cargo. Your crew draw their guns and you slowly open the cargo. A Mantis soldier climbs out, gasping for breath. He explains that he was taken as a prisoner, but he never had an interest in fighting the Free Mantis. Now free from both his captors and the Hive, he is willing to join your crew and start a new life.
The cargo is a standard shipment of ammunition and a bomb launcher.
The cargo contains some additional scrap.
The cargo contains a drone and some additional drone parts.

Strange scratching noises come from inside the cargo. Your crew draw their guns and you slowly open the cargo. A Mantis soldier climbs out, gasping for breath. He explains that he was taken as a prisoner, but he never had an interest in fighting the Free Mantis. Now free from both his captors and the Hive, he is willing to join your crew and start a new life.
It appears the cargo didn't survive the fight. There's little worth value to collect other than some scattered fuel cells.
You slip away quickly, still unnoticed. You won't have time to do anything on the ship, and should jump away as soon as possible.
You try to fly away, but a single Rebel ship from the crowd notices you.
The civilians are grateful. They all chip in together to pay you a sum of scrap for saving them.
The civilians are grateful, but their Free Mantis protector is especially so. They hail you in private. "I not lie... protecting civilians, not much fun. I suppose helping you, much better!"

It appears the civilian ships are in worse condition than you thought. The Free Mantis thanks you, but there is little to do to save the few survivors. They give you some extra fuel for your troubles.
"Yyyyou not speak word of sense. Stupid creature, unlike me! Out of my ship, not worthy... *hick* being here."

It appears the Free Mantis are still sober enough to understand. "You... *hick* speak much sense. Man of science! Smart, llllike me! I feel generous, and you save life. Have... this fuel..." He orders his crew to give you some fuel and scrap and then falls unconscious.
The Free Mantis refuse, but generously give back the scrap. "We cannot let you on. Sorry for refusal, but requesting you please stop trying."
"You are making convincing offer... we take this, and let you dig up weapon. Only from bad person though, who probably deserve it..."

"Big gratitude for Renegade! Was attacked by purple ship... Evil ghosts no match for Free Mantis! Had something, you want?" The Free Mantis give you a piece of salvage from the ship that attacked them.

"Big gratitude for Renegade! Was attacked by broken Zoltan ship... Evil ghosts no match for Free Mantis! Had something, you want?" The Free Mantis give you a piece of salvage from the ship that attacked them.

"Big gratitude for Renegade! Was attacked by broken Engi ship... Evil ghosts no match for Free Mantis! Had something, you want?" The Free Mantis give you a piece of salvage from the ship that attacked them.

"Big gratitude for Renegade! Was attacked by broken Hive ship... Evil ghosts no match for Free Mantis! Had something, you want?" The Free Mantis give you a piece of salvage from the ship that attacked them.
You start taking apart the outer hull when there's banging on your doors. You have little time to react until a swarm of Mantis overtake your ship, killing one of your crew.

removeCrew.text: Dazed but alive, your cloned crew stumbles out of the Clone Bay and prepares to defend.

event.text: Nothing disturbs you as you loot the ship. There are corpses of Mantis everywhere, but nothing alive.
As you're in the midst of taking apart the outer hull, a Free Mantis ship of the same clan jumps nearby. They spot you and waste no time avenging their fallen clan members.

Disappointingly, you find nothing inside the pod besides a few missiles. Looks like this was a weapon cache, although for whom you can't be sure because it's been almost entirely emptied. Satisfied that at least it wasn't boobytrapped, you cut your losses and leave.

You crack open the pod only to find a starving crew of pirates inside! This appears to once have been a pirate weapon cache, but after getting sealed inside, the betrayed crew has turned to ferocious cannibalistic rage and attacks you!

You crack open the pod and find a scattered array of weapons and other haphazard equipment. Seems this pod was repurposed by pirates as a weapon cache. It's fortunately unguarded, so you decide to take whatever you can carry.
While exploring the planet you find the remains of a crashed Coalition ship, but there seems to be no survivors. You report the news back to the Orchids and they thank you for your assistance.

While exploring the planet, you come across a crashed Coalition ship! The last surviving crew member flashes several SOS signals, trying to get your attention. They claim to have been harmlessly passing through the sector when they were shot down by Gathering security and left for dead on this barren planet. They're desperate for rescue - so desperate that they're even willing to work for you.

choice.text: Accept them on board and sneak past the Florals.

event.text: Lying won't do you any good here once they find the ship, so the only option once you've recruited the Coalition member is to fly away and hope the Orchids aren't too bothered.

choice.text: Report their location to the Florals.

event.text: You ignore the SOS message and return to the scout, reporting the news. "Ah, I guess that's better than a whole operation. I'll call for backup and have law enforcement pick them up soon. They'll determine if that 'harmlessly passing through' story is true and decide what to do from there. Thank you for the help."

Sure enough, it seems a Coalition base of operations has been covertly set-up on the other side of the planet. As soon as you enter scanning range, they deploy an armed craft to dispose of you before you can reveal their location!
Scans of the planet reveal no signs of the Coalition, save for a single crashed ship with no apparent survivors. You report the news back to the Orchids and they thank you for your assistance.

While scanning the planet, you discover a crashed Coalition ship! The last surviving crew member flashes several SOS signals, trying to get your attention. They claim to have been harmlessly passing through the sector when they were shot down by Gathering security and left for dead on this barren planet. They're desperate for rescue - so desperate that they're even willing to work for you.

choice.text: Accept them on board and sneak past the Florals.

event.text: Lying won't do you any good here once they find the ship, so the only option once you've recruited the Coalition member is to fly away and hope the Orchids aren't too bothered.

choice.text: Report their location to the Florals.

event.text: You ignore the SOS message and return to the scout, reporting the news. "Ah, I guess that's better than a whole operation. I'll call for backup and have law enforcement pick them up soon. They'll determine if that 'harmlessly passing through' story is true and decide what to do from there. Thank you for the help."

Your scans reveal the location of a Coalition base, just as the Florals predicted. The base has only one active fighter vessel, but you doubt you'd be able to take the whole base down on your own without some serious firepower.
You might not be able to take out the base, but you can at least assist in reducing their firepower. You lock onto the Coalition vessel and jump into action!

choice.text: Set an explosive device to cripple the base. [-15}]

event.text: The heavy payload you set creates a gigantic explosion, destroying the whole left wing of the base! The ship guarding it is also heavily damaged, and the Coalition staff are forced to evacuate. You report back to the Orchids, who call in immediate backup to arrest the spies. You're rewarded tremendously for your assistance.

choice.text: Report the base back to the Orchids.

event.text: The Florals are thankful for your assistance, although highly alarmed at the presence of the base. "It's the Weedlings, trying to join the Coalition! It's given them justification to start spying on us to try and win those swampland bastards over! Hopefully once we report this to command, they'll file a request for Federation support."
"A good choice. May it serve you well in your travels!"
"A good choice. May it serve you well in your travels!"
"A good choice. May it serve you well in your travels!"
"A good choice. May it serve you well in your travels!"
"A good choice. May it serve you well in your travels!"
"A good choice. May it serve you well in your travels!"
"A good choice. May it serve you well in your travels!"
"A good choice. May it serve you well in your travels!"
"A good choice. May it serve you well in your travels!"
"A good choice. May it serve you well in your travels!"
"A good choice. May it serve you well in your travels!"
"A good choice. May it serve you well in your travels!"

event.name: ORCHID_MEGATREE_TALK_SUCCESS
event.text: Your Orchid manages to convince the guards of the utmost importance of your mission. They sanction you to send crew down to dig up the weapon, so long as you cause no damage to the tree.

event.name: ORCHID_MEGATREE_TALK_FAIL
event.text: The guards refuse to grant you access to the weapon.

choice.text: Ignore them and dig for it anyways.

event.text: You attempt to land near the base of the tree, but an Orchid guard stops you, furious that you dare try to harm the tree.

You sneak aboard the transport ship and escort the Orchid back to your ship. He thanks you generously, but doesn't seem to want to talk about why he was detained. Fortunately, no one spots the rescue and you leave without a hitch.

You sneak aboard the transport ship and escort the Orchid back to your ship. On the way however, you're spotted and the Orchids open fire! The Floral you're escorting is caught in the crossfire and your crew barely make it back alive in time to fight the now enraged escort!

You sneak aboard the transport ship and escort the Orchid back to your ship. On the way however, you're spotted and the Orchids open fire! Fortunately, all of your crew, including the Orchid you're escorting, make it back alive in time to fight the now enraged escort!

As you sneak aboard the ship to rescue the criminal, you notice it's not actually a Floral you're rescuing but rather a Vampweed! "Thank you, I was just a merchant passing through and they arrested me because of my red petals!" You nod and hurry back to the ship, but unfortunately you're caught by security and are going to have to fight your way out!

The Orchid vessel took significant damage prior to your fight, but the crew are still alive. With hasty sign language, the Orchids thank you for your help. "I made a terrible mistake, and joined a capitalist cell trying to convince the Gathering to pull back its communist policies. Now, I feel like I'm being followed everywhere I go! Please, take me with you. I can't stay here anymore!"

The vessel seems to have received heavy damage, and unfortunately their crew didn't survive the fight. Although you'll never know why the mercenaries were tracking them now, you suppose they won't be needing their scrap any longer.
Unfortunately, the Orchids seem to have jumped away during the fight. You're a bit disappointed and a little angry, but you can't exactly blame them for taking the opportunity.
"Thanks for your purchase! May your paths be blessed by whatever stupid plant god these things believe in!"
"Thanks for your purchase! May your paths be blessed by whatever stupid plant god these things believe in!"

event.name: ORCHID_SLAVER_CARETAKER_FAIL
event.text: The slavers watch your Orchid's signing in bored bemusement. "Yeah, yeah, that's great and all, but I missed the part where I was supposed to care. I'm not in this business because I give a damn about morals, if you didn't notice. If you're not going to buy something, get lost."
If you can't convince these slavers to end their trade, then you'll forcefully end it yourself.

choice.text: Change your mind and buy a slave.

event.text: You've wasted enough time here.

To your surprise, your Orchid's message seems to touch the pirates. Or maybe not... seems they're just annoyed. "Jeez, okay! I get it, you're people too, bla bla bla. I know the gist. If I'm rude you'll just kill me. I've met Renegades before. Just take the damn plant and leave me alone." The slavers unshackle one of the Orchids and send them your way. Your Caretaker sees to it they adjust to their newfound freedom.

To your surprise, your Orchid's message seems to touch the pirates. Or maybe not... seems they're just annoyed. "Jeez, okay! I get it, you're people too, bla bla bla. I know the gist. If I'm rude you'll just kill me. I've met Renegades before. Just take the damn plant and leave me alone." The slavers unshackle one of the Orchids and send them your way. Your Caretaker sees to it they adjust to their newfound freedom.

Your crew board the station, and find a massive carnivorous plant reaching out to grab them. Fortunately, plants (as well as most other creatures) don't fare well against laser fire. Once the weeds have been driven back, the Orchids thank you.

The station is eerily silent, as your crew wander the hallways. Suddenly, a massive tentacle and toothed petals erupt out of one of the vents snatching up your crew and dragging them away in a bloody mess. Horrified, your crew evacuate immediately.

removeCrew.text: You take a hopeful trip to the Clone Bay, and to your relief a clone is already prepared for the lost crewmember.

event.text: The Orchids are grateful for your assistance. Most offer to be dropped off back at the outpost, but one sticks behind on your ship, hoping you'll be able to protect it from the Rebels in the future.
The Orchid give you one of the Kernel weapons from their damaged ship, no longer needing it now that they can return to the outpost in peace.

To your surprise the crew is a Rock outcast! They explain they fled from the Rock Homeworlds after their banishment and expected to be welcomed into Orchid territory... only for a group of maddened, parasite ridden Orchids to attack their ship and nearly destroy it!
You pry open the doors of the Rock ship only to find the butchered corpse of a mossy Rockman and several irate, parasite ridden Orchids!

You board the ship to find the aftermath of an explosion and the resulting inferno. You can only surmise what was the reason of the accident. Most of equipment is charred and burnt, and there is no one alive, but you still manage to find some useful scrap and resources.

The only person alive on the ship is a dehydrated Orchid. The ship ran out of water and life support systems broke down. After irrigation, the resilient Orchid is rejuvenated and restored to full consciousness.

The boarding team heads into the ship to look for survivors. After a while, your crew falls into an uncontrollable rage. They are returned back to the ship as soon as possible, but one of the crewmembers was affected so strongly that they went mad upon coming back to the ship.

choice.text: (Orchid Crew) Let the Orchid calm the madman.

event.text: The Orchid sprays soothing pollen, and the madman gradually comes to their senses. The whole team sighs in relief.

choice.text: (Mantis Pheromones) Treat the madman with pheromones.

event.text: As soon as a fresh portion of pheromones enters the crewmember's body, they get better.

choice.text: (Adv. Medbay) Try to synthesise a cure with your Medbay.

event.text: You desperately try to scan the affected crewmember with your Medbay. The Medbay struggles to figure out the cause of their condition, but produces a cure all the same. You quickly apply it to the crewmember, and fortunately it seems to work properly.
There is no other way but to kill the poor fellow.

The security footage shows the aftermath of an explosion and the resulting inferno. You can only surmise what was the reason of the accident. Most of equipment is charred and burnt, and there is no one alive, but you still manage to find some useful scrap and resources.

The only person alive on the ship is a dehydrated Orchid. The ship ran out of water and life support systems broke down. After irrigation, the resilient Orchid is rejuvenated and restored to full consciousness.

You hand over the sculpture of the Zoltan ship. The Orchids are fascinated by it, and thank you. Though the gift was from the Zoltans, the Orchids seem to credit you mostly and offer a large portion of scrap and ammunition.

You hand over the sculpture of the Zoltan ship. The Orchids are fascinated by it, and thank you. Though the gift was from the Zoltans, the Orchids seem to credit you mostly and offer a large portion of scrap and ammunition.

As you hand over the statue, it begins to vibrate with greater intensity. A message briefly plays, "You will regret having sided with the Federation, filthy weed freaks! Glory to the Rebellion!", and then immediately explodes! The Orchid settlement is decimated and your ship takes some damage, but that's not the worst of it. The Orchids blame you for the attack and send one of their remaining ships to attack you!

As you hand over the statue, it begins to vibrate with greater intensity. A message briefly plays, "Filthy weed freaks! This was a trap set by the Rebellion! Prepare to die!", and then immediately explodes! The Orchid settlement is decimated and your ship takes some damage, but that's not the worst of it. The Orchids blame you for the attack and send one of their remaining ships to attack you!

After a few moments, the scientists panic. "Your Vampweed's not reacting to thhhe medicine properly... Stop thhhe procedure!!" When the machine comes to a halt, the pod opens up - but your Vampweed is dead. "Ohhhh dear... thhhhis is why we ask for the medical records."

removeCrew.text: Your Vampweed steps out of the Clone Bay, confused to be back on the ship.

event.text: "As to be expected. We've seen these results quite often on Rebel ships. Quite harmful I'd say!" They send back your crew, who looks rather sick but healthy enough to keep working.
"Oh... Oh dear. That was quite fast... I have bad news I'm afraid, it seems your crew did not react well... at all. I don't believe thhhere is anythhhhing we can do to save thhhem."
There is nothing you can do to save your crew. The Shells deeply apologize and offer to greatly increase their payment.

removeCrew.text: Fortunately, you happen to have a Clone Bay to revive your crew, but the Shells don't have to know that...

event.text: You hurry your crew to the medbay to heal them. The Shells still apologize and offer to increase the payment.

You wait and hope for the Slugs to pass by. Fortunately, they don't seem to think anything of your ship and ignore you. The Shell thanks you for keeping their secret and offers to work alongside your crew.

You hope the Slugs won't notice, but unfortunately it seems their telepathic abilities have detected the Shell hiding aboard your ship. Seeing you as their next target, they attack almost immediately! You rush to defensive positions, followed by your new Shell friend.

You contact the Slugs, informing them one of the Shells escaped to your ship. They offer payment for them in return for the Shell. However, while you attempt to capture the creature it explodes, killing one of your crew on impact. It only takes a few shots to kill the creature afterwards, and luckily the Shell's exterior is still whole enough that the Slugs are willing to pay for it.

removeCrew.text: Fortunately the Clone Bay has already begun the process of cloning your crew.

event.text: Your crew grab onto the Shell, hauling them up off the ground and helplessly into the air. You contact the Slugs and inform them that the Shell is aboard your ship. Pleased with your help, they take the Shell back with them and transfer over some scrap.

Your security measures easily deal with the Shell, however the hunters take notice of your ship. They point their already hot weapons on you, either because you robbed them of prey, or they see you as a threat to their streak.

Your security measures swiftly dispose of the undesired stowaway. It seems you were quick enough to avoid being caught by the hunters - when they no longer detect any lifesigns in the vicinity, they jump away, leaving you with a moment of respite.

It appears the civilians did not survive the Shells' attempts at abduction. Whether they died from the fight or earlier from the deadly toxins, it's too late now. You scrap some of the less damaged parts of their ship.
It appears most of the civilians did not make it out of the conflict alive. The last survivor requests to work aboard your ship.
The Shells aren't particularly interested in listening to you. Instead, they have decided to try and capture your crew instead!
The Shells don't seem to want to mess with you. They listen to your demands and pull away from the civilians. The civilian ship thanks you for saving them.
After you explain the Shells don't intend to hurt the civilians, you manage to work out a compromise between the two. The Shells pay you for helping reach a peaceful resolution.
Your attempts at explaining only make the civilians even more afraid. They attempt to flee, and the Shells accuse you of assisting! The ship attacks.
The Shells want to avoid a fight at all costs. They hand over what supplies they can spare.
The colony does not take well to your demands. They retaliate with their weapons!
The militiamen are wary of your offer, but eventually give in. One even offers to join your crew, hoping it will provide a different way for them to protect civilians.
The militiamen are wary of your offer. They decline, not wanting to be tricked once again.

The colony is grateful for your assistance. Their leader explains they specialized in the extraction of fuel from asteroids, but the hackers came looking for money. They were held hostage until they could scrounge up more scrap. Now that they're free, they give you a generous donation of fuel.

The colony is grateful for your assistance. They explain that the hackers were holding their weapon production facilities under their control to create weapons for their ships. Now that they are free, they give you one of their weapons.

You begin to ransack the internals of the ship when you notice a bomb planted inside the wreckage! It explodes, killing one of your crew. You retreat back to the ship when a hacker, undoubtedly the one who planted the trap, attacks.

removeCrew.text: Luckily your Clone Bay is always ready for whenever the crew may be blown up.

event.text: Nothing disturbs your salvage mission. You bring back some supplies from the ship.

To your surprise, one of the civilians appears to have survived the battle. Unfortunately, it also seems their attacker never left. With your latest recruit following behind, you prepare to fight off the hackers.
Your Slug detects a trap onboard the wreckage. A hacker ship hiding nearby, disappointed that you didn't fall for their tricks, moves in to attack!
The Slug senses nothing wrong. Your salvage mission is undisturbed. You bring back some supplies from the ship.
The Slug senses that one of the civilians survived the fight! You move in to rescue them.
Your Shell detects a trap onboard the wreckage. A hacker ship hiding nearby, disappointed that you didn't fall for their tricks, moves in to attack!
The Shell senses nothing wrong. Your salvage mission is undisturbed. You bring back some supplies from the ship.
The Shell senses that one of the civilians survived the fight! You move in to rescue them.
Your search is hopeless. Your sensors can't pick up anything in the nebula.
While searching fruitlessly through the nebula, you stumble upon the Hacker ship which the Federation loyalists were likely hiding from. You prepare for a fight.
You get lucky and find them floating not too deep into the nebula. Thrilled to be found by friendlies, they come on board and abandon their wrecked ship.
The cache is rather underwhelming. You find a small amount of droneparts and nothing else.
Inside the cache is a brand new Ion weapon! You take it on board.
The cache appears to be storage for various supplies, which you help yourself to.
Inside the cache is a de-activated Engi, likely kept as a slave. You provide it with power back on your ship, and it re-activates, ready to serve on your crew.

The cache was trapped! Explosions rock the walls and you jump for cover. However, as you get back to your feet, nothing appears to have been damaged. The trap wasn't a trap after all, instead several Repair Bursts had been set off by accident!

You open the cache, and a screeching noise pierces the air. You run back to the ship and find a stream of garbled data streaming down your computer. Luckily you're able to shut it off in time, but you suspect it may confuse the Rebels for a while.
You successfully manage to explain to the Lanius that the Engi ship is not a wreckage. Satisfied with the scrap they've currently collected, the Lanius ship jumps away.
Your attempts at communicating with the Lanius go in vain. Tired of your incomprehensible yapping, the Lanius decide to destroy you next!
The Engi express their gratitude for your assistance. They give you some droneparts and scrap.
To your surprise, the Engi crew appears to have asphyxiated while you were repelling the Lanius ship. There's hardly anything external left to scrap, but you do find a drone that you can salvage.
The Engi ship is considerably more damaged than you expected. It looks like it won't last much longer until something important explodes.

choice.text: Rush aboard and save the Engi.

event.text: With limited time you're only able to save one of the Engi crew. You're powerless to help as their ship takes its last breath and explodes. With no ship to return to, the Engi agrees to work aboard your ship.

choice.text: Let them explode and salvage the scrap.

event.text: You know this isn't the greatest option morally, but the Engi can't feel pain, so it's probably fine. You watch as their ship explodes, and then finish what the Lanius started.
The Engi seem relieved, and eager to get underway. They set off without saying goodbye.

The Engi are satisfied with your explanation. "Beneficial. Subject goal: long, long journey. Remains compatible with transfer of goods from Engi." They send over the gear willingly, and you feel better for it.
Unfortunately, even as you check the entire system, you aren't able to find any evidence of a Mantis. All that's left to do is return to the beacon and move along.
As you explore the system, you are ambushed by a Mantis! Looks like you're going to have to fight your way out of this!
As you explore the system, you are ambushed by a Suzerain! Looks like you're going to have to fight your way out of this!

While the field at large is very metal rich, you quickly learn that the field is almost entirely composed of compressed, destroyed ships. It's clear this is some kind of junkyard. Fortunately, the remains of one ship floats in pieces near the periphery of the larger mass, making it an easily achievable target amidst the massive pile.

While the field at large is very metal rich, you quickly learn that the field is almost entirely composed of compressed, destroyed ships. It's clear this is some kind of junkyard. You find a derelict ship on the surface that is ripe for the looting, and fortunately it has not been crushed like many of the other ships in the pile.

While the field at large is very metal rich, much of the junk is densely packed. As you try to harvest some of the surrounding scrap, you notice that the surface shifts. You find a derelict ship on the surface, but unfortunately it immediately comes to life - it's a Vagabond!

While the field at large is very metal rich, much of the junk is densely packed. You wander the debris for a while, searching for easier pickings. However, as you approach a large wreck ripe for the plundering, you are stopped by an Engi. They insistently hail you: "This salvage = property of the Engi Harmony. You are trespassing. Leave or punitive action will ensue. Final warning."
The Engi make good on their threat - they attack you!
You search the debris field, but it seems like there's nothing of value here. Unfortunately, the debris is both loose and densely packed, so you'll have to avoid damage as you charge your FTL drive!
You search the debris field, but it seems like there's nothing of value here. Unfortunately, the debris is both loose and densely packed, so you'll have to avoid damage as you charge your FTL drive!
You search the debris field. Amidst the largely worthless junk, you manage to track down a hidden supply of missiles in a large piece of debris.
You search the debris field. While much of it is worthless junk, you manage to scrounge up a small amount of useful resources.
You search the debris field. The material itself is mostly worthless debris, but amidst the junk is a single Lanius. It desperately tries to flag you down, seemingly wanting to join you.

choice.text: Accept the Lanius onto your crew.

event.text: The Lanius tries to speak as best it can as you let it onto your ship. "Found food. While eating, small creature attack! Then, home eaten. Left to drift..."
You search the debris field. The material itself is mostly worthless junk, but floating adrift in the field is a single Vagabond. It desperately tries to flag you down, seemingly wanting to join you.

choice.text: Accept the Vagabond onto your crew.

event.text: The Vagabond seems relieved as you let it onto your ship. "Alas, these mechanical abominations hath devoured mine vessel! Permit my gratitude, o savior."
You search the debris field. The material itself is mostly worthless junk. However, amidst the unremarkable debris, you find what seems to be an escape pod with a solid, rocky exterior.
From out of the escape pod, a lone Rock Outcast stumbles. "...I thought I was a goner. Those Engi found my ship and hauled it off for salvage... I'm lucky to be alive."
Somehow, the Engi ship fails to notice you escaping. You distance yourself as much as possible from their ship.
As you are trying to escape, you notice your cloaking beginning to fail. The Engi ship moves in to attack, and you realize they have disabled your cloaking! There is no choice now but to fight.
Your cloaking system is restored to full power.
You send an away team to investigate, but there's nothing save for the acidic stench of burnt Engi parts. This place is dead.
Your away team reports a wounded Engi and a functioning drone schematic. Then someone yells. The station reactor is overloading and they're running out of time!
It's a tough order, but your crew's lives are the priority. They drop everything and return to the ship unharmed. You put some distance on the station before it blows.

One of your crew valiantly grabs the Engi and throws it into the airlock right before the reactor blows and the automatic blast doors slam shut. You have no choice but to mourn their sacrifice and move on.

removeCrew.text: The brave crewmember's clone strides from the Clone Bay, rather full of themself after such a heroic act.

event.text: The Engi who was saved offers to join your crew.
Your crew return safely to the airlock with the injured Engi and you put some distance on the station before it blows. The Engi, impressed by your crew, volunteers to join you.
Your away team heads home with the goods, but as they transfer back to the ship a small explosion blows the airlock and one of the crew is sucked out into space!

removeCrew.text: Fortunately, your crewmember was close enough to the ship for the Clone Bay to revive them.

event.text: The Engi don't feel things the same way other species do. They'd want the tech to be saved. Your crew return safely to the airlock with the drone control and you put some distance on the station before it blows.
The words they use are "Need = fulfilled", but you take it for gratitude. They take the next jump in their long journey home.
The Engi are grateful. They don't have any supplies or weapons to spare, but they do send over a self-teleporting med-bot disperser they hope they won't need.
The Engi are grateful. They don't have much by way of supplies but they do offer a drone schematic for your use.
As you start to leave, one of the Slugs pushes the Engi out of the way. "Not cool dudessss, you really jussst gonna bail on usss like that?" Scans show their weapons have come online!

You receive another message from the ship, this time with a Mantis at the comm-log. "Foolish meatsacks," he yells. Sensors indicate the ship is moving in to attack and boarders teleport from the station.
You approach to find a Mantis ship assaulting a small Engi space station. You prepare for a fight!
The Engi station is stripped bare and there are signs of a fierce battle. The Mantis must have left the distress call active to lure other ships into a trap.
The station was in the process of being evacuated. A number of civilian Engi offer their gratitude as they finalize their preparations to leave. They offer some fuel as a reward.
The station hails you, "Gratitude. Expected probability of defeat without assistance... 86.2 percent. Request suitable reward."
"Request granted. Fuel transferring."
"Request granted. Weapon transferring."
"Request granted. Drone schematic transferring."

choice.text: (Harmony Crew) "Threat unresolved. Current mission imperative: Protocol 52.34."

event.text: They respond, "Understood. Re-establishment of Federation highest importance. Repairing hull and attaching ship to ship ordnance."
They thank you for the assistance and when you tell them of your mission, one of the Engi asks if he can assist your crew. You welcome him aboard.

"So the Federation has abandoned us? What happened to their oath to protect the galaxy? How can they just let these atrocities be commited every day and do nothing? The Federation is worthless..." The civilians jump away.

"But you ARE a Federation ship, right? That means you can do something! You can tell them about here! But to do that, you'll have to make it out alive. Here, let me see if I can help with that." The civilian ship patches up some of the damage to your hull.
"Oh... Well I suppose you're still a good chance for me to get the hell out of here. Please, take me with you, I want to be free from this hell!"

It's no wonder the Slugs needed help - the "shipment" of lizards put up quite the fight. In the end you make it out without any casualties on your end, though several lizards die. The Slugs are frustrated but reluctantly offer you a reward.

It's no wonder the Slugs needed help - the "shipment" of lizards put up quite the fight. One of your crew doesn't make it out in the end but the lizards are otherwise contained. The Slug laughs upon hearing the news of your crew, but when you slap him and threaten to blow up his ship he relents and offers a reward.

removeCrew.text: Though you make no mention of it to the Slugs, fortunately your crew member is able to be revived by the Clone Bay.

event.text: The crowd is put down easily. Not willing to reinforce their thoughts with a counter attack, the Slugs leave and the factory owner pays you. You are now an official supporter of forced child labor, congratulations!

Looks like the protestors are more willing to defend their thoughts than you expected. A few shots dent your hull, but fortunately it's not too bad. Seeing their attacks were mostly ineffective, the protestors give up and the factory owner pays you. You are now an official supporter of forced child labor, congratulations!
The one in blue gets pressed into a corner, but he lashes out at the last moment, decapitating his opponent. You claim your winnings!
The blue Mantis seems sure to win, scoring numerous hits on his enemy. However, the one in red ends the fight with a single key swipe.
You transfer over the scrap that you bet and quit while you still have a ship to sail off in.

choice.text: (Upg. Engines) Dodge the debt and power up the engines.

event.text: You are able to get out of firing range of the cruiser before they can react. However, a smaller ship breaks off from a patrol and moves in to engage.
The blue Mantis seems sure to win, scoring numerous hits on his enemy. However, the one in red ends the fight with a single key swipe. You claim your winnings!
The one in blue gets pressed into a corner, but he lashes out at the last moment, decapitating his opponent.
You transfer over the scrap that you bet and quit while you still have a ship to sail off in.

choice.text: (Upg. Engines) Dodge the debt and power up the engines.

event.text: You recall the scrap you prepared to send and are able to get out of the cruiser's firing range before they can react. However, a smaller ship breaks off from a patrol and moves in to engage.
You help get the Engi ship up and running but take some of their supplies. He takes off without another word.
He takes your mercy as a sign of weakness and rigs up a small timed explosive before making off in the Engi vessel.
The Mantis Suzerain shows no fear as the airlock's inner doors are sealed and space prepares to take him. You press the switch and then he's gone, whisked out into the great black.
You strip the Engi ship before preparing to deal with the Mantis. However, the Suzerain immediately realizes your intentions and attacks!

It's not clear what occurs between the two Mantis behind the locked door, but when they emerge the Suzerain is prepared to provide telemetry on the local sector. He then leaves on the Engi ship. Your map has been updated.

After a short time alone with the Suzerain, you are told he wishes to join the crew. Although you are surprised at the Suzerain's willingness to swap allegiances, you trust your crewmember's judgement about him.
As you dock your ship with the Mantis, they immediately come charging through your doors! Their ship turns hostile, and you should prepare for a fight.
Their teleporter does indeed appear to be in critical condition. It doesn't take long to fix it, and the Mantis pay you as promised.
As you dock your ship with the Mantis, they immediately come charging for your doors. Luckily they aren't able to break their way through, but you still have to deal with their ship.
The Mantis do not seem to be attempting to trick you, and their teleporter does indeed appear to be in critical condition. It doesn't take long to fix it, and the Mantis pay you as promised.
The Mantis are surprised to see a drone instead of crew, and it doesn't take long for them to reveal their hostile intentions. They cut up the drone and their ship turns hostile.
The Mantis's teleporter does indeed appear to be in critical condition. It doesn't take long for the drone to fix it, and the Mantis pay you as promised.

The Mantis are surprised to see your burst weapon targeting their ship. Whether they always had hostile intentions or think your Repair Burst is a real weapon is irrelevant, because the Mantis have turned hostile.
The Mantis's teleporter does indeed appear to be in critical condition. Your bomb promptly fixes it, and the Mantis pay you as promised.
"Fine. Tell truth, we lie. Now, we take supplies from you and make even better teleporter!"
The Mantis don't attempt to push further.
It was a trap! The Mantis manages to sabotage your engines before beaming away.
The Mantis expresses his thanks and prepares to help you fight his pursuer.
The Engi captain is delighted, and quickly arranges for the transfer of the prisoner.
Fury sparks in the eyes of the Mantis. He won't go easily, and causes serious damage before he can be captured.
The pursuing ship responds with a completely unintelligible message. The young Mantis jerks to attention and assumes a battle stance. It was a trap!
This was meant to be a trap! However, with the Mantis still under the spell, they're unable to do any damage and you take them down quickly. Seems a fight is still inevitable.
The Mantis expresses his thanks and prepares to help you fight his pursuer. You redirect the mind control from the Mantis and prepare to fight.
The Engi captain is delighted, and quickly arranges for the transfer of the prisoner.
Fury sparks in the eyes of the Mantis, but because of the mind control he is barely able to do more than cause a single scratch on your floor before he collapses.

The pursuing ship responds with a completely unintelligible message. It becomes clear this was a trap, but fortunately because of the mind control you're able to take down the Mantis and move onto fighting the hijacked ship immediately.
You power down non-essential systems and wait for the FTL drive to charge. They either don't want to fight or have failed to notice your ship, the latter being more likely.
Before you have a chance to slink away the Mantis ship notices you and powers up their weapons.
You power down non-essential systems in an attempt to remain unnoticed. It looks like they are about to leave when suddenly they turn and set course toward you, weapons powered.
You quickly cloak the ship and move out of immediate scanning range. You appear to have gotten away undetected.
You cloak and shut down non-essential systems. In a short time the Mantis ship jumps away, no doubt in search of prey.
You quickly cloak the ship, but not quickly enough. They spot you and move in to engage.
The footage shows the interior of the pod contains a rabid, aggitated Mantis. Knowing that opening it will only result in disaster, you opt to jettison it back out into space.

The footage shows a relaxed Mantis inside, anxiously awaiting their fate. Once you open it, the Mantis falls to the ground and grovels at your feet. "Oh most gracious and noble captain, you are sparing of me! Please, accepting my gratitude and service."
The footage shows a human inside, anxiously awaiting their fate. A rare survivor of Mantis captivity. Once calm, the survivor offers to join your crew for a time.
The Mantis inside is FURIOUS. He cuts the closest person in half with a single swipe. Kill it before anyone else is hurt.

removeCrew.text: The Mantis is shocked to see the crewmember it just slaughtered step out of the Clone Bay.

event.text: As soon as you open the pod, the Mantis inside falls to the ground and grovels at your feet. "Oh most gracious and noble captain, you are sparing of me! Please, accepting my gratitude and service."
A man bursts out of the life-pod screaming and claws his way into a corner. A rare survivor of Mantis captivity. Once calm, the survivor offers to join your crew for a time.

As soon as the pod opens up, an angry Mantis lash out and plant their claws on your Shell, which immediately causes it to combust as a self-defense reflex, neutralizing this threat. Due to their body structure, your crew member doesn't appear to have received any fatal wounds.
As soon as you open the pod, the Mantis inside falls to the ground and grovels at your feet. "Oh most gracious and noble captain, you are sparing of me! Please, accepting my gratitude and service."
A man bursts out of the life-pod screaming and claws his way into a corner. A rare survivor of Mantis captivity. Once calm, the survivor offers to join your crew for a time.

Your crew member opens up the pod... which releases a berserk Mantis that immediately leaps on your Rock. Despite the agitated state of their attacker, they appear to remain in control and lift the Mantis, before proceeding to slam that nuisance across the room, seemingly having not sustained any injuries from that attack. The crew isn't endangered anymore, but you'd better get to cleaning up the room after the bloody mess of that situation.
As soon as you open the pod, the Mantis inside falls to the ground and grovels at your feet. "Oh most gracious and noble captain, you are sparing of me! Please, accepting my gratitude and service."
A man bursts out of the life-pod screaming and claws his way into a corner. A rare survivor of Mantis captivity. Once calm, the survivor offers to join your crew for a time.

The Obelisk slowly advance towards the pod, seemingly puzzled at how such a primitive device in their eyes can function. Once they figure how to activate it, a rampaging Mantis emerge, immediately lashing at them. The Obelisk appears to be mostly annoyed at their futile swipes causing little effect on their sturdy body, but eventually grows tired and disintegrate their attacker, with ashes being the only traces remaining of the intruder.
As soon as you open the pod, the Mantis inside falls to the ground and grovels at your feet. "Oh most gracious and noble captain, you are sparing of me! Please, accepting my gratitude and service."
A man bursts out of the life-pod screaming and claws his way into a corner. A rare survivor of Mantis captivity. Once calm, the survivor offers to join your crew for a time.

You try to maintain a lock on your crew's positions, but not long after they teleported in you can tell the situation gets heated. You hear the distinct sound of flesh being torn open and screams, followed by static. You order your crew to hurry back, but one of them is missing. With no other choice, you flee while you still can, but one of the complex's guards follow in pursuit.

removeCrew.text: Your recently murdered crew stumbles out of the Clone Bay, still clutching their throat. Once they're sure their head is still firmly attached to their body, they rush to help defend against the guard.

event.text: You remain in contact with your crew as they journey through the maze-like, stainless steel hallways of the compound. Laying small handheld explosives wherever they can, your crew then hurry back undetected to the safety of your ship, where you remotely detonate the bombs. You can see the explosions shaking the building, and their defenses cave in. With no way to protect themselves from further attacks, they give in to your demands, and give over scrap and one of their Engi slaves. Upon interrogating the Engi, you learn that they have remarkably been able to pick up combat skills from watching the trainees, and you decide they will be useful amongst your crew.
There is a single Engi on the brink of death. It seems there's no nasty surprise waiting for you.

choice.text: (Orchid Crew) Send in your Orchid crewmember.
(Anaerobic Crew) Send in your anaerobic crewmember.
We can't save them. Scrap the ship instead.

event.text: The Mantis ship has a normal complement of crew backed up by a Vampweed. This is definitely a trap.
You're able to counter their ambush. They don't seem to have time to fix whatever is wrong with their life support.
As you make the preparations to scrap the enemy ship, it springs to life. It was a trap!
The moment your Orchid steps aboard, it becomes apparent that there's some kind of trap! They're able to make it back to your ship, but it looks like a fight is upon you.

It was a trap! Your Orchid is killed upon boarding the ship, which still has oxygen by virtue of the Vampweed stationed on the ship. The ship's life support turns back on, and it looks like a fight is inevitable!

removeCrew.text: Your Orchid stumbles out of the Clone Bay, a little flustered.

event.text: The moment your crewmember steps aboard, it becomes apparent that there's some kind of trap! They're able to make it back to your ship, but it looks like a fight is upon you.

It was a trap! Your crewmember is killed upon boarding the ship, which still has oxygen by virtue of the Vampweed stationed onboard. The ship's life support turns back on, and it looks like a fight is inevitable!

removeCrew.text: Your crew stumbles out of the Clone Bay, annoyed for having been fooled by this trap.

event.text: The moment your crewmember steps aboard, it becomes apparent that there's some kind of trap! They're able to make it back to your ship, but it looks like a fight is upon you.

It was a trap! Your crewmember is killed upon boarding the ship, which still has oxygen by virtue of the Vampweed stationed onboard. The ship's life support turns back on, and it looks like a fight is inevitable!

removeCrew.text: Your crew stumbles out of the Clone Bay, annoyed for having been fooled by this trap.

event.text: You connect your powerful life support to the Mantis ship, but as you do, the ship springs to life, and the Mantis take this opportunity to board!
The ship doesn't make any sudden movements. If it is a trap, then it'll be someone else's problem.
As you try to leave it behind, their life support comes back online and they immediately pursue you. It's a fight!
Unfortunately your cloak can't keep you hidden the entire period, and one of the ships that is searching for stragglers discovers you!

With your cloaking, you're able to stay hidden from any of the ships that get close until your FTL is warmed up. The ships seem to be more interested in claiming the territory than they are looking for errant ships like yours.
Hidden by your cloak, you successfully manage to deal massive damage to its hull, compromising the station. The explosions send the docked Mantis ships flying away, leaving you alone with the wreck.

You attempt to destroy the station, but your cloak gives out before you can successfully demolish the hull. The attack sends most of the docked ships flying away, but the station itself is still standing and not about to surrender itself to you.

As you try to approach the wreck, a hidden battery reveals itself momentarily to fire off a humongous projectile that grazes the side of your hull, tearing through the plating. You manage to get out of the asteroid field before too much damage occurs, but there's no hope of rescuing the technicians now.

As you try to approach the wreck, a hidden battery reveals itself momentarily to fire off a humongous projectile that grazes the side of your hull, tearing through the plating. You manage to get out of the asteroid field before too much damage occurs, but there's no hope of rescuing the technicians now.

You manage to make your way to the crashed ship, but a hidden battery begins to fire on your ship, causing some considerable damage to your hull. You don't have too much time, but you could either try to board the ship and help the survivors, or steal one of their weapons.

It seems none of the crew survived, though strangely you find a lot of Arcadia technology aboard the ship. You grab one of the drone schematics and as many drone parts as you can carry and prepare to swiftly leave.

To your luck, you find one of the technicians still alive. After bringing them back safely to your ship, they explain that they aren't an employee of Wentworth Innovations at all! They're a corporate spy sent by Arcadia, meant to recover stolen blueprints. However, they were found out and during their escape were detected by one of the security satellites. With their primary mission a failure, they pledge to help yours.

Fortunately, the Rebels weren't lying, and you're welcomed onboard to trade. However, when an elite vessel, merely the equivalent of a police officer here, comes by and spots you, the Rebels make no attempt to stand by you as the elite makes an arrest!

Fortunately, the Rebels weren't lying, and you're welcomed onboard to trade. "We just can't stand by the Federation anymore after all they've done, but you're not all bad evidently. I hope you can walk away thinking the same about us."

You board the station, only for Rebels to pop out, guns drawn! "Federation filth, we knew you'd fall for this! You break your way into our sector, and we break our way into your FACE! Hahah... eh... that sounded better in my head. Whatever, you're under arrest."
You grab the supplies, knowing full well that the people of this sector likely need them more than you do.
You grab the supplies, knowing full well that the people of this sector likely need them more than you do.
You grab the supplies, knowing full well that the people of this sector likely need them more than you do.
"What do YOU know? The fact that you're even here tells me that you could never understand our pain!" The Rebel captain's mood has shifted. You're going to have to fight them!
