"A Renegade trying to cheer us up? I never thought I'd see the day." The Rebels drop some supplies for you to pick up.
"What are you trying to do here? Don't waste your time on us."
Your Rockman tries to forcefully push the animals back into their cages using its superior bulk and weight. Luckily, no animal is harmed. The proprietors seem grateful, if a little nervous.

Your Rockman tries to forcefully push the animals back into their cages using its superior bulk and weight. Unfortunately, the animals are spooked. In the struggle, one of the animals dies. The proprietors shoo you away after the debacle.
With the help of your crew, the zoo proprietors are able to guide each animal back into their habitat. Luckily, no animal is harmed. The proprietors seem grateful.
No matter how much they try, your crew is not skilled enough to help out in this situation. There's nothing else to do here.
One of your crewmembers gets a bit in over their head. In the scuffle, there is an accident and they are killed. The zoo apologizes, but it seems you'll be going on empty handed.

removeCrew.text: Your crewmember exits the Clone Bay no worse for wear.

event.text: The Rebel is grateful for you sparing him, despite it meaning he must betray his original cause.

The Rebel puts on a facade of gratitude, which is shattered quickly when he pulls out a laser and blasts one of your crew! He shouts, "Rebellion forever!" before he is shot in return. You drag his lifeless body to the airlock and send him into the endless vacuum of space.

removeCrew.text: Luckily, your killed crewmember is already undergoing the cloning process.

event.text: The Rebel is grateful for you sparing him, despite it meaning he must betray his original cause. Looks like we won't need the mind control after all.

The Rebel puts on a facade of gratitude, which is shattered quickly when he pulls out a laser and tries to shoot one of your crew! Luckily, the mind control stops him and he drops to the floor. You hurry to drag him out the airlock.

"Tom, please. I'm not your enemy."

"You think you're so much better than me?"

"I never said anything like that."

"You know what? I'll PROVE that I'm better. I'll contribute more than you ever thought POSSIBLE!"

Tom has joined... whether you like it or not.

"Tom, please. I'm not your enemy."

"It's not fair. it's just not fair."

"Can't we just get along?"

"Whatever. Have your fun. I'll look after this place. THEN they'll understand who the real cool guy is."

Jerry sighs as Tom leaves your ship behind.
As you hail the refugee ship, a Slug ship jumps into the system... it was hunting the refugee ship for sport and now they've found you instead!
It doesn't look like they can stand much more damage. After a few shots their ship breaks apart and you move in to loot the remains.
The Slug captain hails you: "A missstake! A sssimple misstake. Of courssse we can pay you! Ssseee? An augmentation has already been transssported." You allow them to leave with their lives.
The Slugs are enraged that you dare insult them by negotiating another time, and open fire!
"Ugh... I can't... but I mussst... the draw of the trade! The opportunity!"
"No."
"I hate you sssso much." The Slugs don't contact you again.
The inside of the station is a gruesome sight. All around are dead bodies of Slugs, their skin a ghostly white. There doesn't appear to be any signs of struggle or a fight...
As you explore the labs, you find several broken test tubes. It looks to be that the Slugs were creating some sort of bioweapon, but it escaped and killed all of the scientists!

choice.text: You don't like this. Head back.

event.text: The inside of the station isn't a pretty sight. The Slug scientists lay on the ground, vacant of life. You explore the laboratory, and notice a knocking sound coming from one of the closets.
To your surprise, the crew of the station is still alive, and not pleased with you boarding them! Prepare for a fight.

As you arrive back to the ship one of your crew begins to gasp for air, and falls to the ground, convulsing in pain. You order the crew to vent the body immediately before it can spread to the others.

removeCrew.text: You aren't sure if the engineered virus is able to spread to clones, but it's not worth the risk. You delete your crew data from the Clone Bay.

event.text: Inside the closet, you find one of the Slug scientists, still alive. They explain that the station was in the middle of developing a bioengineered virus, but an accident caused the crew to become infected and promptly die. With all of the hosts dead, it's not likely the virus is still around, but the Slug advises you leave. You grab their tech before you leave.

You open the closet and a Slug falls out. They scream in horror and fall to the ground convulsing as their skin pales and deflates. You don't know what the hell happened, but you leave before the mysterious illness can spread.
"Enjoy! And remember, no refundsss!" The Slugs beam after having installed a strange red button on your ship.
Though you paid the money to the Slugs, you're surprised when you find they have actually upgraded your reactor, without any tricks!
It must be your lucky day, because the machine flashes bright gold and several fuel canisters pop out.
It must be your lucky day, because the machine flashes bright gold and several missiles pop out. Better be careful not to drop them...
It must be your lucky day, because the machine flashes bright gold and several droneparts pop out.

With the assistance of your trained military crew you overtake the casino staff. However, without anything to unify them, the clients break into complete chaos. You rush to scrap some supplies while everyone is fighting and head back to the ship.
It appears the casino staff was better trained than expected. They push back the crowds of customers and you decide it's best not to get involved further and head back to the ship.
Your assistance appears to do the trick. With the assistance of your trained military crew you scare away the customers. The casino thanks you and offers you a refund.

It appears your crew are no match for the hordes of angry customers, so you hurry back to the ship with one of the casino staff in pursuit. It appears they're the owner, and with their business about to be torched to the ground they'd be grateful to have a place on your ship.

It appears your crew are no match for the hordes of angry customers. A particularly agitated Rockman picks up an entire slot machine and smashes it over the head of one of your crew, killing them instantly on impact. Not wanting to take any further losses, you rush back to the ship.

removeCrew.text: Luckily the Clone Bay is able to revive your crew, though it's likely they will always be afraid of casinos and gambling from now on.

event.text: As you head back to your ship, the Slugs give you some fuel as thanks for your trust in them.

As you arrive on your ship you notice your head is feeling very light. You stumble around, almost falling over. A blaring siren blasts through your ship, and you run to the bridge. A giant menacing Rock ship is moving in to attack! Your crew look at you strangely as you give orders to defend the ship from the Rockmen, but they don't argue.

As you arrive on your ship you notice your head is feeling very light. You stumble around, almost falling over. A blaring siren blasts through your ship, and you run to the bridge. A giant menacing Rock ship is moving in to attack! Your crew look at you strangely as you give orders to defend the ship from the Rockmen, but they don't argue.
The Slugs break into laughter, finding your crazed escapades against some large rocks hilarious. You ignore the traitorous bastards that drugged you and move on.

You catch chatter back on the Slug ship. "Wait, crap. Were thossse the hallucinogenic melonsss?" They hail you, apologizing greatly for their mistake. "I am truly very sssorry... thisss probably undoesss the trussst that we worked sso hard to earn. What mussst we do for you to forgive ussss?"

choice.text: You can work off your debt by serving on our ship.

event.text: "Really? You would let me work aboard your ssship? I have alwaysss wanted to sssee the galaxy outssside of thessse nebulasss..."

choice.text: Repair the damage caused by the asteroids.

event.text: "Yesss, I can do that!" The Slugs get to work patching up the damage.
"Yesss, I can do that!" The Slugs grant you some scrap from their storage.
The Slug is visibly hurt, but says nothing more.

You catch chatter back on the Slug ship. "Wait, crap. Were thosssse the hallucinogenic melonsss?" They hail you, apologizing greatly for their mistake. "I am truly very sssorry... thisss probably undoesss the trussst that we worked sso hard to earn. What mussst we do for you to forgive ussss?"

choice.text: You can work off your debt by serving on our ship.

event.text: "Really? You would let me work aboard your ssship? I have alwaysss wanted to sssee the galaxy outssside of thessse nebulasss..."

choice.text: Repair the damage caused by the asteroids.

event.text: "Yesss, I can do that!" The Slugs get to work patching up the damage.
"Yesss, I can do that!" The Slugs grant you some scrap from their storage.
The Slug is visibly hurt, but says nothing more.
It appears the prisoners did not survive the fight. There's nothing left for you to do except leave.
It appears most of the prisoners died or were severaly injured during the fight. One lone survivor stumbles out of his cell, and with some help is healthy enough to work aboard your ship.

choice.text: (Upg. Clone Bay) Try to save some of the prisoners.

event.text: You manage to get DNA samples from a few of the injured prisoners and enter them into the Clone Bay. After reviving them, they thank you and pay you with what little they managed to sneak with them.
Many of the prisoners appear to have survived. You'll free them all, but you can likely convince one of them to join your crew.

choice.text: We don't need any more crew.

event.text: You take a cautious gulp. It's foul, but doesn't do any lasting damage. It's a thousand to one chance, but this Slug actually seems to be trustworthy. He casually celebrates your newfound trust by repairing part of your ship and offering to sell you his wares.
You take one gulp and wake up with the rest of the crew in the cargo hold... which contains noticeably less scrap than before.

Even if there was something malicious in the drink, you doubt it would affect the Rock digestive system. The Slug casually celebrates your newfound trust by repairing part of your ship and offering to sell you his wares.

Your crewmember is able to identify a heavy anesthetic contained in the flask when he feels slightly drowsy (the Rock digestion system is very robust). His ruse discovered, the Slug immediately returns to his ship and opens fire.

Shells are known to be safe and sound around toxins, so you doubt any poisonous substance from a drink would affect them. They gulp with seemingly no issues and the Slug celebrates by repairing your hull and opening his wares; you wonder if he is genuinely open to repairing the fragile relationship between Shells and Slugs or if he's merely feinting because he has no other options. Regardless, everything goes well and you check what they have to offer.

Your Shell takes a taste of the drink... and immediately proceeds to spit it back right on the Slug's face. "Sssslimy rotten ball... I'll sssell your carcassss to the Clanssm-"
		
The Shell seemingly wasn't interested in hearing the rest of their threat and opened fire with their blaster to silence them. You hope the Shell's reaction to the drink was necessary and not just because it tasted bad to them... One less con artist Slug to deal with, but you still have to deal with an incoming hostile ship, full of just as bad offenders.

Your Ghost, being made mostly of gas, is not only immune to poison, but literally cannot drink. The Slug is confused, but seems to understand the inconvenience. With honest intentions, he repairs your hull and offers to trade.
As soon as your Ghost goes aboard, the Slug captain curses. "You insssult me by ssending crew who cannot even drink? Sssure I wasss going to betray you anywaysss, but thisss isss jussst rude!"
You pull up to the automatic station and after a short time they repair 10 hull damage. You begin to offer your thanks but discover that you can't detach from the station.
You dock with the station hoping for a quick turnaround, but the automatic machines take their sweet time. When the process finally finishes, you notice only one damage has been repaired.

As you dock with the station your readings go haywire. An EMP blast resonates throughout the ship and your engines shut down. You're a sitting duck as a ship reveals itself and silently moves in to attack!
"We're glad you have enjoyed our servicessss. Perhaps some fuel would be an appropriate compensssation?"

choice.text: Give them the 15 fuel they demand.

event.text: You transfer the fuel and they release your ship. "Tell your friendsss about us!" Their portable station slips into the clouds.
"I'm ssssorry to hear that." He presses a button and an explosion rocks the ship. They must have planted a bomb while 'repairing'! Prepare for a fight!
"We're glad you have enjoyed our servicessss. Now for payment. To enssssure your cooperation we've taken the liberty of installing a limiter on your weapons system."

choice.text: Give them the 50 scrap they demand.

event.text: You transfer the scrap and they release your ship. "Tell your friendsss about us!" Their portable station slips into the clouds.

You activate your thrusters and force your way away from the station. A ship quickly moves in to engage. You'll need to get out of here fast; there may not be time to get the weapons fully operational!
"Ahhh. A fellow businessman. We offer to fix 10 damage for 40 ssscrap."
You perform the transaction and watch carefully as their machines patch the hull. However, everything seems fine. Once they're complete you get ready to jump.
"Too bad. Farewell, traveller." Their mobile station slips into the clouds.
Just before the transmission is cut you hear, "They're not falling for it. Jussst kill the crew and we can ssstrip..." Looks like you're not getting out of here without a fight.
Inside the tomb you find a functional weapon! Rather strange, but you suppose it must have been some important part of the King's life.
The tomb, quite strangely, contains several thousand fuel cells. You obviously can't take them all with you, so you grab as much as you can carry and bring them back to the ship.
It appears the tomb contains mappings of the sector! Obviously no one is present who could explain why, but you suspect it must have something to do with 'guiding the spirit' or the like.

You jump in shock as a thin, starving Slug crawls their way out of the tomb. "You have ssssaved me!" You almost think this is the corpse of the ancient king brought back to life, but it turns out the Slug is a fellow tomb raider who became trapped! Finally free after almost a week of being stuck in there, they're glad to accept a position on your ship.

The citizens of the colony are terrified, after what appears to have been months of manipulation from the Slugs. One particularly scared civilian offers to join your crew, so they can escape from the sector.
The citizens of the colony don't seem to comprehend what has happened. When you explain the situation, they thank you, and offer to trade.
As you pull away, one of your crew begins to act funny, and it's suddenly clear you did not go unnoticed by the Slugs! You don't have long until they go crazy.

choice.text: There's nothing we can do, prepare to fight!

event.text: Your crew's mouth begins to twitch, and they attack like a rabid animal!
Luckily the system is able to restore your crew to normal, and you escape quickly.
Luckily the weapon is able to disrupt the control over your crew, and you escape quickly.
Luckily the system is able to restore your crew to normal, and you escape quickly.

choice.text: (Slug Crew) Have your Slug speak to them telepathically.

event.text: Luckily your Slug is able to help your crew keep sane long enough, and you escape quickly.

choice.text: (Telepathic Shell) Have your Shell speak to them telepathically.

event.text: Luckily your Shell is able to help your crew keep sane long enough, and you escape quickly.

choice.text: (Upg. Engines) Escape from the range of the station as fast as possible.

event.text: You pilot away from the station quickly, and your crew turns to normal.

As soon as you board their ship their hostile intentions become clear. Despite being outnumbered, your crew is able to break free of the Slug trap and fight back to the airlock. You pull away from the enemy ship but not before a few Slugs make it on board.
As soon as you board their ship their hostile intentions become clear. On your way back to the airlock, one of your crewmembers is taken out by a well aimed Slug blaster shot.

removeCrew.text: Fortunately, your crewmember was immediately revived by the Clone Bay.

event.text: You cautiously board their ship and immediately smell the stale air of a malfunctioning life support. In no time at all you're able to fix up the problem and head off again with some extra scrap in your hold.
You charge weapons and the Slugs immediately back down. When you return to the freighter, the Rockmen have already repaired the worst of their damage and jump away without another word.
You charge weapons and the Slugs quickly change course to meet your charge.
You have no desire to provoke Slugs in their own territory. You leave them alone.
You have no desire to provoke the Slugs in their own territory. You leave them alone.

After the Slugs board the ship, you are surprised to see the Rock ship spring to life and decimate the other ship. They message you, "Pathetic. You are either a coward or an ally of the Slugs. Either way, you don't deserve to live."
It appears that the Rock ship left during your battle. You doubt they could have been more ungrateful for your assistance.
After the battle the Rock ship hails you. Their captain simply says, "Thanks." and jumps away. That's pretty gracious of them, considering the Rockmen's reputation.
It appears the Rock ship was long since abandoned. You strip what you can from it.
You track the distress beacon with difficulty to one of the five moons of a planet hidden in the nebula.

As you drift closer, you are contacted by a Slug marooned on the moon's surface. "I shall join your crew, sssay I, if you can answer me this simple quesssstion. How many moons are there in orbit here?"
You track the distress beacon with difficulty to one of the six moons of a planet hidden in the nebula.

As you drift closer, you are contacted by a Slug marooned on the moon's surface. "I shall join your crew, sssay I, if you can answer me this simple quesssstion. How many moons are there in orbit here?"
You track the distress beacon with difficulty to one of the seven moons of a planet hidden in the nebula.

As you drift closer, you are contacted by a Slug marooned on the moon's surface. "I shall join your crew, sssay I, if you can answer me this simple quesssstion. How many moons are there in orbit here?"
You track the distress beacon with difficulty to one of the eleven moons of a planet hidden in the nebula.

As you drift closer, you are contacted by a Slug marooned on the moon's surface. "I shall join your crew, sssay I, if you can answer me this simple quesssstion. How many moons are there in orbit here?"
As you pilot closer to the planet, an automated message blasts through your ship, "GOTTEM!", followed by a massive explosion that knocks your ship backwards and leaves a humongous crater.

You land on the planet's surface, and find a massive explosive trap. Scans show it should have already detonated on your approach, but whatever idiot wired it did a horrible job. Without anything to protect it, you scrap as much as you can.
Though the first sweep reveals little, a second and much more in-depth one reveals a massive explosive trap on the surface, wired to explode as soon as you get too close. It's too risky to approach.

Scans show a massive explosive trap meant to explode as soon as you approach, but whoever must have wired it did a terrible job. It should have already detonated on your approach, but without anything to protect it, you scrap as much as you can.
You arm the weapons and attack the smugglers!
You arm the weapons and attack the smugglers!
You move in to attack, but the Smugglers hail you again. "Ok, maybe the price was too high! Let's not be hasty. Is this a more favorable deal?"
"An excellent purchase! Just don't ask what they're made of." You hear the pirate mumble something about Orchid children and Equinoid droppings, then hangs up.

choice.text: No, we're still going to kill you.

event.text: You arm the weapons and attack the smugglers!

You pick a crew at random, and send them out to duel. They make a valiant effort, but unfortunately it's not enough. They fail, and the Slug disarms them. "Haha! You losssst. Now, hand over your fuel... And no funny busssinessss!"
"A good ssssport! Honorable indeed." The Slug beams off with all of your fuel, leaving you stranded.

"What? What a poor ssssport. We made a deal!" The Slug beams back to his ship, and a second later it activates, weapons online. Even worse, it appears they're using a combat augment to jam your shields!
You re-enable your shields, and prepare to fight the Slugs.
You pick a crew at random, and send them out to duel. They give their all, and somehow they manage to disarm the Slug! "Alright, a deal isss a deal... Heres'ssss my ssscrap."
"What? Drugs? Why would we need these? Get lost, Federation!"
"I- are these Slug narcotics?" A Rock Crusader looks down at the drugs, but they're quickly scooped up by a Saboteur on the ship. "Yessss, we'll take them!"
The Suzerain beams aboard, but only to immediately detonate a fire bomb that damages the ship! It was a trick!
True to his word, the Suzerain beams aboard your ship, ready to turn on his old crew-mates.
You fumble out some meaningless garble in hopeless imitation of the Slug. They obviously don't fall for it, and attack you out of outrage for your pathetic attempt.

Though your attempt at replicating the Slug's speech is pathetic, they don't seem particularly offended. Laughing tremendously at you, they invite you on board their ship, and surprisingly offer some repairs and supplies.
It seems the Lanius has been severely injured by something, and a good chunk of their body is missing. They probably won't live much longer, unless you can help.
The Lanius melts down the metal and assimilates with it. You watch as the knife-like structures on its body slowly reform.
Now fully healed, the Lanius gladly joins your crew to pay off its debt for you saving its life.
Somehow, the Medbay's nanobots are capable of repairing the damage to the Lanius' body. Grateful for saving its life, the Lanius joins your crew.

choice.text: There's nothing that can be done, let them die.

event.text: The Lanius is heavily injured and very aggressive. Feeling threatened by you, they stumble forward and attack.
After a little while you are hailed by the Lanius again. "Mistake. In process, human's lungs are removed. Very unfortunate. Will pay in return for loss."

removeCrew.text: Your crew comes gasping out of the Clone Bay, clawing at their chest. You take a moment to assure them that their lungs are back where they should be.

choice.text: Screw the payment! We want revenge.

event.text: This is an injustice! You'll never trust the Lanius again after this, but first you want to kill these bastards...
After a little while you are hailed by the Lanius again. "Very good. Learned lot. Here is human and pay."
After a little while you are hailed by the Lanius again. "Mistake. In process, human's lungs are removed. Very unfortunate. Will pay in return for loss."

removeCrew.text: Your crew comes gasping out of the Clone Bay, clawing at their chest. You take a moment to assure them that their lungs are back where they should be.

choice.text: Screw the payment! We want revenge.

event.text: This is an injustice! You'll never trust the Lanius again after this, but first you want to kill these bastards...
After a little while you are hailed by the Lanius again. "Very good. Learned lot. Here is human and pay."
After a little while you are hailed by the Lanius again. "Mistake. In process, human's lungs are removed. Very unfortunate. Will pay in return for loss."

removeCrew.text: Your crew comes gasping out of the Clone Bay, clawing at their chest. You take a moment to assure them that their lungs are back where they should be.

choice.text: Screw the payment! We want revenge.

event.text: This is an injustice! You'll never trust the Lanius again after this, but first you want to kill these bastards...
After a little while you are hailed by the Lanius again. "Very good. Learned lot. Here is human and pay."
After a little while you are hailed by the Lanius again. "Mistake. In process, human's lungs are removed. Very unfortunate. Will pay in return for loss."

removeCrew.text: Your crew comes gasping out of the Clone Bay, clawing at their chest. You take a moment to assure them that their lungs are back where they should be.

choice.text: Screw the payment! We want revenge.

event.text: This is an injustice! You'll never trust the Lanius again after this, but first you want to kill these bastards...
After a little while you are hailed by the Lanius again. "Very good. Learned lot. Here is human and pay."

You wait for a while but the Lanius do not respond. Suddenly, you see your soldier running back, followed by two angry Lanius! Your soldier quickly explains that the Lanius nearly removed their lungs by mistake, and they were forced to fight their way to freedom.
After a little while you are hailed by the Lanius again. "Very good. Learned lot. Here is human and pay."
"There should be some extra junk metal in some cargo bay..." You thank them once they transfer the scrap and prepare to move on.
"We use drones frequently in our work and have extra parts lying around." They transfer the parts over and you thank them for their generosity.
"We were doing research on some Lanius weaponry before. I hope you don't have to use it but perhaps it will aid you on your mission." You thank them and prepare to move on.
"Sorry, we don't really carry much equipment that would be of use to a military vessel." You thank them and prepare to move on.
They are grateful for your contribution and offer you some Lanius equipment that they were previously studying.
They are grateful for your contribution and offer you some Lanius equipment that they were previously studying.
They are grateful for your contribution and offer you some Lanius equipment that they were previously studying.
After the exchange is complete they leave without a word.
After the exchange is complete they leave without a word.
After the exchange is complete they leave without a word.
After the exchange is complete they leave without a word.
After the exchange is complete they leave without a word.
After the exchange is complete they leave without a word.
It seems the colony doesn't take lightly to you intruding on their territory after-all. Their weapons come online and they attack!
The Lanius welcome you closer, offering to trade.
Your crew hails their ship, wondering if they have any extra salvage. Their crew seems happy to share.
Your crewmember hails them, asking if they have any extra scrap. They state that they are extremely low and cannot spare any.
They scoff at your crewmember's request and utter something that was translated as, "Get your own, lazy solder."
You move in and power up your weapons. Detecting the threat, they stop what they were doing and prepare for a fight.
You ignore their derisive tone and prepare to jump.

You ask what they want and the translator chirps their response, "Explore. Assess trade potential." It appears to be a merchant ship attempting to make connections with the other races. The civilian must have simply been too scared to ask. You check what they have to sell at the moment.

You ask what they are doing here but the translator clearly has problems with the request. It chirps with their response, "Expunge... Floral... Proposition..." You try to clarify their answer but to no avail. Both you and the Lanius captain end the transmission despondently.

You ask what they are doing here but the translator clearly has problems with the request. The Lanius seem enraged for an indiscernible reason. They cut transmission and power their weapons. Looks like you'll have to fight after all!
You power up your weapons, and in response, the Lanius ship does the same! Prepare for a fight.
You power up your weapons, but don't get a response.
As soon as you lock your weapons onto their vessel, it awakens... they must have been in hibernation and were awoken by the danger!
As you drift toward the vessel, your piloting skill is unable to match your intent - the Lanius ship powers up, hungry for raw materials!
You clumsily manage to strip some hull plating before being forced to retreat or risk collision.

After a discussion that your translator fails to comprehend, the enemy ship powers down its weapons. You learn that your crewmember successfully reminded them of their treatise promising to leave the property of sentient aliens alone. If this is a widespread rule of this race, there appear to be many who disagree with it. You attempt to hail the civilian ship now that it's safe.
The ship refuses all hails, even from one of its own kind. It appears to have gone completely rogue. Before you can react, it begins to target your ship. Prepare for a fight.
The Slugs, taking advantage of the firefight, have fled the system. So much for gratitude.

The Slugs reluctantly thank you for your help, protest they had the whole situation under control, attempt to make you pay for them helping you, and an hour later, finally relent and give you some supplies.

The Mantis hiss and click, angry at being saved, and angry at themselves for needing to be saved. They part ways with some scrap metal that is no longer attached to their hull and a few missiles they can no longer use.
The Mantis ship has sustained too much damage - there are no survivors. You gather what resources you can from the wreckage.
The Rockmen give an awkwardly-translated message that seems to indicate something about gratitude. They then jump away without another word.
The Rockman ship jumped away during the battle, but it left much of its hull and spare parts floating behind - you salvage what you can, and prepare to jump.
"Why I never! You have some nerve." It seems you seriously offended the Zoltans, because now their weapons are online and they're attacking.
"Pah, fine. It's no surprise creatures like you are always begging for scrap. Just don't be late."
After a long message the translator is only able to spurt out "critical... must... metal..." You can only surmise they are desperate for scrap.
You release the material out of the airlock and the Lanius quickly collect it and start melting it down. They are grateful for your assistance and send over a ship augmentation.
You begin to message the ship but it quickly powers on its weapons defensively. It appears to be fully functional and looking for a fight!
You release the material out of the airlock and the Lanius quickly collect it and start melting it down. They are grateful for your assistance and send over a ship augmentation.

You release the scrap out of the airlock and they greedily collect it. Shortly afterwards their impulse engines flicker on and they power up their weapons. It appears you haven't sated their lust for metal!
You prepare to jump as soon as possible. You don't want to be around if they disable this beacon.
You prepare to jump as soon as possible. You don't want to be around if they disable this beacon.
You prepare to jump as soon as possible. You don't want to be around if they disable this beacon.
You make preparations to jump but are surprised when the Lanius ship pulls away from the beacon towards you. It appears to be fully operational!

After your skirmish the fighting dies down and you're contacted by the planetary defense team. "Sorry you got caught up in that fight, stranger. No matter how many of these monsters we blow out of the sky they just keep coming. We can patch up your ship for you."
You finish off your assailant with the help of the Anti-Ship Battery but the fight rages on in the distance. You'd best leave before you get dragged into it again.
The competitor gone, you investigate the debris, but it looks as if the Lanius harvested much of it before you arrived.
The competitor gone, you proceed to investigate the field and scavenge what you can.
It looks like you interrupted the Lanius before they had a chance to scavenge much from the debris, and you make off with a good haul.
Your explanation seems to be making sense to the Lanius. "Ship... not trash? Leave." The Lanius wave to you as they detach from your ship and begin to drift off into the vacuum of space once again.
Your explanation is pointless. The Lanius are only more confused and ignore your crew, going back to salvaging your ship. You have no choice but to fight them off.

Your crew tries to explain the situation to the Lanius, but instead of understanding, they simply get tired of your crew babbling nonsense and stab them through the heart. They promptly go back to eating their way through the hull.

removeCrew.text: Luckily your Clone Bay revives your crew in time to fight off the Lanius.

event.text: Luckily, it appears the Flak gun survived the fight.
It does not seem the Flak gun survived the fight. Disappointed, you prepare to move on.

While the soldiers are gathering to prepare, Conrad pulls you aside with another soldier. "I'm going to be totally honest here, this mission is doomed. I have a duty to serve here, and I cannot abandon my men. However, this man is my brother. I can't let him die here with me. He will serve faithfully on your ship."
"We have no use for this. It's a ship mounted weapon that fell off a Rebel ship we shot down, but as you can see we have no ship to mount it to. I hope it serves you well."

"I can't say whether this will help or not, but the Federation supplied us with maps of the sector. I'm sure you have more use for it than us. And in case it doesn't, here's an augment we no longer need."
The ship's crew thanks you. "I know the ship may be a bit suspicious, but our original was destroyed. We were forced to board this one, and hastily painted over it. Here, have this as thanks."
"Hahahah! You absolute idiot! You moron! You complete nincompoop! You dunce! You walnut-brained incompetent buffoon! I can't believe you fell for it! Now you shall die!"
The people you rescued were primarily refugees fleeing the conflict. They offer you their sincere gratitude, but cannot extend anything more.
You are hailed, "Thank you! It's not much but we can repair a bit of damage before you jump off into the war. Good luck!"
The survivors send a message, "Thanks for the support, I don't know how much longer we could have held on. Take some supplies, we probably won't need them at this point."

It appears the Slug captain is still alive, though his ship and crew are barely holding together. The Slug doesn't seem fazed by the imminent destruction of his ship. "Hah! You sssshowed that Rebel what for. That'ssss what I call entertainment. Though, you can ssssee my ssship won't hold together long, and my crew isss doomed. Perhapsss I will ssstick with you, ssso I can sssssee this ssspectacle all the way to the end."
It seems none of the Slugs survived. Disappointed, you take what remains from their ship.
You pry open the cache to find racks and racks of ammunition.
The cache is filled mostly with first aid supplies and rations. You do however find a fire weapon, the black sheep of the supplies.
The cache is harder to open than you expected. You spend some time trying to open it when a Lost Sun ship spots you, and attacks! You abandon the cache and prepare to fight.
A brief exploration yields nothing of interest.
Scans reveal a number of asteroids with useful compositions. You extract some fuel.
You discover the remains of ship embedded into an asteroid. It still has some functional missiles.
You happen upon an abandoned mining site. A few mining drones were left behind and could be repurposed.
The asteroid field proved more dangerous than expected. Some asteroids managed to get through your ship's defenses.
You manage to catch up to the Rock spy. They don't take kindly to you following them, and attack.
You are unable to track down the Rock ship, leaving you lost in the asteroids.

You successfully manage to track down the Rock ship, but not fast enough. A large asteroid crashes into their hull, tearing the ship apart. You try to scrap what you can without suffering the same fate.
Most of the wreckage is too charred to be salvaged, but you still scrap what you can.

Upon investigation, the bridge of the ship fared slightly better than the rest of the ship. A lone Mantis survivor lays trembling in the corner, and almost kills one of your crew as you approach. However after some coaxing you convince him to join your crew.

The weaponry that destroyed this ship has left only worthless junk. As you are about to give up, your eye catches a small crate drifting near what was once the cargo-bay. It contains a few fuel cells that managed to survive the explosion.

The Rockmen are grateful for your help. They were a small farming colony that was cut off from the main trade routes after the Lost Suns captured the sector and were stuck in poverty. A few good-natured Federation ships in the past had given them some supplies, but this inevitably led to their discovery. They have nothing to pay you, so instead they fix up your hull.

The colony did not fare as well as you had expected. Most of the Lost Sun's attacks had made their way past the weak shield protecting the structures on the surface, killing a good portion of their population. They have nothing that they can spare you other than a feeble thank you, but one of the survivors offers to join your crew, as his life in the settlement no longer holds any promise.
"A ssshame. I alwayssss try to be polite firssst, but people rarely agree. Oh well, thissss will be a lot more fun now!"
"Ssssquares." The Clansmen jump away.
The Rebels don't bother listening to you. They send over a team of crew to board you while you fight their ship.

The Rebels take a step back to listen to your speech. You assume it's not going to work, until they set down their weapons. Ashamed of attacking civilians, they head back to their ship and depart from the station. The Militiamen thank you and pay you for assisting them.
They don't see many of your species in these parts, and you stick out like a Casvagarian Sea Slug in a Plutonian Shrimp Stew. You make it back to the ship with a gang of Zoltan guards in tow!
You pose as traders and succeed in bypassing airlock security - however, it's only a matter of time before someone realizes your ID cards are counterfeit!
You head into a ship supply store. It is a well-equipped, self-service affair. An order is dialled into a terminal, scrap is deposited, and the item is dispatched from a nearby chute.

As you investigate their hold, you realize that the Zoltans are freshly dead - it appears that they must have perished in the fighting. It doesn't take much imagination to find out why - the conditions of their hold are nearly inhospitable. Looks like there's nothing more to gain here.

You search their ship and discover the slave hold. The slaves are barely hanging on - it appears that the conditions of the hold are surprisingly careless for Slavers. Nonetheless, you are able to rescue them. Among the survivors, a Zoltan monk bows to you. "I thank you for rescuing us from the slavers. I used to be a fighter like you until I found my faith with the Illesctrian order."
A closer inspection reveals signs of habitation on the surface, but nothing else particularly interesting.
Sending a shuttle to explore a beckoning cave system you discover signs of a battle - and a still-functioning weapon!
A deep scan of the surface reveals a cave system that runs for miles, and what looks like a scrap heap left over from some heavy-duty construction.
It looks as if a team could break through the fragile layer of the moon's surface into a hidden cavern.

choice.text: Attempt to detonate an explosive to break through the surface. [-1}]
Explosives are too valuable to waste on excavation work. Let's get out of here.

event.text: A portion of the surface layer is destroyed in an impressive display, revealing miles of caves. You don't have time to fully explore them, but you find some remains of an old subterranean base that could be useful.
The explosives are set remotely, but the detonation achieves nothing. What a waste.

Your explosives reveal the 'cave' is actually a secret base, located in a network of bunkers just under the surface. Everyone inside is dead; some Mantis clearly came through here recently. It looks like the Zoltans were researching advanced ship weaponry. You take one of their better examples back to your ship.
The Zoltan security staff board your ship and scan the crew's faces into a computer. After a few tense moments of uncertainty they allow your ship to pass.

The Zoltan security staff board your ship and begin scanning the crew's faces into a computer. Suddenly alarms go off and the Zoltans leap on one of your crew! "This person is wanted on five charges of Utter Villainy! Surrender them to us!"
It's a tough call, but Zoltan law holds sway here. Besides, that one always seemed a bit shifty.

removeCrew.text: Unfortunately your crewmember was taken away unharmed so your Clone Bay was unable to retrieve them.

event.text: You're not going to leave anyone behind. You pull away from the station with the enemy guards on board. Unfortunately, they are able to sabotage your weapon system in the chaos. It's time to leave!
Your weapon system is restored to full power.
You allow them to approach, but are caught unaware when they open fire!

"We have been studying the relationships between the species and have determined that the 'Federation' still has potential to be a net positive for the galaxy. Please accept this gift to aid your journey."
He responds haughtily, "You would presume I would work under your command after such a display of... prowess? No, I must decline."
He responds defeated, "I suppose I have nowhere else to go without a ship. I accept your offer."

The civilians manage to fight back the Peace-Keeper forces, who flee from the scene before more casualties can occur. It appears your efforts did not go unnoticed either, and the civilians bring you a large reward for your assistance.

The civilians manage to fight back the Peace-Keeper forces, who flee from the scene before more casualties can occur. It appears your efforts did not go unnoticed either, and the civilians bring you a large reward for your assistance.
Unfortunately, it seems your efforts were in vain. The civilians are defeated and the Peace-Keepers retake the city. You flee before they can chase you off themselves.

As you expected, the Peace-Keepers quickly retake the sector from the Duskbringers and begin making arrests. It appears you chose to help the right side, because the Peace-Keepers have taken note of your efforts at assisting them and pay you in scrap.

It appears your efforts were in vain, as the Duskbringer forces beat back the Peace-Keepers and slowly take control over the city. As the Capital forces flee, a lone soldier runs to your ship and offers to join you so they can escape.

While scrapping the hull of the Duskbringer ship, a massive explosion erupts from one of the nearby buildings! Your ship takes some damage but luckily you pull away in time before it can be compromised. Another series of explosions rocks the city, as buildings crumble to the ground! A squadron of Duskbringer bombs descend from the sky, reducing the city to ashes. You fly away as quickly as possible.

As you hail the refugee ship, a Zoltan ship suddenly jumps into the system... it claims the refugees are criminals, and accuses you of escorting fugitives! Before you can respond, it cuts communications, and powers up its weapons!
It appears the pirates were slavers. Grateful for your assistance, they offer you one of their 'workers' for free.
The pirates appear to be mercenaries, ironically hired to hunt you down by the Rebels. After an awkward silence, you work out a deal, and they promise to lie to the fleet.
The pirates appear to be smugglers. They explain that their client snitched on them and led to their arrest. Now that you've saved them, they offer to sell to you instead.
The Lanius eventually jump away after realizing you don't intend on responding.
The Lanius aren't pleased by being ignored... they arm their weapons and attack!
It appears you are successful! The Auto-ship remains offline.
Your attempt was unsuccessful. The Auto-ship recognizes you and attacks!
The Zoltans are not threatened by you. With your attempt at scaring them foiled, you prepare to fight.
The Zoltans are not threatened by you. With your attempt at scaring them foiled, you prepare to fight.
The Zoltans are not threatened by you. With your attempt at scaring them foiled, you prepare to fight.
To your surprise, the Zoltans are actually frightened by your weapon. They offer some supplies.
As you investigate the battlefield, your ship is pummeled by drifting wreckage - unable to detect anything of interest, you decide not to risk any further damage to your hull and prepare to jump.

The wreckage is drifting faster than it first appeared. You barely avoid being pummeled by drifting wreckage - unable to detect anything of interest, you decide not to risk your ship and prepare to jump.

The wreckage is drifting faster than it first appeared. You barely avoid being pummeled by drifting wreckage - unable to detect anything of interest, you decide not to risk your ship and prepare to jump.

The wreckage is drifting faster than it first appeared. You barely avoid being pummeled by drifting wreckage - unable to detect anything of interest, you decide not to risk your ship and prepare to jump.
You spot a life form floating within the wreckage.

choice.text: Leave the battlefield before other ships arrive.

event.text: You take leave from the battlefield.

Your crew calmly lines up for the Zoltans to take their readings. After a short time, the process is done. They contact you, "Thank you for your participation in our study. Please accept these small cakes made from stiff dough as well as some scrap."

Your crew calmly lines up for the Zoltans to take their readings. After a short time, the process is done. They contact you, "Thank you for your participation in our study. Please accept these small cakes made from stiff dough as well as some scrap."
As soon as you dock, pirates burst on board and a hostile ship appears on the radar. You hear the Zoltans yell in the distance, "We're being held hostage!"
Unfortunately, while in the middle of robbing the ship the Duskbringer returns to find you, and raises the alarm! Get ready for combat!
Your crew sneak aboard the Duskbringer ship and loot it. You don't find much besides a spare weapon which you take.
"Oh thank you, you are so kind." He beams away, without another word.
"Oh thank you, you are so kind. Perhaps I shall stay with you... you seem like such nice people."
"Oh thank you, you are so kind. I do not have much, but back in my day I used to know a thing or two about reactors. Maybe I can do some work on yours."
"It is ok... I understand." The monk beams away without another word.

The Monk stands upright, immediately looking several years younger. He throws off his robe, revealing a blaster! "Tsk tsk captain, you should have been more giving!" Several more Zoltans appear, and a pirate ship approaches.
It appears the ship was pirates! They aren't happy to see you and arm their guns.
It appears the ship was Duskbringers! They aren't happy to see you and arm their guns.
It appears the ship were simple Monks. They say hello before slipping away once again.
You've arrived at the destination, but a pirate ship is in your path! You hail the Monks to warn them and prepare to battle.

The Monks jump in shortly after. "You have done well. It is a shame we must rely on violent savages such as yourself, but this is a cruel and uncaring galaxy. Please accept this monetary donation as thanks."

You do your best to try and help them reach a compromise. Eventually, you manage to convince one of the monks to join the Orchids, if only to spare everyone else the circular conversation. "Huh, can't believe that worked. Thank you for your help." The Orchids give you a small reward for assisting them.

You do your best to try and help them reach a compromise. Even so, you end up bringing nothing to the table as you can't relate to either side. In the end, they apologize for wasting your time. It seems there's nothing more to do here.
As you expected, the temple is completely unable to defend themselves. Sworn to nonviolence, the monks are forced to surrender all that they have, which ends up not being much.
The monks refuse to give up their supplies. "We have no need for violence, and we will not give in to your demands. We are peaceful folk. You know better than this."
There's not much more you can do, and you aren't ready to actually kill a bunch of defenseless monks.

You've brutally murdered a bunch of innocent Zoltans, a needless slaughter as part of your petty search for scrap. What has this pointless massacre earned you? A couple fuel cells and a fake gold statue of a Zoltan meditating that isn't worth more than 3 scrap.

As you approach, an ancient alien voice speaks to you: "Your mission has brought you great battles, and great losses. This will help ease the pain." A few minutes later someone reports medical equipment has appeared on the ship!

You approach the planet carefully, trying to keep your ship from breaking up in orbit. The monolith, whatever it is, must sense as much because the next thing you know you have enough scrap to patch up your damage and more besides!

As you pull closer to the Monolith, you can hear the sounds of clanging and movement around the exterior of the ship. Confused and fearful, you pull back out of orbit and inspect the ship, but see no one. Instead, the hull has received considerable repairs!
A deep voice echoes through the ship's halls. "Your mission will be long and arduous. May this aid you, so that you shall not fear an unwarranted interruption."

Suddenly, a wormhole opens up in space, and a merchant vessel is deposited out the other side. They're confused, but upon noticing you they offer to trade, since their original clients have been left behind.
You watch in fascination as a weapon slowly fabricates in front of you, piece by piece. When nothing else happens afterwards, you safely assume that was all the monolith had to offer and pull away.

A horrific screeching can be heard from the other room. You enter to find a disgusting, small, naked creature covered in slime writhing on the ground. It rapidly begins to grow, until it develops into an adult Slug! They have no idea how they got here, but the Monolith seems to have created them for the sole purpose of serving you!
A cloud of nanobots forms around you, and a voice speaks to you. "And what purpose need you be serving?"
The nanobots form into an Separatist Engi, well trained in piloting.
The nanobots form into an Separatist Engi, well trained in shield engineering.
The nanobots form into an Separatist Engi, well trained in combat.
You approach and wait, but nothing happens. A Zoltan ship hails: "And in the coming times, when the monolith speaks not with a man he has no future and must be left wanting."

A rift opens in front of you, so huge an entire planet is thrown out of it, followed by an unhappy Lost Sun vessel! On the planet's surface appears to be a giant ASB cannon, and they're firing at both you and the enemy!

You approach the Monolith, and an alien voice fills the ship. "For every gift, something in turn must be taken." You notice your fuel stores rapidly decrease, but the scrap reserves increase for every cell depleted!

A thick gas begins to form around the ship, as a nebula consumes the beacon! A passing Zoltan ship tells you not to worry, and that this is a regular occurrence. The nebula usually goes away after a little while. Luckily, the Rebels will probably struggle to track you.
Whispers surround you, serenading you with promises of unknown riches. All you have to do is make a choice... sacrifice a crew member to receive your reward, or stay strong and resist the urge.

As soon as you accept the challenge mentally, a dagger appears in your hand. You drag the nearest crew and stab them, in a crazed bloodlust. You faint right after, only to awake and find the ship filled with scrap and supplies.

removeCrew.text: It appears that, despite their death merely being a stab wound, your crew member's death is irreversible.

event.text: After a while the whispers stop and you pull away from the planet as fast as possible.
You notice that as you approach the planet's surface, your hull slowly begins to repair itself. However, breaches open all around the ship! Every rose has its thorns...

As you approach the surface, you notice a storm of missiles flying straight towards you! As they collide with the ship, they cause considerable damage, but they also turn into scrap on impact as well. In fact, it's just enough scrap to repair all of that damage and more...
A chuckle echoes through your ship, and a disembodied voice follows. "A friend, and an enemy. An eye for an eye."

You turn to see one of your crew members coughing, grabbing at their throat as they collapse to the ground, turning purple. Slowly, their skin begins to peel away and their body melts, only to reform once again into an entirely different form.

As you approach, a kaleidoscope of colors fills the viewscreen and one of your crew begins to age rapidly in reverse, eventually disappearing into nothingness. Let's hope they've transcended physical existence, and not just been forced out of it.

removeCrew.text: You check your Cloning Bay but it lies dormant. Whatever just happened to your crewmember must be irreversible.

event.text: As you approach the monolith, you notice time around you begins to slow. You feel light headed, and faint. When you awake, it appears a considerable amount of time has passed. We'll have to hurry out of here before the Rebels catch up.
A rift opens in front of you, and a fleet of Rebel ships is dumped out the other end! A Rebel ship moves in to attack, apparently not fazed by being warped through time and space.
You notice as you approach, your shields begin to malfunction! As you attempt to leave, an asteroid field slowly approaches. A coincidence? Unlikely...

A small ball of light forms in front of your ship, and slowly begins to grow. The monolith disappears from you as you are slingshotted miles away, and the ball metamorphosizes into a sun! You get caught by the first of the solar flares, but hopefully you can escape before the next.
A portal to a dark abyss opens in front of you, and 4 aliens stumble out of it! They don't seem particuarly friendly, so you prepare to fight.
As you approach the surface, all lights on the ship suddenly blink off. A distinct clicking noise suggests that you've been boarded by the Mantis, a likely creation of the monolith, as well!

As you approach, an ancient alien voice speaks to you: "Your mission has brought you great battles, and great losses. This will help ease the pain." A few minutes later someone reports medical equipment has appeared on the ship!

You approach the planet carefully, trying to keep your ship from breaking up in orbit. The monolith, whatever it is, must sense as much because the next thing you know you have enough scrap to patch up your damage and more besides!

As you pull closer to the Monolith, you can hear the sounds of clanging and movement around the exterior of the ship. Confused and fearful, you pull back out of orbit and inspect the ship, but see no one. Instead, the hull has received considerable repairs!
A deep voice echoes through the ship's halls. "Your mission will be long and arduous. May this aid you, so that you shall not fear an unwarranted interruption."

Suddenly, a wormhole opens up in space, and a merchant vessel is deposited out the other side. They're confused, but upon noticing you they offer to trade, since their original clients have been left behind.
You watch in fascination as a weapon slowly fabricates in front of you, piece by piece. When nothing else happens afterwards, you safely assume that was all the monolith had to offer and pull away.

A horrific screeching can be heard from the other room. You enter to find a disgusting, small, naked creature covered in slime writhing on the ground. It rapidly begins to grow, until it develops into an adult Slug! They have no idea how they got here, but the Monolith seems to have created them for the sole purpose of serving you!
A cloud of nanobots forms around you, and a voice speaks to you. "And what purpose need you be serving?"
The nanobots form into an Separatist Engi, well trained in piloting.
The nanobots form into an Separatist Engi, well trained in shield engineering.
The nanobots form into an Separatist Engi, well trained in combat.
You approach and wait, but nothing happens. A Zoltan ship hails: "And in the coming times, when the monolith speaks not with a man he has no future and must be left wanting."

A rift opens in front of you, so huge an entire planet is thrown out of it, followed by an unhappy Lost Sun vessel! On the planet's surface appears to be a giant ASB cannon, and they're firing at both you and the enemy!

You approach the Monolith, and an alien voice fills the ship. "For every gift, something in turn must be taken." You notice your fuel stores rapidly decrease, but the scrap reserves increase for every cell depleted!

A thick gas begins to form around the ship, as a nebula consumes the beacon! A passing Zoltan ship tells you not to worry, and that this is a regular occurrence. The nebula usually goes away after a little while. Luckily, the Rebels will probably struggle to track you.
Whispers surround you, serenading you with promises of unknown riches. All you have to do is make a choice... sacrifice a crew member to receive your reward, or stay strong and resist the urge.

As soon as you accept the challenge mentally, a dagger appears in your hand. You drag the nearest crew and stab them, in a crazed bloodlust. You faint right after, only to awake and find the ship filled with scrap and supplies.

removeCrew.text: It appears that, despite their death merely being a stab wound, your crew member's death is irreversible.

event.text: After a while the whispers stop and you pull away from the planet as fast as possible.
You notice that as you approach the planet's surface, your hull slowly begins to repair itself. However, breaches open all around the ship! Every rose has its thorns...

As you approach the surface, you notice a storm of missiles flying straight towards you! As they collide with the ship, they cause considerable damage, but they also turn into scrap on impact as well. In fact, it's just enough scrap to repair all of that damage and more...
A chuckle echoes through your ship, and a disembodied voice follows. "A friend, and an enemy. An eye for an eye."

You turn to see one of your crew members coughing, grabbing at their throat as they collapse to the ground, turning purple. Slowly, their skin begins to peel away and their body melts, only to reform once again into an entirely different form.
You charge your weapons - not that this will take much.
Just as you're preparing to attack you detect a nearby jump signature. A Zoltan defense ship comes to their aid!
It appears the Clansman ship was destroyed in the fight. Little remains but scrap matter for you to take.
It looks as though the Clansman ship took a beating during the fight... but the Slug onboard is still alive. "Ayyy yo my ssship isss totaled. Gonna hang with you now if that'ssss alright."
You manage to break open the device, but the power cells are fried. Too damaged to be any worth in your reactor, but you can repurpose them into fuel. Better than nothing.
Somehow you get the process right, and interface directly with the machine. You drain as much power as you can for yourself, which will do good work for your reactor.
You simply can't figure out how the machine works. You fiddle with it for a little longer, but a flare from the star strikes your ship, causing some damage. You give up and hurry to leave.
You play with the machine for a while, and eventually manage to pull out the cells to repurpose as fuel. Unfortunately, a stray science vessel has spotted you... and they aren't happy!
Your Shell knows exactly how this machine works, and they retrieve the power cells to install into your reactor. This will give it a nice boost!

Your Shell knows exactly how this machine works, and they retrieve the power cells to install into your reactor. This will give it a nice boost! Unfortunately, a stray science vessel has spotted you... and they aren't happy!
"Wow, your databanks are quite extensive. And so I thought we Shells were the only ones with thhhe observational skills to record such thhhorough data. Thhhank you for this. Allow us to assist you."
"Wow, your databanks are quite extensive. And so I thought we Shells were the only ones with thhhe observational skills to record such thhhorough data. Thhhank you for this. Allow us to assist you."
"Wow, your databanks are quite extensive. And so I thought we Shells were the only ones with thhhe observational skills to record such thhhorough data. Thhhank you for this. Allow us to assist you."
You mute the Engineers and carry on your way.
You attempt to mute the engineers, but that only agitates them. They attack!

You talk in a slow, calming voice as you approach the smuggler. This seems to relax him, giving you enough time to grab him and snap his neck. Job well done? With the smuggler out of the way, you loot his pockets and find some resources.

"Hey, you ain't talkin' no gibberish! Tha's good... tha's good... If you ain't no blob though, you outta be careful, them blobs everywhere! It ain't no safe place travelin along, think I oughta come with you folks..."
"You talk real damn good for an impostor!" The smuggler swivels to shoot you, but you manage to jump out of the way. Soon you find yourself in a fight!
Looks like the weapon was real after all!
You draw the weapon onboard, only for it to stir and suddenly split into several separate Technopaths!

You draw the weapon onboard, only for a Morph vessel to come stumbling out of the clouds, yelling "AKOO BLAT TRI TROO KAPAT RETEROO!" Looks like bringing this weapon onboard has angered them somehow... and it's apparent why. The weapon is in fact another Morph, but they don't seem nearly as hostile as the shouting ship!
The Shells are reluctant to trust you to such a degree, and ultimately decline. With nothing else to do, they fly away, leaving you with some time on your hands.
The Shells appreciate the offer and accept. Though most you drop off at a nearby Shell station, one of them wishes to stay behind.
The Shells are reluctant, but ultimately agree. Once dropped off at a nearby station, they offer you some scrap as pay.
"Your timing is most convenient! Thank you, Federation. May this heal your wounds."
It appears the Shells did not make it. All you can do is scrap the hull of the station.
It's not easy work, but you chip away at the goo with the help of the Rebels. Eventually, you finally scoop out all of the goo, and the Rebels' engines spark to life once again.
It's back-breaking work, and to no avail. The goo simply won't come out, and it becomes clear these engines aren't going to recover...
"Great work! Too bad I'm afraid we're still going to have to alert the fleet on your location!" The Rebel ship speeds off, and you chase after them!
"Hmmm... you've helped us more than we expected. I suppose the act of not murdering us is worthy of some pay as promised."
"Bah, you're worthless. What was I thinking, expecting help from a Fed ship?"

"Though you have proven yourself unable to assist, your willingness to help is most remarkable. As my ship is thoroughly ruined, it would appear my options are either to wait here for some miracle, or to go with you instead. I don't believe in miracles, so I only see one valid option."
Your boarding drone makes quick work of the blobs. Once eradicated, the Mantis thanks you and gives you a decent reward.
It appears you didn't plan for the Morphs mimicking your own drone - a Technopath takes the shape of your boarder, and blasts it into pieces! Disparaged, you consider your options.
If you're expecting any kind of reward, you'll have to be careful not to destroy the ship!

choice.text: Ignore the Mantis, there's nothing else to do.

event.text: You wait, and wait... and wait. And nothing happens. You watch as your crew simply expires in the vacuum of space.

removeCrew.text: Fortunately, the Clone Bay covers stupidity as a cause of crew death. Your crew is back and healthy, though not very pleased with you.

event.text: You wait, and wait... and wait. And nothing happens. You watch as your crew simply expires in the vacuum of space.

removeCrew.text: Fortunately, the Clone Bay covers stupidity as a cause of crew death. Your crew is back and healthy, though not very pleased with you.

event.text: You wait, and wait... and wait. And nothing happens. You watch as your crew simply expires in the vacuum of space. Only to suddenly watch as they vanish, then reappear replaced by none other than Sylvan. You fly by and scoop him up.

After a little bit, a single fuel cell clunks out of a second, larger slot nearby. As you walk over to it, more and more fuel cells continue to fall! You collect them all and count exactly double of how many you put in.

After a little bit, a single fuel cell clunks out of a second, larger slot nearby. As you walk over to it, more and more fuel cells continue to fall! You collect them all and count exactly double of how many you put in.

After a little bit, a single fuel cell clunks out of a second, larger slot nearby. As you walk over to it, more and more fuel cells continue to fall! You collect them all and count exactly double of how many you put in.

After a little while the voice speaks again. "We apologize traveler, but this device has been under repairs for 9-9-9-9-9-9-9-9-9-9-9-9-9-9-9-9-9-9-9..." The voice continues to loop, and you realize you aren't going to get your fuel back. You leave, disappointed.

After a little bit, a single missile clunks out of a second, larger slot nearby. As you walk over to it, more and more missiles continue to fall! You collect them all and count exactly double of how many you put in.

After a little bit, a single missile clunks out of a second, larger slot nearby. As you walk over to it, more and more missiles continue to fall! You collect them all and count exactly double of how many you put in.

After a little bit, a single missile clunks out of a second, larger slot nearby. As you walk over to it, more and more missiles continue to fall! You collect them all and count exactly double of how many you put in.

After a little while the voice speaks again. "We apologize traveler, but this device has been under repairs for 9-9-9-9-9-9-9-9-9-9-9-9-9-9-9-9-9-9-9..." The voice continues to loop, and you realize you aren't going to get your missiles back. You leave, disappointed.

After a little bit, a single drone part clunks out of a second, larger slot nearby. As you walk over to it, more and more drone parts continue to fall! You collect them all and count exactly double of how many you put in.

After a little bit, a single drone part clunks out of a second, larger slot nearby. As you walk over to it, more and more drone parts continue to fall! You collect them all and count exactly double of how many you put in.

After a little bit, a single drone part clunks out of a second, larger slot nearby. As you walk over to it, more and more drone parts continue to fall! You collect them all and count exactly double of how many you put in.

After a little while the voice speaks again. "We apologize traveler, but this device has been under repairs for 9-9-9-9-9-9-9-9-9-9-9-9-9-9-9-9-9-9-9..." The voice continues to loop, and you realize you aren't going to get your drone parts back. You leave, disappointed.
You pull the Obelisk aboard your ship. Almost immediately, it lights up. "Oh how marvelous, you've found me. I thought I would be stuck in the empty vaccuum of space forever."

At first the Obelisk doesn't stir, and you consider stashing it in the storage for later. But as you begin to move it, it suddenly activates and fires a laser which destroys your shields! You draw your blaster, but the Obelisk has already calmed down. "Oh, my bad. Truly sorry about your equipment. I hope you don't mind if I request to join your crew? It's been terribly boring drifting in space for eternity, and I'd like some action for once."
"A shame. I cannot let you mortals leave while there still might be a chance for great wonders aboard your vessel. Come back here!"
"You mortals have no eye for opportunity!"
"You mortals have no eye for opportunity!"
You are undisturbed as you salvage some supplies.
While salvaging some wreckage, an Augmented ship flies past, sees you, and attacks!
You find little of value amongst the wreckage other than a bit of scrap to make up for what you lost. Looks like the Augmented took most of everything valuable...
It appears you've found a functioning drone in the wreckage! You bring it back to the ship.

While searching the wreckage, one of the Augmented ships comes dangerously close to colliding with your ship, but manages to right itself just in time. "Apologies, taking bad shot from Royals, ship malfunction. Yours sturdy, me come with you maybe?"
You stumble across a massive fuel reserve in one of the ships, enough to carry you for a long while.
"Thank you kind skin sack! I greatly appreciate it." The ship jumps away. Hopefully the Rebels won't capture that ship and use the data against you...
"Thank you kind skin sack! I greatly appreciate it." The ship jumps away. You have a feeling the Rebels will get their hands on that data somehow...
"Thank you kind skin sack! I greatly appreciate it." The ship jumps away. Good thing the Obelisks fell for it, and now if it ends up in Rebel hands, they won't be able to use it against you.
"This data is all nonsense! You've lied to me, skin sack! Now you die!"
You're unable to track down the Engi ship. You give up and fly away.
You manage to find the Engi ship, but they're running away from something. They turn hostile as soon as you approach and attack!
The ship escapes before you have a chance to contact them...

"Message received. Calibrating frequencies. Federation identified, friendly connect established. Here on mission from Harmony. Objective: prove source of creator and disable ancient weaponry. If invasion successful, Obelisks will recapture Harmony."

choice.text: We have similar objectives. Maybe we could help each other?

event.text: "Offer is: tempting. Initiating transfer of supplies, requesting supplies in return. Repay however is possible."
"Willingness to trade is recognized. Your kindness will be relayed to Harmony after mission success."
"Willingness to trade is recognized. Your kindness will be relayed to Harmony after mission success."
"Willingness to trade is recognized. Your kindness will be relayed to Harmony after mission success."

choice.text: We cannot repay, take the scrap and run!

event.text: "Error: Federation ship has engaged in theft. Breach of contract, activating weapons."
The Auto-ship remains unresponsive as you scrap it.
As you attempt to take apart the Auto-ship it comes online. To your surprise, Obelisk weapons spring from its hull!

You fly the ship between the two, preventing them from shooting at each other. Both recognizing you as an ally, they pause, giving you enough time to speak. It seems your efforts have had an effect, the ships agree not to fight, and even give you some scrap and repairs as thanks for preventing the conflict.
You try to negotiate with the two ships, but it appears you were mistaken about the Rebels - these are traitors, and they have no intention on helping out anyone but themselves!
"Is that so? Do you have your ID?" Your human stops, unsure of how to respond. Obviously, you don't, so it seems the only way out of this is battle!
Your human manages to fake it well enough for the outpost to believe your lie, and gives you some supplies.
It seems the Obelisks didn't survive the battle. Understandably, it's hard to differentiate an Obelisk wreck from an Obelisk ship sometimes. You scrap whats left.
"What is this? The bone puppets have saved us? Remarkable. Are you creatures in need of weaponry? We will gladly trade with you, even if you are mortals."

The transport seems to be in poor condition, but is still standing. "We assure you, there was no reason to save us! We could have handled those Rebels without mortal intervention. Though... take this as a reward, and speak of this to no one, understand?"
"Good, I see you are smarter than most. Be grateful that we too have decided to show you mercy."
"Really? You dare try to try and fight us again? Hah, how laughable."
Almost immediately, the Rebel ship jumps away. Cowards...

The Rebel captain thanks you. "I never should have joined these orange-uniformed twats. Last thing I expected was for command to send me searching for a freakin' Multiverse Renegade in a Cultist infested craphole. Mind if I come with you?"

The Rebel captain thanks you. "Now, don't think this is because I like you, but a favor is a favor and I owe one to you. Command won't notice if I happen to give them the wrong info on your location..."
The Cultist captain glares at you. "Mind your own business, Feds! This is our sector, and we don't want your help."
The Cultist thanks you gruffly. "Ugh, fine. Take this scrap and get lost."
The Cultist thanks you gruffly. "Ugh, fine. Take this scrap and get lost."
You ignore the cultists.
The Cultist ship doesn't take kindly to being ignored, and attack!
It appears the attacker is a cultist vessel. You prepare to attack.
It appears the attacker is a pirate vessel. You prepare to attack.
It appears the attacker is a Rebel vessel. You prepare to attack.
The Crystals thank you and pay you some scrap.
The Crystalline ship is badly damaged. One of the few survivors requests to join your crew.
Your crew rush aboard to try and save the pirates. Fortunately, everyone makes it back alive, including one of the survivors.

Your crew rush aboard to try and save the pirates. The team returns with one of the survivors, but one of your crew is missing. The team reports that they were caught in the blaze and didn't make it out alive.

removeCrew.text: Fortunately, it'll take more than some flames for the Clone Bay to not bring your crew back.

event.text: It appears the pirates did not make it. Your crew return empty-handed.

You didn't even realize it, but time slipped away from you faster than you thought. With the story over, you apologize but explain you have to leave. "I understand the importance of your mission, and won't keep you any longer. But I speak for everyone when I say that I appreciated your company with us today. It is not often we get visitors, much less ones so interested in tales of our history. Please, accept this gift."

You didn't even realize it, but time slipped away from you faster than you thought. With the story over, you apologize but explain you have to leave. "I understand the importance of your mission, and won't keep you any longer. But I speak for everyone when I say that I appreciated your company with us today. It is not often we get visitors, much less ones so interested in tales of our history. Please, accept this gift."

You didn't even realize it, but time slipped away from you faster than you thought. With the story over, you apologize but explain you have to leave. "I understand the importance of your mission, and won't keep you any longer. But I speak for everyone when I say that I appreciated your company with us today. It is not often we get visitors, much less ones so interested in tales of our history. Please, accept this gift."
You fire as much as you can onto the village, but the shield is stronger than you expected. Your attacks result in nothing but your own embarrassment as the Outcasts watch you in bemusement.

Your attack manages to keep the shield down long enough that the Outcasts are sent into panic and surrender. You aren't certain if you would be able to actually get through the shield entirely, so you settle for accepting their surrender instead.

Fortunately, powerful as the shield may be, a few lucky shots from your attack manage to break through and strike the buildings within. The Outcasts begin to evacuate immediately, allowing you enough time to land and secure the power source.
This should allow your reactor to run at even higher capacity than before!

choice.text: Install it into your own shield system.

event.text: This should allow your shields to run at even higher capacity than before!
With no need for any upgrades, you simply convert the power source into fuel for the next several jumps.
It's tough breaking through the stubborn nature of a Crystal but you manage to convince them to periodically broadcast lies about your location.

The Crystals merely laugh in your face at such a proposition. "This might be what YOU desire, but it is not what WE desire. We want the Rebels out of here as soon as possible, and the longer they spend looking for you, the longer we have to deal with them."
The Crystal looks down at the scrap then instinctively scoops it up. "Perhaps our interests do align after all..."
Your crew beams into the camp and managed to free several of the slaves being kept there.
However, on their way back to the ship the slavers catch them and open fire! Your crew is shot, but the slaves manage to make it back to the ship alive. A noble sacrifice.

removeCrew.text: Fortunately the Clone Bay is able to revive your crew, and they are welcomed back with cheers from the now liberated slaves.

event.text: Your crew beams into the camp and managed to free several of the slaves being kept there. However, on their way back to the ship the slavers catch them and open fire! It's a struggle and several of the slaves die, but you're able to repel the slavers long enough to make it back to the ship with your crew still alive.
Both the Crystal and the Rockman turn to you in confusion, and you try to explain your point to them. However, they merely mute you and go back to shouting. This won't work.
You open fire on the Crystals, and like cowards the Lost Sun ship jumps away. Disappointing, but at least you'll be able to reap the rewards from this fight.
