You scan the battlefield, and with the aid of your Sensors, you are able to salvage a good amount of material from the wreckage. Well-stocked, you prepare to jump.
You scan the battlefield and find a prototype military vessel in the debris! The crew has been killed, but their working prototype weapon array is still intact! You salvage it and bring it aboard.
You scan the battlefield, and find little remains. Disappointed, you prepare to jump.
You scan the battlefield, and find little remains. Disappointed, you prepare to jump.
You scan the battlefield, and find little remains. Disappointed, you prepare to jump.
You scan the battlefield, and find little remains. Disappointed, you prepare to jump.
You scan the battlefield, and are able to salvage some useful material from the wreckage.
You scan the battlefield, and are able to salvage some useful material from the wreckage.
As you approach the wreckage, a Mantis ship screams into the system... either sensing prey - or to finish the job its fellows started.

The wreckage appears to be a battle between Federation fighters and Rebel cruisers. Though outnumbered, it looks like the Federation fought valiantly. As you begin a more detailed scan of the wreckage, Rebel reinforcements arrive in the system and target your ship!
As you approach the wreckage, a Zoltan ship makes its arrival. It immediately mistakes you for one of the attackers, declares you as hostile aggressors in violation of Zoltan space, and opens fire!
As you approach the wreckage, a Coalition vessel nearby activates! It seems the ship was aptly positioned inside the field of wreckage to spy on Federation ships like yours!

As you approach the wreckage, a Slug ship makes its arrival. It hesitates for a moment, as if surprised to see anyone remaining, and then jumps away without a word. You resume scanning the system, wary of any other visitors.
It seems your sensors are no more powerful than the terraformer's. You apologize and continue on your way.
You find if you modulate the feedback signal of your sensors to just the right frequency, you're able to get through the atmosphere and perform a complete scan!

After a complete scan of the planet, you find no life. The team is grateful and ready to get to work. The station scientists have a unique talent for life support units and offer to upgrade your oxygen system as thanks.

After a complete scan of the planet, you find no life. The team is grateful and ready to get to work. The station scientists have a unique talent for life support units and offer to upgrade your reactor as thanks.

A complete scan of the planet reveals no life signs other than a single ship on the surface. The terraformers thank you for your help, and attempt to contact the ship. Just as you're about to jump away, the ship takes off and attacks, it's a pirate!

A complete scan of the planet reveals no life signs other than a single ship on the surface. The terraformers thank you for your help, and attempt to contact the ship. Just as you're about to jump away, the ship takes off and attacks - seems like it was a Duskbringer fugitive!
A complete scan of the planet reveals a simple mold as the only life present. The terraformers claim their terraforming plans are only hindered by intelligent life; they can begin their work.

choice.text: Tell them to stop. Any life is valuable.

event.text: "But our livelihood depends on this job! Who cares about some silly mold? We'll pay you to look the other way!"

choice.text: Offer to pay them to at least delay until the mold can be studied.

event.text: They see reason and accept the offer. The station scientists have a unique talent for life support units and offer to upgrade your oxygen system as an apology for their behaviour.

choice.text: Power your weapons and demand they leave at once.

event.text: They shut off communications, but you can tell they have begun an evacuation procedure.
After an hour of convincing, the Mantis finally calms down and introduces himself as Robert Smith. He explains he's from a nearby human colony and would appreciate being returned there.
The cornered and frightened Mantis attacks as soon as you approach. One of your crew is eviscerated before the rest are able to stop him. The Engi apologize for your loss.

removeCrew.text: Your crew's clone is waiting when you return to the ship.

event.text: The cornered and frightened Mantis attacks as soon as you approach. You're able to subdue him and leave him at a Mantis colony in a neighboring system. They don't seem pleased or grateful at his return.
"What unanticipated generosssity. You are now my favorite Fed. Don't let it go to your head though, you're ssstill lame." Despite the backhanded compliment, the Slug still pays you back.
"What unanticipated generosssity. You're asss much an idiot asss the lassst sssap we tricked like this! Prepare to die, Fed ssscum!"
It appears the civilians didn't survive, though whether the lack of oxygen or the explosion was the culprit you aren't sure. You scrap what little remains of the ship and move on.
It appears only one civilian survived the explosion. They're grateful for your help and offer to serve on your ship.
You board the ship to find a gang of pirates onboard! They must have killed the civilians and accidentally destroyed the reactor.
It appears the civilians didn't survive, though whether the lack of oxygen or the explosion was the culprit you aren't sure. You scrap what little remains of the ship and move on.
It appears only one civilian survived the explosion. They're grateful for your help and offer to serve on your ship.
Scans show the ship is actually full of pirates, waiting to spring a trap when you board. You pull away from the wreck and fire upon their hull, frightening them. They immediately surrender.
Your crew complains of hearing strange noises of static as they work. One requests that they end the salvage operation early.

choice.text: They're being ridiculous. Finish the job.
They've gathered enough supplies. Let's get going.
(Adv. Sensors) Wait, sensors are picking up something strange...

event.text: Your sensors are picking up some subtle but anomalous activity, it's as if the ship is slowly activating. You pull everyone back to your ship with what they have gathered.
Suddenly the wreckage powers up. Apparently this vessel was under control by Ghosts the entire time!

You receive a transmission from the ship, though it's entirely static. It's briefly followed by a message in plain text: "You got what you came for. Now leave us!" It appears this ship is merely inhabited by Vagabonds.

choice.text: Take the Ghost's advice and leave.
This ship could be dangerous to future travelers. We should destroy it.

event.text: You prepare to attack the Ghost vessel.
The salvage operation ends without a hitch. You get your crew-members back on board and prepare to jump away.

Just as they're finishing the salvage operation, your crew reports they're being attacked by what they claim to be the ghosts of the previous crew. You're concerned at first until you return to a sensible place of mind and remind yourself real ghosts don't exist. These must merely be the gaseous race nicknamed the Ghosts, known to inhabit wrecked vessels!

choice.text: Order your crew to retreat with what they can and get back to the ship.

event.text: Your crew make a hasty retreat, and manage to escape just before the ship fully powers up.

choice.text: Order them to stand their ground, they should be able to handle a few Ghosts.

event.text: The fight doesn't doesn't go well. Eventually your crew is forced to abandon the supplies and retreat of their own accord.
The Ghosts prove to be even weaker than you'd expected. Your crew quickly mops them up and brings back a large cache of supplies.
Your crew is losing the fight against the Ghosts. If this continues, you'll lose everyone.
Your crew safely make it back to the ship just in time as the grills activate and evaporate several of the Ghosts. The rest stand back, glaring at you as your ship pulls away.

choice.text: Retreat if possible, but protecting the ship is the primary goal.

event.text: You lose a crew-member to the fight but manage to escape the ghost ship and its inhabitants.

removeCrew.text: You get back to find your crew-member cloned, though annoyed with the command decisions that led to his death.

event.text: As you approach it becomes clear that the station is simply an empty shell. It has been stripped of useful materials long ago.
You approach cautiously but you detect no danger. It appears to have been a small rest stop that was abandoned a while ago. You take what few supplies you can find.
Upon closer inspection it appears to have a large portion of its hull destroyed. You take what few supplies you can find.
The station is in disarray. You find a cloning bay partially intact but nothing else seems to be functioning.

choice.text: (Clone Bay) Search for a surviving DNA bank.

event.text: While the cloning facilities are no longer functioning, you find someone was in queue to be cloned. You transfer their data to your Clone Bay, and after some time their body is rebuilt.
You take what you can and prepare to move on.
You dock with the station to take a look inside. However no sooner do you open the airlock than pirates burst in. Meanwhile scanners pick up a previously undetected pirate ship moving in to attack!

You dock with the station to take a look inside. However no sooner do you open the airlock than pirates burst in. Meanwhile multiple warning signals go off on the bridge. The pirates have activated a remote planetary defense system and it's locking onto your ship!
The clone is extremely confused but calms down after you try to explain the situation. With no other options the clone offers to work on your ship for a time.
The clone is extremely confused but seems to accept their new situation. With no other options the clone offers to work on your ship for a time.
The clone emerges in a crazed frenzy and refuses to calm down. You have no choice but to fight.
The civilians are grateful. However, none of them seem eager to be mistaken as Federation loyalists so they quickly jump away.
Some of the civilians pool together their excess scrap to try to repay you for your help.
One of the civilian ships quietly teleports over a crate of Federation military supplies.
One of the civilian ships contacts you and reveals they are Federation loyalists. An eavesdropping Rebel swoops in, destroys the ship, and turns to attack you!

The colonists hand over the supplies. It appears to be mostly equipment meant for automated farming, but you can make use of it. As you leave, you receive a message: "This is why the Rebels will always have support!"
The colonists hand over the supplies and you load it onto your ship. As you jump away, you crack it open and discover nothing more than vaccinations for a local plague.
You make the colonists teleport the supplies to your ship. It's nothing more than building construction supplies. Oh well, scrap is scrap.
The colonists willingly give up their supplies. But as you make to jump away, an explosion rocks your ship. The cargo was booby trapped!
The colonists hand over the supplies. It appears to be nothing more than some basic medical supplies.
The colonists hand over the supplies. It appears to be a small supply of ammunition, probably for their mining operations.
The colonists aren't willing to give up the supplies without a fight. As you bring the cargo back to your ship, a horde of angry civilians board and try to take it back!
It appears the supplies are mostly equipment meant for automated farming, but you can make use of it. As you leave, you receive a message: "This is why the Rebels will always have support!"
The supplies are nothing more than building construction supplies. Oh well, scrap is scrap.
It appears the supplies are nothing more than some basic medical supplies.
It appears the supplies are a small supply of ammunition, probably for their mining operations.
You spend some time looking around but your scanners cannot pick up any trace of the Rebel ship.
After far too much time spent searching, you are finally able to track him down. You go into the fight pondering just how much of a head start you've lost on the Rebel Fleet...
After a short search you find the Rebel ship. Let's hope he's as easy to defeat in combat as he was to find.
The ship is completely abandoned. There is no trace of the crew or any cargo. Mystified, you leave the ghost ship and continue on.

The ship is completely abandoned. It looks like it ran out of fuel... and the crew ran out of food not long after. Despite the grisly scene that remains, you are able to scavenge some supplies from the cargo hold.

It looks as if the ship ran out of fuel... and the crew ran out of food not long after. Despite the grisly scene that remains, you find one surviving crewman locked in the freezer, almost perfectly preserved and apparently overlooked by the starving crew.

As you investigate the ship, you are attacked by the now-cannibalistic crew! Driven mad by lack of food, they have turned to feeding on each other. As you fight your way off the ship, one of your crew falls to the crazed attackers, and you are forced to leave them behind or else lose your entire ship.

removeCrew.text: Your abandoned crewmember is waiting on the ship when you return, trying not to dwell on the fate of his previous incarnation.

event.text: As you approach the ship, your sensors flicker off for a second and you realise you have been boarded by Ghosts!
The ship is completely abandoned. There is no trace of the crew or any cargo. Mystified, you leave the ghost ship and continue on.

The ship is completely abandoned. It looks like it ran out of fuel... and the crew ran out of food not long after. Despite the grisly scene that remains, you are able to scavenge some supplies from the cargo hold.

It looks as if the ship ran out of fuel... and the crew ran out of food not long after. Despite the grisly scene that remains, your drone finds one surviving crewman locked in the freezer, almost perfectly preserved and apparently overlooked by the starving crew.

As your drone investigates the ship, it is attacked by the now-cannibalistic crew! Driven mad by lack of food, they have turned to feeding on each other. You are forced to leave the drone behind or else lose your entire ship.
As you approach the ship, your sensors flicker off for a second and you realise you have been boarded by Ghosts!
As you hail the freighter, it advances, weapons bristling from its hull! It's a pirate ambush!

As you hail the refugee ship, a Zoltan ship suddenly jumps into the system... it claims the refugees are criminals, and accuses you of escorting fugitives! Before you can respond, it cuts communications, and powers up its weapons!
As you hail the refugee ship, a pirate ship jumps into the system... it was using the refugee ship as bait!
As you hail the refugee ship, a Slug ship jumps into the system... it was hunting the refugee ship for sport and now they've found you instead!
As you hail the refugee ship, a Duskbringer ship jumps into the system... they've decided to test their weapons on some humans and these poor civilians found their way into their cross-hairs!

Your crew tries to keep the crowds in line but the scene quickly turns ugly. Half-crazed with fear, the infected grab mining tools and push back at your crew, forcing them to retreat hastily. They barely get away without injury but the same can't be said for the colony's leaders. You quickly leave.

With the visible threat of your weapons, the infected become subdued enough for you to set up a rudimentary quarantine. However before you leave, one of your crew presents signs of infection. You have no choice but to leave them on the station in the hopes that they discover a cure quickly. You leave before more crew succumb.

removeCrew.text: As your crewman is still alive and working towards a cure, it would be against Federation regulation to create a clone to continue with you on your journey.

event.text: You send your crew into the station. Unfortunately as soon as they enter the fire breaches the station's fuel cell containment. You quickly try to dock and retrieve your crew but not before an unfortunate soul is lost in the inferno.

removeCrew.text: With a new-found respect for flames, your crewmember's clone stumbles out of the Clone Bay.

event.text: Your crew valiantly keeps the fire at bay long enough to allow some of the scientists to escape, but it appears to be a losing battle. Before long you order the retreat. The few scientists they were able to save are distraught but grateful. You'll drop them off at the next station.

You locate the highest concentration of life forms and bring the ship alongside the station. Before you can begin to offload the survivors, a huge blast splits the station apart. Your ship is thrown away and some debris pierces your hull. You watch helplessly as the last of the survivors are consumed in the collapse of the station.

You pull up alongside the station and cut through their hull. You are able to rescue a few survivors but many more are lost. One of the survivors offers to join your crew and you offload the rest on a nearby station.

You fire a few volleys from a distance and it is clear the defense system is no match for your weapons. However, the station does not seem happy with your 'solution'. You salvage what you can and jump before there is trouble.

You fire a few volleys but aren't able to penetrate the defense system's shields. Its weapons have no trouble piercing yours though, and you take minor damage before escaping. The station will need to find help elsewhere.

You take a few careful shots but you expose a mineral patch in the rock that reacts violently with your weapon. A shockwave forces you back as debris pelts against your hull. When you regain control you find there is not much left of the ship.
You fire a few volleys into the rock and it starts to shudder and break apart. Without shields the pirate ship takes a beating but eventually pulls free. They thank you for your assistance.
You decide the pirate is not worth saving and fire a few volleys into their hull causing the ship to depressurize and break apart. You move in to loot the remains.

You decide the pirate is not worth saving and fire a few volleys into their hull. Before you can scrap the remains another pirate ship flashes on your radar. Perhaps they saw your deed, or perhaps they want to claim the spoils for themselves, but for whatever reason, they're charging weapons!
Their ship looks to be on the verge of destruction and life signs are fading quickly.

choice.text: Quickly try to rescue the crew.

event.text: Despite your efforts the majority do not survive. The sole survivor offers to join your crew and helps you strip the now derelict ship of useful components.

choice.text: (Med-bot Dispersal) Pump their ship with Nano Med-bots to aid in the rescue.

event.text: You drag the injured and dying crew on to your ship. The Med-bots help stabilize their condition, but most perish. The surviving shields operator offers to join your crew and helps you strip their broken ship of scrap.

choice.text: (Teleporter) Lock on to all remaining life signatures and beam them onto your ship.

event.text: Your quick reactions allow you to stabilize a few of the seriously wounded crewmembers. An infantryman offers to join your crew, eager to assist the Federation.

choice.text: (Heal Bomb) Use a healing bomb to keep them alive.

event.text: You launch a healing bomb into their ship and the Nanobots are able to keep the crew stabilized. Once they are relieved, you send over some supplies to keep them healthy enough to get to friendly territory.
Now that they're safe, an engineer offers to join your crew and the rest of the crew ask to be dropped off at the nearest station.

choice.text: (Medical Drone) Use the drone to keep them alive.

event.text: You send the drone over to their vessel, which immediately goes to work. Once they are relieved, you send over some supplies to keep them healthy enough to get to friendly territory.
Now that they're safe, an engineer offers to join your crew and the rest ask to be dropped off at the nearest station.

choice.text: (Medical Crew) Send your crewmember to stabilize their condition.

event.text: You send your crewmember over to their vessel, who immediately goes to work. Once they are relieved, you send over some supplies to keep them healthy enough to get to friendly territory.
Now that they're safe, an engineer offers to join your crew and the rest ask to be dropped off at the nearest station.
"Thanks, we didn't think there would be Rebel ships all the way out here. They seem to be searching for something. Take some extra supplies as thanks for your aid."
You succeed in preventing them from being entirely destroyed, but your ship took a number of hits in the process. They offer some of the scrap and fuel they were mining out of the asteroid as thanks.
You try your best but one stray rock hits a key structure in their ship. It breaks apart in front of your eyes. You salvage what you can before leaving, and try not to think about the lost crew.
Despite your best efforts, the civilian ship breaks apart from the constant barrage. You are barely able to break out of the asteroid field yourself. The ship sustains some damage in the process.

Your drone succeeds in keeping their ship from breaking apart while they fix it, however you take some damage while attempting to leave the asteroid field. They offer you some military supplies as thanks for saving them.

Your nanobots succeed in keeping their ship from breaking apart while they fix it, however you take some damage while attempting to leave the asteroid field. They offer you some military supplies as thanks for saving them.

They reluctantly agree. Once aboard, you watch as their ship crashes against a massive rock. They thank you, but say "I don't know what we'll do without our ship. As the Captain, I feel obligated to help you with your mission."

They refuse at first, but after another blast rocks their ship they agree and beam aboard your ship. They say, "Thank you but we really should return to our families... I'm sure we can muster up a reward if you take us home."

You regretfully leave the area, not able to watch them get destroyed. A short while later you get a second message, "We survived, no thanks to you! Don't think I don't know that the Rebels are hunting for you. I'll be sure to tell them where you are the next time I see them!"
You watch helplessly as their ship smashes against a cruiser-sized rock...
Detecting the greater threat (and potential reward), they turn and engage your ship.
It seems the pirate wasn't looking for a fight with someone who could fight back. They leave and you move to contact the civilian ship.
You find a colony that seems to have been recently attacked. Exploring the devastation, you find a lone survivor.

choice.text: Invite him to join your crew.
Take him home to his family on a nearby planet in this system.

event.text: You find a man living alone in a cave. From the appearance of his wrecked ship, it seems he's been here for many years. He looks healthy, but his mental state is questionable.

choice.text: Bring him back to your ship in hopes of finding some help for him.
You refuse to let this person come any closer without the proper staff or equipment.
Leave the madman to his ravings, he's not worth the risk.
(Upg. Medbay) Bring him to your medbay.

event.text: Once inside your medbay, the system is able to restore his body and undo some of the damage to his brain. Once awake he states, "I feel almost like my old self again... Thank you. Please let me serve on your ship."

choice.text: (Adv. Medbay) Bring him to your medbay.

event.text: Once inside your advanced medbay, the system is able to identify and minimize the trauma associated with being alone for so long. Once awake he states, "I don't know how to repay you, I feel 10 years younger... Let me serve on your ship."

choice.text: (Medic Crew) Have your medic examine him.

event.text: Your crewmember deduced that this person suffers from trauma after a lengthy isolation. It will take a prolonged treatment to truly heal them, but with some calming meds, they are level-headed enough to join you, provided proper care and surveillance are given on board.

choice.text: (Slug Crew) "Sssir, allow me to asssesss hiss mental ssstate."
(Telepathic Shell) "Sir, allow me to assess his mental state."

event.text: The family apparently owns one of the most valuable mining enterprises in the sector. For the safe return of his son, the patron of the family offers you a substantial reward.
The survivor's family is of modest means, yet they manage to offer you a reward for your virtuous deed.
Overjoyed with the return of their son, the family of the survivor arranges to repair your ship's hull as compensation.
Once back in orbit, the man turns increasingly violent. Eventually he turns on your crew and manages to kill one before you can subdue him.

removeCrew.text: Luckily, your clone bay is able to revive your crewmember.

event.text: He seems to improve immensely upon getting back to the ship. It might take a while for him to truly be well again, but until then he seems happy to serve as a member of your crew.
Being back in space terrifies him. He goes mad and nearly blows a hole in the side of your ship with a makeshift explosive in an attempt to "escape this metal prison." He dies in the explosion.
It seems he was in worse health than we first thought. He collapses on the trip up to the ship. It doesn't look like he's going to make it...

choice.text: (Upg. Medbay) Quickly bring him to the medbay.

event.text: Your improved medbay was able to resuscitate him. After a short time he recovers greatly saying, "I really thought I was a goner... I haven't eaten for days. Would you mind if I stayed on your ship?"

choice.text: (Upg. Clone Bay) Quickly register him into the Clone Bay.

event.text: Your quick reaction allowed your Clone Bay to revive him after he passes. After he steps out of the machine he states, "How am I alive? Wasn't I just dying on some shuttle? Technology sure has changed."

You bring the ship closer. The Slug enters a trance-like state for 1 to 2 seconds, then quickly snaps out of it. He states, "Thisss perssson is clearly unssstable. It isss bessst we leave them alone."
You bring the ship closer and the Slug, after a pause, says that the person is stable and with good intentions. You offer a position in your crew and it is graciously accepted.
You bring the ship closer. The Shell enters a trance-like state for 1 to 2 seconds, then quickly snaps out of it. He states, "Thhhis person is clearly unstable. It is best we leave thhhem alone."
You bring the ship closer and the Shell, after a pause, says that the person is stable and with good intentions. You offer a position in your crew and it is graciously accepted.
He states that he was a weapons operator before being stranded. He happily offers his services for a time in exchange for "getting off that rock".
He states that he was a shield operator before being stranded. He happily offers his services for a time in exchange for "getting off that rock".
He states that he was a pilot before being stranded. He happily offers his services for a time in exchange for "getting off that rock".
He states that he was an engineer before being stranded. He happily offers his services for a time in exchange for "getting off that rock".
He states that he was an infantryman before being stranded. He happily offers his services for a time in exchange for "getting off that rock".
He states that he was a shipwright before being stranded. He happily offers his services for a time in exchange for "getting off that rock".
"Thank you so much! We don't have much to offer, but have a look at the sector scans we took." Your map is updated.
"Thank you. Here, have this extra scrap as payment."
"Thank you. Here, have this extra scrap as payment."
"Thank the Gods. We can finally get out of here! We're jumping straight home so take this extra weapon. We won't need it, hopefully."
"Thank you. Perhaps as payment our engineer can try to optimize your ship's reactor output?"

As you approach the factory, your navigation screen becomes overwhelmed by the number of distress beacons increasing everfold. Unable to maneuver properly, your ship collides with some of the debris and eventually you're forced to pull out before the damage becomes unrecoverable.

Though the number of signals continues to increase rapidly, you manage to escort several of the workers onto your ship before you have to pull away. Though you drop most off nearby, one offers to stay. Probably because it pays better than their old job, if you had to guess.
As you approach the ship to scrap it, the lights flicker on, and the sensors detect boarders. It was a trap!
You're undisturbed as you scrap the ship. Inside you even find an unused augment lying on the ground!

Inside the ship you find signs of a greater conflict. Lacerations on the Hive Mantis suggest the damage was dealt by other fellow Mantis. Your suspicions are affirmed when you find a young Free Mantis locked in the cargo-hold who had fled from the fight. He seems to be eager to join your crew.
You hail the ship, trying to see if they're still alive. However, their weapons come online in response and they move in to attack!

You quickly receive a response, albeit a very rude one. "Eating crap and die, Federation! Not needing help from YOU!" It seems they must have been attacked recently, and their engines aren't functioning.
With the ship damaged like this, it should be easy to finish it off.
"Bah, engines are toast. Worthless junk machine. Not needing this right now. Must kill again, soon. Will go with you."

choice.text: (Free Mantis Crew) Hail again and taunt the Mantis.

event.text: "Free Mantis laughing at me, but them is one who lacking braincell by dozens! I using your spines as soup ladels!"
The ship here is no ordinary vessel. It's a massive Rebel carrier! It must have detected you, because its few remaining systems come online and it dispenses an Auto-ship to face you.
The ship that crashed appears to be a Federation Dreadnaught! There may still be crew alive, but the ship seems to be in a critical state.

choice.text: There's no saviors aboard your vessel to send over.
It's too late, we should go.

event.text: The ship appears to have once been a Federation carrier, but it's beyond repair. A good section of the hull has collapsed and it's very doubtful anyone survived.

choice.text: We aren't pirates, it would be disrespectful to scrap the ship.

event.text: The ship here is no ordinary vessel. It's a massive Rebel carrier! From this distance it hasn't detected you, but several Auto-vessels remain functional inside.

choice.text: Attack the Auto-ships to access the carrier.

event.text: You approach the carrier and prepare for battle.
The ship appears to have once been a Federation carrier, but it's beyond repair. A good section of the hull has collapsed and it's very doubtful anyone survived, so you make use of the wreckage.

The ship that crashed appears to be a Federation Dreadnaught! There may still be crew alive, but the ship seems to be in a critical state. With your scans, you make certain you give yourself enough time to escape before a structural collapse, and rush in to collect some of the survivors.
Your crew returns with a single survivor. It appears the rest of the Federation crew were either killed in the crash or the following inferno.
You watch in horror as the carrier collapses, no doubt burying your crew inside.

removeCrew.text: Luckily your crew is already being cloned and is revived a short time later.

event.text: You are uninterrupted as you salvage the carrier.
It appears one of the Federation Auto-ships onboard is still functional! It detects your attempts at salvaging as hostile and attacks.
It takes a long time to track down the source of the distress beacon. It appears to be a Federation marked beacon has been left behind, but the ship it belonged to is no longer present.
You discover a Federation marked distress beacon, and the ship that deployed it not too far away. Though hard to tell from a distance, it looks as though the ship has received critical damage.
While searching for the source of the distress beacon, you encounter a hostile Pirate ship. Get ready for a fight!
The Federation ship is glad to see a friendly face. They ask if you can aid in repairs.

choice.text: Take some time to repair their hull.

event.text: It takes a long time to patch up their hull, but the Feds are grateful. They give you some supplies.

choice.text: (Hull Repair) Dispatch the drone to fix up their hull. [-1|]

event.text: The Feds are grateful for your assistance. They give you some supplies.

choice.text: (Pro-Hull Beam) Use the beam to fix up their hull.

event.text: The Feds are grateful for your assistance. They give you some supplies.

choice.text: (Repair Arm) Use the arm to fix up their hull.

event.text: The Feds are grateful for your assistance. They give you some supplies.

choice.text: (Repair Bomb) Use the bomb to fix up their hull. [-1}]

event.text: The Feds are grateful for your assistance. They give you some supplies.

As you move closer to communicate, it becomes clear that this is not an ordinary Federation ship. It has been taken control of by pirates, and now that you've made clear of your position they're intent on a fight!

The data provided by the diagnostics informs you that a Federation vessel last visited this location. Knowing what you're looking for, you quickly track down the ship, which is requesting aid with their repairs.

choice.text: Take some time to repair their hull.

event.text: It takes a long time to patch up their hull, but the Feds are grateful. They give you some supplies.

choice.text: (Hull Repair) Dispatch the drone to fix up their hull. [-1|]

event.text: The Feds are grateful for your assistance. They give you some supplies.

choice.text: (Pro-Hull Beam) Use the beam to fix up their hull.

event.text: The Feds are grateful for your assistance. They give you some supplies.

choice.text: (Repair Arm) Use the arm to fix up their hull.

event.text: The Feds are grateful for your assistance. They give you some supplies.

choice.text: (Repair Bomb) Use the bomb to fix up their hull. [-1}]

event.text: The Feds are grateful for your assistance. They give you some supplies.

The data provided by the diagnostics informs you that a Federation vessel last visited this beacon - but their identification seems to have been forged. If there ever was one, this is as clear a sign as can be that a pirate lurks nearby.
You have no difficulty tracking down the pirate thanks to your logs and prepare for combat.

"A space dock is under assault from the Rebels. Although the dock is... technically... illegal within their laws, it's very important for our trade. We'll pay you in fuel and scrap if you promise to save them."
They transmit the space dock's coordinates.
They regretfully accept your decision.

"Some of our friends have taken to piracy in the recent chaos of the war. We'd like you to "convince" them of their poor decision by severely damaging their ship. We'll pay you well as long as you don't kill them all."

"Just be sure not to blow them up!" they say nervously as they direct you to a nearby moon. You find the pirate ship docked there. They immediately respond to your appearance with, "Your money or your life!" They must be new to this.
"Fine. I don't know what we'll do about them though..." You prepare to jump away from this sector.
As you try to leave, a patrol spots you. Wailing sirens begin to blare around the camp and the ship moves in to attack!
They must have been focused on setting up camp since you got far enough away to attempt a jump without being noticed.

"Great, I was worried no one would respond. My usual carrier is days late. I need you to deliver this cargo of drone parts to a small station a few jumps from here. We can't afford to pay another carrier, but they will surely tip you generously."
"Great! I uploaded their location to your star map. I'm running out of options, so I have no choice but to trust you'll do what you have agreed to do."
"Fine, I'll keep looking for someone who wishes to make some easy money..."

"Your ship seems reasonably equipped... A freighter carrying a shipment of my goods is a week late. The fools flew through a pirate-filled sector in their haste and I fear for the cargo's safety. I'm looking for a less incompetent captain to investigate."
"At least you're confident, for what little that's worth. Here is their last known location."
"At least YOU are willing to admit your incompetence. Thank you for saving me the cost of paying more fools to go to their death."
You find the small research station and discover that it's putting out a distress signal. Strangely, there is no response to your hails.

choice.text: Dock with the station and investigate.
(Boarding Drone) Use a Drone to investigate.

event.text: You find the station and they respond to your hails immediately, saying, "It took you long enough! We have practically no use for these now... I refuse to pay full price, take this and leave the cargo in our holds."
You drop the parts off and take your pay.

choice.text: Refuse and keep the drone parts.
(Mind Control) Convince him that he's being 'unfair'.

event.text: "I'm being unfair. You did the job and the parts are here safe and sound. Here is the agreed upon amount."

choice.text: (Mind Control Weapon) Convince him that he's being 'unfair'.

event.text: "I'm being unfair. You did the job and the parts are here safe and sound. Here is the agreed upon amount."

choice.text: (Adv. Weapons) Remain silent but power up your weapons.

event.text: "You make a good point. You traveled all the way out here to fulfill our request, despite what must have been... a difficult scenario to cause such a delay. Here, we'll even tip you for the inconvenience you must have gone through..."
"Fine, I was bluffing. I'll pay the full price."
The merchant disconnects in a huff.

You find the remains of the ship. It seems to have severe external damage, but you cannot pinpoint a cause. The majority of its cargo seems intact. You manage to discern the ship's intended destination.

choice.text: Take the cargo and head to its original destination in search of a reward.

event.text: You note down the delivery's intended destination, and load the cargo onto your ship.

You find a severely damaged ship floating among some debris. The crew hails you, "I can't believe that cheap bastard sent someone after us! I thought we would freeze to death. If you help us complete the delivery, we'll share the reward and join your crew."

choice.text: Promise to deliver the cargo and ask if any would be interested in joining your crew.

event.text: They upload the delivery destination once on board. One takes you up on your offer, the rest you drop off at a nearby station.

choice.text: Take the cargo but drop them off at a nearby station.

event.text: After a quick scan, you find a ship being chased by a pirate. This must be the missing delivery ship! You move in to rescue them.
The cargo was some food and medical supplies, nothing that you need right now. You make a note of the delivery destination in case you want to drop off the cargo for the payment.
You find a prototype weapon inside. You quickly install it on the ship.
There were general military supplies in the cargo crates. You take what you can use.

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: You were asked to escort an unprepared vessel to these coordinates.

event.text: You escort the ship to the requested beacon. Much to your dismay you are ambushed by a Rebel ship. You walked right into their trap!

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: You were asked to escort an unprepared vessel to these coordinates.

event.text: Shortly after you arrive, the ship you were escorting jumps nearby. They thank you for your help and offer you a reward.

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: You were asked to escort an unprepared vessel to these coordinates.

event.text: The ship you were escorting thanks you, "I don't think we could have made it without your help. Let my friends patch up some of your hull and show you their wares."

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: You were asked to escort an unprepared vessel to these coordinates.

event.text: You arrive and the ship you were escorting jumps in behind you. "Thanks for the help. We work at a nearby fusion power plant, we could try to improve your reactor's output as a form of compensation."
You pass over the drugs, and wait while the other ship looks them over. "Everything seems to be in check... but I don't think we'll be paying."

choice.text: Raise your weapons and prepare to take the payment from them yourself.

event.text: You're not going to let anyone double cross you, especially not some narcotics addicted scum! You point your weapon array towards them.
You pass over the drugs, and wait while the other ship looks them over. "Everything seems to be in check... job well done."

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: A missing cargo ship intended for delivery of construction materials was last detected here.

event.text: You find the missing cargo ship docked to a Rebel station. You send a short-band message to them and discover they are being held against their will and forced to 'donate to their supplies for the war effort'.

choice.text: Attack the Rebels to help them escape.

event.text: You move in to attack the Rebels that are threatening them and scanners detect weapon locks from a nearby Anti-Ship Battery. It's about to get hectic!
You apologize but it's not worth the risk to attack a Rebel station.

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: A missing cargo ship intended for delivery of construction materials was last detected here.

event.text: You find the missing cargo ship docked to an empty space station. However their hold appears to be empty and there are no obvious signs that anyone is inside the ship or station. Everything looks abandoned.

choice.text: Move in to examine the station.

event.text: You decide it's not worth the time to examine.

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: A missing cargo ship intended for delivery of construction materials was last detected here.

event.text: You find the missing cargo ship floating near the beacon. "Thank heavens! We've been drifting here after using the last of our fuel to escape a pirate raid."
"Great, thank you. Here's some scrap metal for your troubles. Be careful out there."
"Well, I suppose that's better than nothing. Thank you. Hopefully we can find a station at the next Beacon."
"I see..."
With the guard dead, you can easily fire on the station from a distance and take it down. You scrap the remains of both ships.
You attempt to fire on the satellite, but it is better protected than expected. You cannot get through its defenses, so you move on after scrapping the guard.
You are unsuccessful in escaping the Elite. You prepare for battle.
You are unsuccessful in escaping the Elite. You prepare for battle.
You manage to outrun the fleet ship by some odds. You take a moment to catch your breath.
You happen across a small asteroid field near the beacon.

choice.text: Approach the asteroid field to scan it.

event.text: You find a small outpost for local travelers, but it seems few ships in this area employ FTL drives. Their stock of fuel cells is small and their price high, but beggars can't be choosers...
You gladly make the trade.
This fuel won't last long, but you gladly make the trade.
This fuel won't last long, but at least you can jump to another beacon.
No ships respond to your hails and you find nothing of interest.
You wander within scanning range of a small Rebel automated scout!
They pull close to your ship and unload some fuel saying, "Try not to run out of fuel again. These are dangerous times; who knows who could have showed up."
They approach and dock with your ship. On board they present an offer.

As their ship pulls up next to yours, their captain continues, "Yes, we'll certainly help... Help to relieve you of that nice ship!" Sensors detect a hidden teleporter has been activated. We've been boarded!
As they approach, you detect their weapons powering up. It seems their intentions are hostile!
"I assure you that we mean no harm. See, we'll send some fuel over on a transport." A small ship docks and offloads some fuel just as they said. They leave, saying, "Stay cautious, friend."
"No one trusts anyone these days..." The ship jumps away.
They reply, "Keep our distance? Let's see if you can stop us!" They power up their weapons and advance.

Sensors indicate their ship is without military-grade weaponry, even small arms. You allow them to dock and they give you some fuel saying, "I remember a time when we didn't have to be so paranoid about each others' intentions... Stay safe."
Sensors are picking up armed crew and considerably more weaponry than is legal for a craft of this size. This is surely a trap.

choice.text: Power up weapons and prepare for a fight.

event.text: You prepare to battle the pirate.

choice.text: (Cloaking) Cloak and get out of scanning range before they have a chance to lock on.

event.text: Your highly advanced cloaking system allows you to get out of range easily since they were still out of firing range. Eventually the ship jumps away.
They respond: "Seeing that you're in need, is this trade acceptable?"
"I'm not doing this for charity, you know," says their captain. "This is the only other way I'll part with my fuel."
Their captain disconnects from the channel and without another word their ship prepares to jumps away.
Before they jump away, their captain says, "I'm sorry, but we are unable to help in any other way."
They take pity on you and offer you some fuel free of charge.
They end the discussion and prepare to jump away.

A refugee ship fleeing the Rebel advance enters the system, having picked up your distress beacon. While it doesn't have much fuel to spare, it recognizes you are part of the Federation and offers to split its remaining fuel with you.
The refugee ship cuts communications and jumps from the system without another word, the galactic equivalent of giving you the cold shoulder.
The refugees become desperate at your refusal - apparently, their hull is even more damaged than it first appears. Almost begging, they offer a better trade than before.
The refugee ship cuts communications and jumps from the system without another word, the galactic equivalent of giving you the cold shoulder.
The refugee ship makes the exchange, and wishes you well on your mission.
Having traded supplies, the ship suddenly powers up and attacks - it's a pirate ship!
The refugee ship apologizes, but they need their fuel. They wish you well, and then vanish from the system.

Sensing your reluctance, the refugee ship nevertheless parts with a small amount of fuel. It warns you to leave the sector as quickly as possible before it is overtaken by Rebels, then it jumps and vanishes to parts unknown.
Taking your reluctance as weakness, the refugee ship suddenly bristles with weapons - it's a pirate ship, and it believes it's found easy prey!
Taking your reluctance as weakness, the refugee ship suddenly bristles with weapons - it's a pirate ship, and it believes it's found easy prey!
The Engi respond to your signal. "Identity: Federation. I/O error: Federation = [void]." All further hails go unanswered.
The Engi fail to respond, but move to intercept. You detect abnormal electromagnetic signals aboard the ship - someone has reprogrammed them to fight!
The Engi respond to your signal. "Your need: fuel. This unit's need: scrap. Exchange beneficial. Exchange permitted?"
You make the exchange and the Engi leave without another word.
The Engi coolly cut communications and continue on their journey.
Upon discovering your need, the Engi gladly offer some of their extra fuel reserves. It's amazing how altruistic these robotic creatures can be.
A short time later the team returns with a stash of ammunition and scrap - but all the fuel on board is long gone.

One of the crew reports that the main computer was housed in this section and is still partially operational. They're able to download local telemetry as well the location of the ship's reserve fuel! Your map has been updated.
The team returns home rather sooner than expected. Turns out just as they were making entry to the frigate, the ship's emergency fuel cell just happened to drift by!

The away team reports in, but then screams are heard and the comm goes dead! When it comes back online a Rockman can be heard - he's the lone survivor from the frigate's crew, and completely mad. He demands you pay a scrap ransom in return for your crew-member's life!
Despite his fragile condition, the Rockman is good to his word and returns your crew-member, who is suitably grateful. Sadly, gratitude doesn't power the FTL drive.
It's a tough call, but it's for the Federation and the liberty of all. You set off before you can change your mind.

removeCrew.text: Before preparing to jump you check the Clone Bay but there is no sign of activity.

event.text: The Rock ship circles yours, running scans on your systems. You fear the worst, but the scans pause on your fuel tank. They obviously have no wish to communicate, but they transfer over a cache of fuel before flashing their lights and jumping away!
The Rock ship circles yours, running scans on your systems. Your worst fears are confirmed when they identify your engines and teleport a bomb straight onto it! Combat ready!
You attempt to decline, but the Shells won't have it. "We cannot let thhhhis opportunity pass!" They attempt to convince you one more time, but you won't have it. Looks like a fight is unavoidable!
You doubt he is trustworthy but have no choice but to make the deal. However you complete the exchange without event.
Everything looks secure but suddenly a number of supplies disappear! He must have planted a portable teleporter into your cargo bay somehow. Before you can react his ship is long gone.
You doubt he is trustworthy but have no choice but to make the deal. However you complete the exchange without event.

"Do not scoff! This is most serious. I see it in your eyes... Hark, you are but one of them, are you not? A Federation cruiser, sent to bring about the Dynasty's downfall!" The ship arms its weapons. None of this makes any sense, but you'll have to fight it out!
"Beware the heart, traveler! It bleeds, but still it beats!" You assume thats all, but the Ghosts eject a crate of fuel at you, then jump off!

"Lies, lies! You know nothing! The Federation has sheltered you from the heart! The demon's fingers shall grip you and show you no mercy! Consider this a favor!" The Ghost ship suddenly arms its weapons and attacks!
"Good! Then, beware the heart, traveler! It bleeds, but still it beats!" You assume thats all, but the Ghosts eject a crate of fuel at you, then jump off!
The captain struggles to keep the ship on track, but the rest of the crew seems to know something is up and keeps the ship on target.
Your mind control proves effective and the guard ship goes silent.

event.name: GUARD_MIND_AFFECTING_FAILED_MORALITY
event.text: Your weapon strikes the captain, but the rest of the crew notices your weapon in time to avoid it. You're going to have to fight this out!
Your weapon strikes several crewmembers, who begin to argue. The argument quickly escalates into fighting, allowing you the time to slip away.

event.name: GUARD_MIND_AFFECTING_FAILED_MORALITY
event.text: Your weapon strikes the captain, but the rest of the crew notices your weapon in time to avoid it. You're going to have to fight this out!
Your weapon strikes several crewmembers, who begin to argue. The argument quickly escalates into fighting, allowing you the time to slip away.
The captain struggles to keep the ship on track, but the rest of the crew seems to know something is up and keeps the ship on target.
Your mind control proves effective and the guard ship goes silent.
You try to cloak and evade the enemy ship, but their scanners are too good and they lock onto your location!
You try to cloak and evade the enemy ship, but their scanners are too good and they lock onto your location!
You successfully manage to slip past the guard without being noticed.
You try to cloak and evade the enemy ship, but their scanners are too good and they lock onto your location!
You try to cloak and evade the enemy ship, but their scanners are too good and they lock onto your location!
You successfully manage to slip past the guard without being noticed.
You attempt to slip past the guard, but they're faster than expected and catch up to you!
You successfully manage to escape from the guard's range.
You attempt to slip past the guard, but they're faster than expected and catch up to you!
You successfully manage to escape from the guard's range.
"I apologize, but we do not have orders to provide assistance to other ships."
The Militiamen agree to your request, and transfer over a small crate of supplies.
The Militia guard refuses to give in to your demands. Instead, they raise their weapons and retaliate.
Reluctantly, the Militiamen transfer over some supplies, not wanting to battle you.
The Militia guard refuses to give in to your demands. Instead, they raise their weapons and retaliate.
Reluctantly, the Militiamen transfer over some supplies, not wanting to battle you.
Reluctantly, the Militiamen transfer over some supplies, not wanting to battle you.
"I apologize, but we do not have orders to provide assistance to other ships."
The Militiamen agree to your request, and transfer over a small crate of supplies.
The Militia guard refuses to give in to your demands. Instead, they raise their weapons and retaliate.
Reluctantly, the Militiamen transfer over some supplies, not wanting to battle you.
The Militia guard refuses to give in to your demands. Instead, they raise their weapons and retaliate.
Reluctantly, the Militiamen transfer over some supplies, not wanting to battle you.
Reluctantly, the Militiamen transfer over some supplies, not wanting to battle you.
"Transmission received. Apologies, contents of storage intended for visitors = 0%. Requesting that you do not ask again." You decide not to push your luck.
"Identification of visitor = Federation. Protocol requires supplies are: donated."
"Hostile ship poses unfavourable threat level. Despite this: confidence in current defense = high. Preparing combat mode."
"Levels of hostility are 70% above preference. Cargo will be given in return for keeping lives."
"Violent actions are: detected. Preparing offensive reaction." The guard's weapons spring out of the hull and begin to charge!
You can tell the Engi are struggling over whether to honor their programming or give in to your threat. In the end they cave and transfer some supplies.
You can tell the Engi are struggling over whether to honor their programming or give in to your threat. In the end they cave and transfer some supplies.
The Zoltan guard makes no attempt to respond to your hails, and you decide not to try and push your luck further.
"You will be glad to hear not all of your allies' goodwill has dried up. Yes, we will provide some supplies."
The Zoltans make no attempt to respond to your threats, at least not verbally. Instead, they power up their weapons and move in to attack!
"There is no need for violence, friend. We will give you some supplies as you request, so long as you power down those weapons."
"Many apologies, cannot provide supplies. Clan would not appreciate giving away things..."
The Free Mantis gladly give you some supplies, honored to be of assistance to a Federation vessel.
"Federation never selfish or greedy! You not Federation ship, must be Hive spy! We kill you!"
"You are needing supplies? Most certainly! Please, take all we have! Federation heroes, happy to help." It appears they didn't understand your intentions, but you aren't complaining.
"Federation supposed be hero! You certainly not hero. You shameful, we destroy you and bring heads to true Federation vessel!"
The Free Mantis are confused and afraid as to why you betrayed them, but they oblige and give you some supplies.
The Free Mantis are confused and afraid as to why you betrayed them, but they oblige and give you some supplies.
"Though it's quite interesting to discover new people, I'm afraid we cannot spare any supplies."
"You wish for some supplies? Most certainly! It is not often I get the opportunity to make new friends!"
"You insult our entire species with your demands! We refuse to allow someone such as yourself continue into our sector and wreck havoc!"
"Is it customary here to make such rude demands towards strangers? Disgusting... but we do not wish to have any issues. Take this and be gone."
The Crystals don't take well to your threats. Rather than complying, they raise their guns and attack.
"I was right to assume you troglodytes were not above barbaric savagery! Take these supplies and leave at once."
"I was right to assume you troglodytes were not above barbaric savagery! Take these supplies and leave at once."
The Orchid shakes their head, signifying that they have no supplies to spare.
The Orchid nods and the guard transfer over some supplies.
The Orchids aren't a hostile race, but when you come into their sector and start making demands you can expect they're going to retaliate.
The Orchids don't wish to fight. They give over some supplies.
The Orchids aren't a hostile race, but when you come into their sector and start making demands you can expect they're going to retaliate.
The Orchids don't wish to fight. They give over some supplies.
The Orchids don't wish to fight. They give over some supplies.
"I would prefer we kept our relations with the Federation as were previously settled. Consider the gift of safety in our lands a fair consolation."

"It is unusual for the Federation to come here, and uncharacteristic for them to request aid from a people with little to offer in material. However, I am a believer that good actions are a cycle, and though my brothers and sisters might not agree, I will oblige your request."

"For all the time we have lived in these lands, never once has the Federation made such demands! Why should this day be any different? You insult us with your words, and we are not people who would let such insults go without consequences."

"Careful with your wording. We are peaceful people, yes, but we come from places of great disturbance. I shall choose to ignore your tone and offer this, but take with it this advice. Such aggression will do you no good among my people, and perhaps I am a fool for letting you past."
"There is no place in these lands for 'powerful' men like you who would rather pillage than provide. It is in the name of good that I will strike your vessel down."

"Your people dare so much as call us the barbarians, but it is your actions that prove you are the savages! Had I any less desire to see my brothers and sisters again, I wouldn't be so kind as to give in to your disgusting threats."

"Your people dare so much as call us the barbarians, but it is your actions that prove you are the savages! Had I any less desire to see my brothers and sisters again, I wouldn't be so kind as to give in to your disgusting threats."
"Sorry, but I cannot give anythhhhhhing." The Shell mutes your ship.
"Sorry, but I cannot give anythhhhhhing." The Shell mutes your ship.
To your surprise, the Shells transfer over some supplies. You wonder if they're doing it out of kindness, or out of fear.
Despite the Shells being known for their 'cowardice', this guard isn't putting up with you. They arm their weapons, and you should do the same.
Fearful of you, the Shells transfer over the supplies willingly.
Despite the Shells being known for their 'cowardice', this guard isn't putting up with you. They arm their weapons, and you should do the same.
Fearful of you, the Shells transfer over the supplies willingly.
Fearful of you, the Shells transfer over the supplies willingly.
"You cannot fool me! I know you are Federation, I'm not naive enough to fall for your lies!"
"You cannot fool me! I know you are Federation, I'm not naive enough to fall for your lies!"
"Perhaps I am mistaken. Though I doubt you are who you say, I do not wish to suffer punishment from killing a fellow Rebel. You may pass."

"An MFK? Well, you should have no issue telling me your serial number." Your MFK tells you the serial number is likely blacklisted, which is confirmed when the attempt is made. "Aha! Your capture will make my commanding officers very pleased!"

"My mistake! I should have checked first. Please, don't report this. You'll... understand, won't you?" The guard clears his throat as some scrap is dispensed towards your ship. You scoop up the bribe and carry on.

"My mistake! I should have checked first. Please, don't report this. You'll... understand, won't you?" The guard clears his throat as some scrap is dispensed towards your ship. You scoop up the bribe and carry on.
Your attempts at hacking the drone were ineffective. The ship continues its attack.
Your hacking manages to get past the automated ship's mainframe and disable the ship long enough for you to slip past.
You target the drone with your hacking weapon, but it was ineffective. The ship continues its attack.
You target the drone with your hacking weapon, but it was ineffective. The ship continues its attack.
Your weapon successfully disables the drone long enough for you to slip past.
"It is not our fault you have distanced yourself from the Elders' words! Your death here is your own doing!"

"I see you have made the mistake of letting yourself stray from the words of the Elders! I am most forgiving, I will give you this one chance to live in hopes you will use it wisely. Best of wishes, brother."

The guard squints at Mafan. "You're not on my list, but the Theocracy recognizes your insights as valuable..." The guard hesitates and then shrugs. "You may pass. But keep your presence in this sector to an absolute minimum."

The guard squints at Mafan. "You're not on my list. The Theocracy recognizes your insights as valuable... but that's not good enough for me to allow a heretic aligned vessel through." Even though the guard rejected Mafan's request, it seems like they're not aggressive yet.
"A civilian of the Gathering is still a civilian of the Federation! We have no obligation to trust you!"
"Tread with care, Orchid. You may be our allies, but don't think your Federation friends will be tolerated by us." The Rocks let you pass.
"You have been poisoned by the Federation's lies! We would sacrifice millions of our own kind in order to take down the Federation, and you are not immune!"
"I pity you, poor creature, who has so clearly been poisoned by the Federation's lies. Though you are ignorant, I shall not harm my own kind. Leave, before I change my mind."
The enemy Suzerain spits when he sees your crew. "Traitorous scum! You work on Federation ship, you betray hive!"
"One of Hive work on your ship? Very strange! You must be covert ship. I not interrupt longer."
"Y-yes. Of course, Captain, we'll... we'll let you through."
"Your name means nothing anymore, 'Captain'. You'll pay us, or you'll die!"

event.name: GUARD_VAMPWEED_WAVER_FAIL
event.text: "Why should I wave your fee? You are a Renegade, correct? If you are not aware, the Confederacy is not beholden to Federation laws, and frankly having people like you here is a liability. We should be charging you more, not less."

choice.text: Then we'll fight our way through!

event.text: You mute the ship and prepare for combat.
The Vampweed nods and combs over the scrap for a brief moment. "Very well. Security will let you through momentarily."

The Vampweed scratches the long petals on their face with their vines. "As you are likely aware, the Confederacy is not beholden to Federation laws or jurisdiction. That said, I understand that your cause represents the best interests of everyone here. The Federation might not be our friend, but the Rebellion is more certainly our enemy. I will do you this one favor, but do not expect everyone to be so generous."
"There exists no mercy in hell, so shan't I not give it here? Cause erupt a mighty panic if allowing any of yours through these gates! One of us or not, you see not a glint of care in mine eyes!"
"It is far from protocol to allow the passing of any vessel bearing the Federation banner. Yet, your crew makes me question your interest in bringing harm to my people. Do not make me regret this."
The civilians stutter, not sure how to respond. A hacker ship uncloaks nearby, its entire arsenal aimed at you. "Sssscrew thisss, thesse onessss asssk too many quesssstionss."
"We-we are getting word from our s-superiors. They're s-saying.. that the price... can be l-lowered..."
A hacker ship uncloaks nearby. "Thankssss for your patronage! Enjoy the ssssector!"
A hacker ship uncloaks nearby. "You Fedsss are jusssst too ssstubborn to play along, aren't you?"
As you're attempting to flee, a Hacker ship uncloaks and stops you! "You cannot run from ussss captain! We will get our ssscrap one way or another." Scans show they've disrupted the engines!
The Anti-Virus works its magic and counters the digital assault without any problems.
The Hacker ship's virus is much harder to purge than you expected, and you have to overclock the hacking system. Your engines return to normal, but your hacking has taken a huge loss.

You fly past the outpost. They make no attempt to stop you, though a hacker ship uncloaks and tries to block you. You collide with their hull, taking minor damage, but continue on your path, leaving them behind in the dust.
The Vampweed guard refuses to give in to your demands. Instead, they raise their weapons and retaliate.
The Vampweed guard looks angry, but decides that the cost of giving you supplies is less than the cost of fighting you.
The Zoltan looks down at a clipboard for a long time. "We have deemed your response... unsatisfactory." Their weapons go online, and it seems a fight is unavoidable!
The Zoltan looks down at a clipboard for a long time. "Your response has been deemed satisfactory. You may continue."

You try your best to lie, but you're entirely unconvincing. Already skeptical, it only takes a few more questions for the Outcasts to annihilate your story. "You seek to take advantage of us with falsehoods! You are no better than the Theocracy, and thus you deserve no fate better than death!"
The Outcasts seem to believe you. "Thank the stars. You have brought peace of mind to us. Let us reward you for this good news." Hopefully this doesn't come back to bite you any time soon.

You try your best to lie, but you're entirely unconvincing. Already skeptical, it only takes a few more questions for the Outcasts to annihilate your story. "You seek to take advantage of us with falsehoods! You are no better than the Theocracy, and thus you deserve no fate better than death!"

The Outcasts seem to believe you. "If what you say is true, then we must arm ourselves at once. I'm afraid there is no time to be spared when there is the threat of an invasion up ahead. You have our thanks. It is best you arm yourself too."

Though most Duskbringers wear specialized armor with a built-in bomb pack, it is not unbelievable for a standard Zoltan to side with the Dusks. As such, the guard here believes your crew and gives a small helping of supplies before rushing off to assist in the battle.
It appears the guard does not believe your bluff, but is too busy handling the Rebels to do anything about it. You are left behind while the ship rushes on to fight.
"I wish we could, but we can't spare any. We hope you understand."
"We have enough of a surplus. One moment." The Praetors send a cache of missiles and scrap to your ship.
"Sssssorry, but we will not change our pricessss."
"Ah, I ssssee you are a massster negotiator. Yesss yesss, I think we will give you a dissscount. How doesss 100% off sssound?"

choice.text: Then we'll just fight our way through!

event.text: "Ssome people are jussst so temperamental. It'ssss mere pocket change!" You give the Slugs no chance to negotiate and attack.
"You... you are actually paying? What a sssstrange creature you are. Very sssstupid too, I'd imagine."
"Nightssss... How dissssgussssting. Everything got worsssse when you took over. Sssstill, I acknowledge your right to free passssage here. Now get out of my ssssight."
"Sssso, you jusssst drop yoursssself into my lap, do you? How lucky. For me, that issss!"
"Hmmmm... no."
"Ooooh, shiny metals. You bring good gift! You may live."
"Ooooh, shiny metals. You bring good gift! You may live."
The enemy Mantis spits when he sees your crew. "Traitorous scum! You work on Federation ship, you betray hive!"
"One of Hive work on your ship? Very strange! You must be covert ship. I not interrupt longer."

"I see you have received a thorough brainwashing at the hands of the corrupt Federation. A shame that a weak minded peasant such as yourself must be tainted. The Inquisition shall make quick work of you all."

"I see you have received a thorough brainwashing at the hands of the corrupt Federation. A shame that a weak minded peasant such as yourself must be tainted. The Inquisition shall make quick work of you all."

It takes an in-depth conversation between the two Rockmen before any progress can be made. "You have... you have presented ideas of a reality vastly different from the one I have been raised to believe in. Yet... there is a ring of truth to your nonsensical spewings. I must think this over. I will come with you, so that I may experience the outside world myself and decide what I shall believe."

The Crystals will have none of it. "You are naive. Though you claim that you will bring no harm to us, your mere presence here will drag the Rebels closer! You are a threat to our security, and we cannot allow you to pass!"

The Crystals will have none of it. "You are naive. Though you claim that you will bring no harm to us, your mere presence here will drag the Rebels closer! You are a threat to our security, and we cannot allow you to pass!"

"You speak words that you cannot verify. Though your intentions may be all but bad, you will surely bring chaos with you one way or another. This may be our fatal mistake, but we will give you the benefit of the doubt despite this. Let us both hope you can prove that this was not merely a rash decision on our behalf."

You aren't sure whether you accidentally offended the Lanius with something you said, insulted them by trying to contact them, or if they always had hostile intentions, but the Lanius guard doesn't waste any more time and attacks you.

You aren't sure whether you accidentally offended the Lanius with something you said, insulted them by trying to contact them, or if they always had hostile intentions, but the Lanius guard doesn't waste any more time and attacks you.
"Ship, talk. Surprise, bring shock great. Need... things? Givings." A few supplies fly out of an airlock on the Lanius ship, and you scoop up the supplies.

You hold your breath in anticipation, but the smugglers briefly inspect only your crew. "Federation personnel, huh?" Your heart beats faster, but the smuggler just laughs. "Hey now, I'm not one to judge. I'll let you through, all are welcome here, long as you ain't on the blacklist."

You hold your breath in anticipation, but the smugglers briefly inspect only your crew. "Federation personnel, huh?" Your heart beats faster, but the smuggler just laughs. "Hey now, I'm not one to judge. I'll let you through, all are welcome here, long as you ain't on the blacklist."

You hold your breath in anticipation, but the smugglers briefly inspect only your crew. "Federation personnel, huh?" Your heart beats faster, but the smuggler just laughs. "Hey now, I'm not one to judge. I'll let you through, all are welcome here, long as you ain't on the blacklist."

The smugglers don't even ask to investigate your cargo as you thought they would. Instead they look your crew over. They stop and pause, looking down at their list. "This one! He's on the blacklist. You aren't welcome here!"

"I've got my eyes on you, machine. We know better than to step aboard and discover whatever nasty surprises you usually harbor, so let's make it quick." Your vessel gets thorougly scanned. You suspect this might backfire, but you're eventually cleared to go.

"I've got my eyes on you, machine. We know better than to step aboard and discover whatever nasty surprises you usually harbor, so let's make it quick." Your vessel gets thorougly scanned. You suspect this might backfire, but you're eventually cleared to go.

"I've got my eyes on you, machine. We know better than to step aboard and discover whatever nasty surprises you usually harbor, so let's make it quick." Your vessel gets thorougly scanned. You suspect this might backfire, but you're eventually cleared to go.
The smugglers don't even inquire further as you thought they would. Instead, they prime their weapons! "We've had enough of you robotic vermins probing around our operations! Prepare to be swatted!"

"Nights?" There is a pregnant pause. The other side is briefly muted. Eventually their audio comes back. "You may pass. Your reputation is... enough for us to let you through. But watch yourself."
			
			"You firsssst."
The guard chuckles. "Oh, now this is a real treat. I've always wanted to be the one to shove your head on a pike. Prepare to die, Nights!"
It seems the wreck of Callie contains a special modified weapon, which you bring aboard.
As you start to leave, you do one more once-over of the wreckage and are surprised to find an item left behind that you missed!

You find the remains of a unique augment amongst the ruins of the ship, but it appears it did not survive the fight. You'll have to be more careful next time, or get lucky. Fortunately, there's still a bit more supplies to take with you.
You detect faint life-signs amongst the ruins of the ship, but it appears they're fading fast. Fortunately, there's still a bit more supplies to take with you.
You detect faint life-signs amongst the ruins of the ship, but it appears they're fading fast. Fortunately, there's still a bit more supplies to take with you.
You quickly fire up your engines and make a break for it. However, it seems to be in vain. They catch up to you effortlessly and power up their weapons.
You divert all available power to your engines and flee. You caught them off-guard, but they seem to be gaining on you. Luckily you are able to stay out of range long enough to charge the FTL drive.
You fire up the engines and try to escape. Their slower ship is unable to keep pace; eventually it gives up and returns to the beacon to await an easier target.
The pirates aren't fazed by your threats, and instead power up their weapons as well!
"Ok, ok! We get it, you aren't messing around. Sorry to bother you."
Your pilot succeeds in getting away from the pirate without taking damage.
Despite some fancy flying, the pirate catches up to you before you can leave the asteroid field. You have no choice but to fight.

You beam a small team into their holds. They work quickly to free the slaves and teleport back to your ship. One of the captives seems fit for battle and you throw them a weapon in preparation for a fight.

You teleport an away team into their hold to attempt to free their prisoners. They are able to get to one person before being caught and forced into a corner by the crew. You quickly beam the team and prisoner back to your ship.

You beam a team onto their ship. However, your estimations of the location of their prisoners was off. By the time they get their bearings the slavers spot them. You beam them back to the ship and prepare for a fight.
Unfortunately, the ruins don't contain anything exciting. Any tech has been dismantled, so you content yourself with taking some resources that were left behind.

The ruins only contain a single weapon crate left behind, but to your disappointment it appears to have belonged to some pirate who stashed it here to hide. It might not be ancient tech, but it's still a free weapon.

You don't find any weapons or drones, but you do find a damaged combustion engine in there that resembles a modern engine system in some capacity. You strip it for parts, intended to upgrade yours with what remains.
Alas, the ruins yield no military weaponry. You do however discover an incredibly advanced generator. With these parts, maybe you can improve your own!

While salvaging the ruins, you find a strange triangular drone. With some tinkering, you even get it to function for a short while. You run some scans and construct a schematic to bring back to the ship.

While exploring the ruins, you nearly mistake a drone for a statue before you recognize a dim glow from its lights. A cylindrical design with 2 rings, the drone appears to be designed to interface with a system to manage it. You construct a schematic using some scans and bring it back to the ship.

You're amazed to find an armory inside the structure, but unfortunately most of the weapons inside are completely dysfunctional. You do however find a Laser of some sort that you bring back to the ship.
A still functional Bomb launcher, similar to modern ones yet very old, is laying in a central chamber in the structure. You bring it back to the ship.
Unfortunately, the ruins don't contain anything exciting. Any tech has been dismantled, so you content yourself with taking some resources that were left behind.

The ruins only contain a single weapon crate left behind, but to your disappointment it appears to have belonged to some pirate who stashed it here to hide. It might not be ancient tech, but it's still a free weapon.

You don't find any weapons or drones, but you do find a damaged combustion engine in there that resembles a modern engine system in some capacity. You strip it for parts, intended to upgrade yours with what remains.
Alas, the ruins yield no military weaponry. You do however discover an incredibly advanced generator. With these parts, maybe you can improve your own!

You pry open the ruins only to find an ancient Phantom Alpha, who claims to come all the way back from an ancient war. Having been trapped in the ruin for centuries, they're a bit mentally questionable but more than eager to work for you.
A still functional Bomb launcher, similar to modern ones yet very old, is laying in a central chamber in the structure. You bring it back to the ship.
Looks like a weapon is mounted on a wall of the structure inside a vast armory. The technology is beyond that which you recognize, but you bring it aboard to investigate later.

While salvaging the ruins, you find a strange triangular drone. With some tinkering, you even get it to function for a short while. You run some scans and construct a schematic to bring back to the ship.

While exploring the ruins, you nearly mistake a drone for a statue before you recognize a dim glow from its lights. A cylindrical design with 2 rings, the drone appears to be designed to interface with a system to manage it. You construct a schematic using some scans and bring it back to the ship.
