You're amazed to find an armory inside the structure, but unfortunately most of the weapons inside are completely dysfunctional. You do however find a Laser of some sort that you bring back to the ship.
A still functional Bomb launcher, similar to modern ones yet very old, is laying in a central chamber in the structure. You bring it back to the ship.
With some amount of grace, your crew manage to drift through the field without setting off any explosives. Disarming as many as they can, they bring back an impressive haul.

Your crew are less than graceful navigating the field, almost setting the entire thing off twice. At last, they push their luck for the final time, and one of your crew is blown into chunks! You can hear the rest of the team screaming in terror through the radio, but you silence them and order them back to the ship immediately with however much they've already collected.

removeCrew.text: Fortunately your crew has been revived by the Clone Bay, though they request they get a pass from the next salvaging mission.

event.text: Your crew manage to disarm a lot of mines before they return, but spot something in the center. It's a Mine Launcher, the tool used to lay the field! Now that there's less mines, you can pilot closer and grab it, but risk setting off the remainders of the field with your ship.
You grab the Mine Launcher and leave the field, only to accidentally trip one of them on the way out! Luckily the resulting explosion isn't too catastrophic, but it still hurts.
Your crew dig around the ship, but find all of the crew dead and anything of value gone. You resort to scrapping the hull instead.
While exploring the interior, your crew find a lone survivor. Though they might have once been a pirate, they're more than willing to work for you.
Your crew find an entire functional weapon left behind in the ship's storage! They haul it back to the ship in triumph.

It looks like most of the ship has been stripped bare. However, the cargo bay is still locked, and it doesn't look like anyone's broken in yet. It wouldn't be too hard for you to do so, do you wish to proceed?

You delicately cut your way through the door, but the second you step inside a trap is triggered! "Screw you, thieves!" shouts an automated message, followed by an explosion that rips one of your crew apart. Though the loss is terrible, it doesn't seem to be followed by any further repercussions, leaving you to take all that remains.

removeCrew.text: Fortunately, your Clone Bay is already in the process of reviving your crew.

event.text: Your crew is able to slip easily past the door and get inside, where they find a trap that they quickly defuse. Now that it's safe to enter, the rest of the crew follow and take all that they can.

choice.text: (Rock Crew) Send in your Rock first.

event.text: Your crew is able to easily bash the door open and get inside, but the second they step inside a trap is triggered! "Screw you, thieves!" shouts an automated message, followed by an explosion. Your crew member fortunately appears to only have flinched and is still whole. Now that it's safe to enter, the rest of the crew follow and take all that they can.

Your crew board the ship, but find it mostly empty. However, there's a very unpleasant stench in the air. Your crew open one of the storage cabinets only to find the rotting corpse in there, as well as what look to be... giant alien spiders?!
You are undisturbed as you scrap the ship.
Your crew manage to pry open the doors to the cache, and find a supply of missiles and fuel within! It's not a ton, but it's enough to bring back everything to the ship.

The signal appears to have been a distress signal, muffled by the special armor on the cache! The sender's corpse lays discarded among a pile of used up rations, likely trapped here on accident. Your crew is nervous stepping inside and only return with a few scroungings.
To your luck, the cache appears to have once been a Rebel weapons cache abandoned after the Civil War! You find a weapon still functional despite its age and bring it back with you.

The cache appears to have belonged to some civilians, based on the odd assortment of household items. Possibly a last-resort bunker from the Civil War? Not much is of use to you besides an old map, which while outdated seems accurate enough for you to use.

As you peel open the cache doors, you hear a voice gasping for air and a person comes clawing their way out, clutching a respirator to their chest. Seems the signal you found earlier was a distress signal, barely managing to pierce its way through the shell. The cache is empty now, but the rattled survivor once recovered seems willing to help you.

The cache door appears quite well secured, but you test your luck in opening it anyways. Almost immediately after the doors are opened half way an explosion sends your crew tumbling into space, destroying the life support of the one standing closest. Once you've recovered from the event, you survey the damage and find the boobytrapped cache's contents are no more.

removeCrew.text: Fortunately, your crew member has already cloned by the time you return to the ship.

event.text: Your drone manages to pry open the doors to the cache, and finds a supply of missiles and fuel within! It's not a ton, but it's enough to bring back everything to the ship.

The signal appears to have been a distress signal, muffled by the special armor on the cache! The sender's corpse lays discarded among a pile of used up rations, likely trapped here on accident. Your fearless drone recovers as much as its carrying capacity allows it to.
To your luck, the cache appears to have once been a Rebel weapons cache abandoned after the Civil War! Your drone finds a weapon still functional despite its age and brings it back to you.

The cache appears to have belonged to some civilians, based on the odd assortment of household items. Possibly a last-resort bunker from the Civil War? Not much is of use to you besides an old map, which while outdated seems accurate enough for you to use.

As your drone blasts open the cache doors, you hear a voice gasping for air and a person comes clawing their way out, clutching a respirator to their chest. Seems the signal you found earlier was a distress signal, barely managing to pierce its way through the shell. The cache is empty now, but the rattled survivor once recovered seems willing to help you.

The cache door appears quite well secured, but you test your luck in opening it anyways. Almost immediately after the doors are opened half way an explosion sends your drone tumbling into space, destroying its circuitry. Once you've recovered from the event, you survey the damage and find the boobytrapped cache's contents are no more.

While in the process of raiding for valuables, a small elderly monk you didn't notice before spots you and protests softly. You ignore him, knowing he's incapable of doing anything to stop you, but this probably won't reflect so well on your mission.
Unfortunately, your search yields nothing but disappointment. It's not to be unexpected the shrine has nothing of value for a military vessel, but it doesn't make your empty hands hurt any less.

You find a few small Aether trinkets: nothing big enough to reverse engineer into tech, but certainly worth something to pawn off. The rest of your search reveals nothing of value, but at least you aren't going back empty handed.
You find a small collection of fuel cells for weary travelers passing by, next to a sign asking politely that you only take as many as you need.
You only grab a couple fuel cells, just enough to make it a few extra jumps, and head back to the ship on a clear conscience.

choice.text: Take as many as you can.

event.text: You grab as many fuel cells as you can carry, emptying the tub by quite a bit. While this will top off your engines nicely, you can't help but feel like you're being judged by some invisible force from around the corner, some ancient eyes piercing through you. Creeped out and suddenly no longer sure you're truly alone, you hurry back to the ship.
You allow your Zoltan a few moments to utter a prayer to the shrine. Satisfied, they get up and return to the ship and you prepare to carry on.

You allow your Zoltan a few moments to utter a prayer to the shrine. In doing so, you gain the attention of a small elderly monk who you didn't notice before. "Eh...? Visitors? It's been so long since I've seen people..." The monk looks at your Zoltan praying. "I see you are people of good faith. I appreciate that. Perhaps I will come with you, and remind myself what the galaxy looks like."

You allow your Zoltan a few moments to utter a prayer to the shrine. As you approach however, a small Zoltan Auto-craft reveals itself from hiding. "Federation ally, the Ministry has granted this vessel the capabilities to aid any craft carrying those of the Illesctrian faith." The ship extends several appendages and begins to repair your hull, free of charge.

Ancient graffiti has tattooed the worn walls of the abandoned structures, the last remains of voices that have been silenced. You find a few skeletons, indicating that this place must have been abandoned for a long time. Careful not to disrupt the dead, you stick to essential spots and scavenge some loose supplies around the camp.

"Damn the Federation! You abandoned us when we needed you most, and now you come back only when we're on the brink of death!" Some hidden sentry gun that escaped your initial scans activates and fires on your ship! You escape with only minor damage but quite startled.

There's clear signs of disease having once swept this camp. Your crew acts cautiously, but all of the colonists are so long dead it seems improbable any virus could remain. A worn-out doctor drone, overwhelmed by so many patients, now lies dormant next to the local clinic. You grab the drone and head back to the ship.

You're startled by the sounds of footsteps and find a worn-out but young outcast amongst the ruins. "Stay back! I'm armed!" You assure him you're no threat and he calms down. "I was told this place was a sanctuary for any lost travelers looking for a new home. Instead, I have only found decay and lost hope. I was prepared to make a new life here, but if this will not be my sanctuary, then perhaps you might be instead?"

While exploring the colony, you're suddenly jumped by a band of armed Rebels! "Ruins like this are the byproduct of the Federation's own neglect of its citizens! When the Civil War was afoot, the Rebellion ensured the safety of its people, but where were you? You were busy protecting your xeno aristocrats from the will of humanity!"

You and your crew explore the center. You come across a baseball diamond, and are stopped by a team of Zoltan. They claim that they need to face another team in order to experience the Human game of baseball.

As you play against them, the Zoltan captain continually condescends you and the staff of the rec center. The Zoltan prattles on and on, saying that the game is typical human juvenility and that your tactics are limited and short sighted. After your landslide victory, their shortstop pledges to join your crew. "I have seen the light! By watching you win against a vastly superior foe, you have proven that the Power of Friendship can overcome any obstacle!"

Your crew stays in the stands watching other tourists play. Your crew ask you to go get some popcorn, so you head to the concession stand. While you're there, however, you get caught up in a conversation with a middle aged man, who yaps your ear off about his 5-year old daughter the whole time. Once he realizes he made you miss the game, he offers to have his station give you some extra fuel as an apology.
You and your crew explore the center. You end up in an arcade, filled with fighting game cabinets. There's a few players who seem to be free for an open player.

You challenge the human. You are immediately destroyed on your first match, and the human starts using weaker and weaker characters to defeat you. After wrecking you a dozen times, he looks over at you in curiosity, before realizing you're a Renegade. "Huh. Never expected to meet a multiversal traveler in the middle of an arcade. You... want some scrap? Yeah, of course you do. I'll make this much from donos after I talk about this on stream anyway."
"Archive has the best arcades! I'm addicted to these." She seems to be experienced at this. You come close, but you never quite manage to beat her. "Hey, let's play this next match for money!"
You play, but you still aren't able to beat her. However, she seems to have a lot of fun. "That was great! Uh, by the way. I'm actually kind of in a bit of debt. You mind if I tag along with you?"
The two of you continue to play for fun. You even manage to beat her once or twice, but you suspect she might be trying to let your guard down.

You and your crew explore the center. An Archive employee offers you and your crew vouchers for a ride on a roller coaster. You consider hopping on with your crew, but spot a Zoltan pacing back and forth near the ride entrance.
Your crew spend some time zooming around the tracks, enjoying the sights, sounds and people. Ultimately, you don't end up doing much socializing, but your crew seemed to have enjoyed themselves.

choice.text: Offer your voucher to the Zoltan.

event.text: You offer your pass to the Zoltan, who mutters some excuses about trade regulations on gifts before capitulating and riding with your crew. After getting off, the Zoltan staggers over to you, flickering with exertion - "You Humans certainly don't show much concern over the dangers your own entertainment exposes you to. Perhaps that bravado is why you're still standing after all your mistakes." Still, before he stumbles off, he mumbles that he'll have a gratuity dropped off at your ship.

The ship you're raiding is automated, but its sensors detect you. It automatically sends a notification that you're engaging in piracy, which will trigger the planetary defense system that Detritus had set up.

choice.text: (Signal Diluter) Drown out the signal long enough to finish your raid.

event.text: While your crime will be noticed in the long run, you may as well profit off of this raid in the short term.
You keep your Signal Diluter active as you send in a shuttle to do some shopping before you leave.
You won't be able to buy anything in this state. It looks like you'll have to focus your attention on leaving.

It takes a few moments for the freighter you begin stealing from to respond, but eventually they catch wind of your raid. They broadcast a notification that you're engaging in piracy, which will trigger the planetary defense system that Detritus had set up.

The freighter takes a moment to process what you are doing, and promptly sends its crew in a shuttle to the station directly. You'll still have enough time to get out of here before their shuttle can inform the station of your misdeeds.
You won't be able to buy anything in this state. It looks like you'll have to focus your attention on leaving.

"Confirmation suggests prior theory was incorrect. Thank you for your evaluation." Now satisfied, the Engi allow the "not Separatists" in to trade. Realizing you must have vouched for them, the Separatists discreetly offer you a gift while browsing the marketplace.

"Evaluation: inaccurate. Federation vessel suspected of lying or being very stupid. Punishment: death." A harsh punishment - but it seems to extend to the Separatist as well! An ASB shot nearly takes out their ship and the survivor climbs aboard yours, but now you have to get out of here!
Unfortunately for you, the stereotype of Zoltans taking crap from noone applies to this ship as well. No one's getting anything out of them without a fight!
"Fascist scum, working aboard a Federation vessel. Oh the number of protocols this violates, not to mention the ethical quandries! Fine, take my goods. But the Ministry will hear of this!"
The Monk scoops up the scrap metal, smiling wide at you, but says nothing more. Slightly annoyed, you move past and visit the store.

The Monk scoops up the scrap metal, smiling wide at you. "Oh, you are so generous, so kind! May your journeys be blessed!" Confused, you move past the monk, taking note of how much happier you suddenly feel.
The Monk gives you a nasty look and folds his robed arms, but says nothing. You move past and visit the store.

"Gah, curse you! You show no kindness to others. May your journeys be filled with ruin!" You brush the Monk's harsh words off as nonsense, but you notice you feel much gloomier as you approach the market...
The other Monk looks disappointed, but nods. "Yes, yes. Safe travels, brother."

"I was not aware we so openly joined Federation vessels. Perhaps it should allow our teachings to spread further than before? I think I shall come with you, a change of scenery could do me good, and I don't wish to return to those awful nebulas for much longer."
The guards pull back satisfied. "Apologies captain. An increase in pirate activity in these sectors warrants suspicion. Your crew have been cleared, you will be permitted to shop here."
The guards pull back satisfied. "Apologies captain. An increase in pirate activity in these sectors warrants suspicion. Your crew have been cleared, you will be permitted to shop here."
The guards pull back, holding on to one of your crew. "This one here is a fugitive of the Zoltan Ministry. Turn them in and there will be no further consequences for your vessel or crew."
The Zoltans drag off your crew. "Against my better judgement, you will still be permitted to shop here. Do not let us catch you harboring fugitives again, understand?"

removeCrew.text: Your crew member cannot be cloned as they are not dead. A long life in Ministry prison awaits them now...

event.text: Your crew push off the guards and draw your weapons. Looks like a fight is nigh!

Your Zoltan slowly puts down their gun and speaks to the guards. At first their arguments don't seem to have an effect, but explaining the Federation needs all the help it can get - ANY kind of help - they seem to relent.
Nervously, you land as far away from the fire as possible and visit the store. Fortunately, when you return the fire has been contained to only two-thirds of the market place and your ship is fine.

Nervously, you land as far away from the fire as possible and visit the store. However, when you return you see the landing pad has caught ablaze! Running through the fire, you make your way back onto the ship, but a portion of it has already caught fire!

You dock with the station and step aboard, and an alarm starts ringing almost immediately! A set of Crystal guards come to face you, but fortunately they're level headed enough to listen to your explanation. Looks like this is an ordinary market after-all!

You step aboard, only to find a band of pirates huddled around a garbage fire while a cage of Crystals look on in despair. As soon as you approach, the pirates draw their guns. "Who the hell are you, identify yourself!"

choice.text: Calm down, we're here to trade.

event.text: You put down your laser, and the pirates cautiously stow theirs. "Alright. Lucky for you, this place is under new management. We got some... "workers" on sale too."

choice.text: We don't want your slaves. We're here for military goods.

event.text: "Ew, you're one of them ethical folk. Whatever, as long as I have scrap in my heap I'm not complaining."
"Are you a Federation captain or a pirate? Hah!" You ignore the laughing pirate and escort your new crew to the ship, then return to observe the market.
You won't stand for this! You open fire on the station.
You come back from the store to find the Mantis have already finished. Fortunately, they've done better than you expected. "Making sure you are giving us 5 star review, and seeing you next time!"
You come back from the store to find the Mantis have already finished. Fortunately, they've done better than you expected. "Making sure you are giving us 5 star review, and seeing you next time!"
You come back from the store to find the Mantis have already finished. Fortunately, they've done better than you expected. "Making sure you are giving us 5 star review, and seeing you next time!"

You come back from the store to find the Mantis have already finished. Unfortunately, it seems they haven't done a very good job. Not only is the ship roughed up in a few spots, but they haven't repaired as much hull as promised either. "Making sure you are giving us 5 star review, and seeing you next time!"
"Oh, you are wanting the money back? We done hard working here, and you not liking it? Hmph. Only offering partially refund."
You begrudgingly take the refund and carry on to the store.

choice.text: Bastards, blow them all to hell!

event.text: It very well may be a drastic overreaction, but you won't take this kind of incompetence when handling a military ship lightly.

choice.text: Bastards, blow them all to hell!

event.text: It very well may be a drastic overreaction, but you won't take this kind of incompetence when handling a military ship lightly.
You come back from the store to find the Mantis have already finished. Fortunately, they've done better than you expected. "Making sure you are giving us 5 star review, and seeing you next time!"
You come back from the store to find the Mantis have already finished. Fortunately, they've done better than you expected. "Making sure you are giving us 5 star review, and seeing you next time!"
You come back from the store to find the Mantis have already finished. Fortunately, they've done better than you expected. "Making sure you are giving us 5 star review, and seeing you next time!"

You come back from the store to find the Mantis have already finished. Unfortunately, it seems they haven't done a very good job. Not only is the ship roughed up in a few spots, but they haven't repaired as much hull as promised either. "Making sure you are giving us 5 star review, and seeing you next time!"
"Oh, you are wanting the money back? We done hard working here, and you not liking it? Hmph. Only offering partially refund."
You begrudgingly take the refund and carry on to the store.

choice.text: Bastards, blow them all to hell!

event.text: It very well may be a drastic overreaction, but you won't take this kind of incompetence when handling a military ship lightly.

choice.text: Bastards, blow them all to hell!

event.text: It very well may be a drastic overreaction, but you won't take this kind of incompetence when handling a military ship lightly.
"Heheh, you falling for trap! There not store here, only death!"
"You are in lucking day! Market open to all sorts! Come, participate in grand gesture of capitalistic adventure! Me am making profit today!"
"You are in lucking day! Market open to all sorts! Come, participate in grand gesture of capitalistic adventure! Me am making profit today!"
"Lying! I am knowing of it. For you, this earns disembowlment!"
"You expect us to hand over the shards of the holy Crystals to some... some common Federation filth? Unthinkable!" One of the Rock ships rises up to face you.
Apparently, the Rocks aren't having it. While most just ignore you, one particularly agitated vessel breaks off from the group to chase you!
In the search, you disappointingly find nothing of value. Seems if you want to find anything you'll have to search harder - if there is anything left at all.

You find only a handful of fuel cells, probably so unimportant that the Vampweeds simply chose not to take them back. It's a disappointing haul, but if you want to find more you'll have to keep searching.

You find a singular repair drone, barely functional, which you manage to squeeze a minor hull repair out of before it dies. No wonder the Vampweeds didn't take this back. Maybe you can find more if you keep searching?
You still find nothing of value - very disappointing. Your crew dust off their hands and look around at the empty huts and cargo containers in frustration.
This time, you find an overlooked weapons rack full of missiles and launchers - that is, until you realize half of the tech is broken and unusable. Only a few warheads can be salvaged.

You find an old, dusty paper map that seems to depict the current sector - but it's severely outdated and torn in places. It's useless to you besides revealing the location of an underground scrap deposit nearby.
You still find nothing of value - very disappointing. Your crew dust off their hands and look around at the empty huts and cargo containers in frustration.
You stumble across what you think is a functional drone - but it only turns out to be completely rusted and nonfunctional. You pull off what you think might be useful.
Your crew return with nothing. Not even a rusty tool was left to be found, or even a vaguely interesting shaped rock.
Your crew come all the way back to the ship. They're demoralized and angry, and want to quit. They bring nothing back with them, as to be expected.
You attempt to lie your way into the store, but the Vampweeds aren't buying it. "Get lost, Renegade! The Federation had its chance, but those days are done! You should have lost that Civil War!"
Infuriated by your attempts to lie to them, the Vampweeds retaliate with violence!

Your attempts at lying are fruitless, at least at first. Even after getting turned away, a little while later you're contacted by another Vampweed. "Ssssh, don't tell anyone about this! I'm a merchant, not an idealist. These guys... they don't have what it takes to make a profit. Turning away customers like that? It's idiocy! I'll sell to you, but you've got to make it quick!"
You find a single store that responds to your hails: "Don't open any wide band channels. We'll sell to you but we don't want to draw attention to ourselves."
A suspicious vendor lets you in, and allows you to browse his store. Unfortunately, on your way out you can't help but feel you might not have gone as unnoticed as you had hoped...

Your search for a friendly marketplace yields no results but after a time a small shuttle approaches. They release some supplies in your direction with the message, "We are not all friends of the Rebel fleet. Stay strong."
You apparently spoke to the wrong person in your search for a store. Warnings go off and you detect an automated Rebel ship moving in to attack.
You apparently spoke to the wrong person in your search for a store. Warnings go off and you detect an automated Rebel ship moving in to attack.
Your approach doesn't go well. As soon as you get too close, a Rebel ship flies out from a hangar at the market and attacks!
Your approach doesn't go well. As soon as you get too close, a Rebel ship flies out from a hangar at the market and attacks!
Despite the warning, you dock with the station. It's clear you're breaking the law here, but the store owner says nothing. On your way out, he whispers "Speak to no one about this."

Before you get to shop with the transport, an elite Rebel ship suddenly jumps in - this must be their escort. To your surprise, the transport turns on its military escort, and now you have additional firepower!

Before you get to shop with the transport, a Rebel ship suddenly jumps in - this must be their escort. The transport pretends not to be involved and accuses you of attacking them, prompting the escort to open fire!
You vanish, confusing the Rebels. You're able to sneak far enough away.
You step aboard the Rebel ship, somewhat cautious of a trap. Yet, nothing comes. You quickly take a look around and head out before their escort arrives.
Looks like the Auto-ship isn't falling for it. As soon as you transmit your ID, the ship scans your own vessel instead, recognizes it as Federation, and attacks!

You can't believe it, but somehow you've tricked the Auto-ship! Unfortunately, scans later show that the ship was recording and transmitting the entire encounter. Looks like the fleet might have some new information on your whereabouts...
Somehow, you've tricked the Auto-ship into thinking you're not a Federation vessel. It opens up its virtual market for you.
You aren't getting involved with the Duskbringers when you can help it.
You aren't getting involved with the Duskbringers when you can help it.
Looks like you didn't get away unnoticed - the Duskbringer vessel turns hostile and attacks!
By sheer, stupid luck, you get everything right. You'll be able to shop here safely now.

Looks like you've messed up, but it's not a disaster just yet. You're hailed, and a Duskbringer officer warns you that you descended a full centimeter below the allocated approaching space. If you don't want any problems, you'll have to pay a small fee.
You can tell by the tone of the Duskbringer he was looking forward to trouble, but you aren't giving him any. You don't mess up anything else, and are allowed inside.
The sudden excited attitude of the Duskbringer makes it clear this is what he was hoping for. Now prepare for battle!

It appears in your approach, you accidentally comitted a major felony. According to the station's security, your angle of approach went over by exactly 2 degrees, rounded up. This being an unforgiveable crime, they sentence you to death immediately. This is unusually strict, even for the Zoltans, so you assume it's only made up to get you in a fight!
To your luck, the ship doesn't attack immediately! "Ssso, a Federation ssship? Truth be told, the Coalition isssn't quite what it wasss cracked up to be."

choice.text: Why not go and live a reclusive life away from the fighting?

event.text: "What, the life of a coward? Sssoundsss perfect for me! You're sssmart. Now, I wasss thinking to myssself why I would want to be talking to a Federation ssship, but now I'm glad I did." To your surprise, the merchant offers to trade!

choice.text: Why not go be a freelance warrior? That's better than the Coalition surely.

event.text: "The life of a warrior isssn't the life of a Ssslug! HAH! You're asss ignorant asss the resst of the Federation. Now, it'sss time I ssstop sslacking and do my job."

choice.text: You're just a puppet of the government like you were before.

event.text: "A puppet? Of the Kleptocracy? Clearly, you know nothing about our sssociety. You're asss ignorant asss the resst of the Federation. Now, it'sss time I ssstop sslacking and do my job."

choice.text: Life is simply full of thorns.

event.text: "Oh, sssso we got an edgelord over here. Pisss off! No one thinksss you're cool!"
To your luck, the ship doesn't attack immediately! "Federation ship? Truth be telling, Coalition not what cracking up to be..."

choice.text: Why not go and live a reclusive life away from the fighting?

event.text: "Haha, life of coward for Mantis? Ignorant meatsack know nothing of Mantis! You are dumb as other Federation meatsack, robots, green freaks, and rest! It time I do job, and disembowel you!"

choice.text: Why not go be a freelance warrior? That's better than the Coalition surely.

event.text: "Life of warrior, similar to this. Yet, freedom of hunt, sounding spectacular! You smarter than I. Thinking, why myself speaking to Federation ship? Now I knowing." To your surprise, the merchant offers to trade!"

choice.text: You're just a puppet of the government like you were before.

event.text: "Puppet of Hive? Ignorant meatsack know nothing of Mantis! You are dumb as other Federation meatsack, robots, green freaks, and rest! It time I do job, and disembowel you!"

choice.text: Life is simply full of thorns.

event.text: "Hahahah, you are speaking like edgy teenager! Pessimism mindset of loser, not fine Mantis warrior!"
To your luck, the ship doesn't attack immediately! "Hmph. The Coalition is not what I expected. We do not fight for holy glory, only squabble..."

choice.text: Why not go and live a reclusive life away from the fighting?

event.text: "You expect me to turn my back to the holy texts, and go hide in a nebula? We Rockmen know more honor than that! You are foolish and naive, just like all the rest of the Federation. It is time we put you in your place."

choice.text: Why not go be a freelance warrior? That's better than the Coalition surely.

event.text: "A bounty hunter, a mercenary? You suggest I become a pirate?! We Rockmen know more honor than that! You are foolish and naive, just like all the rest of the Federation. It is time we put you in your place."

choice.text: You're just a puppet of the government like you were before.

event.text: The Rockman stops to contemplate. "You, you are right. No matter where I go, when the Theocracy banner flies, we shall never be free! I wondered why I let myself speak with a Federation ship, but now I am glad." To your surprise, the merchant offers to trade!"

choice.text: Life is simply full of thorns.

event.text: "Misery is a fact of life, we must suffer to appease the gods. What do you gain for making aimless statements like this? Hah, nothing! You are a coward who shelters himself in pity. Stupid Federation."
To your luck, the ship doesn't attack immediately! "God, I never should have joined the Coalition. I was better off before being miserable and picking up trash in those damn asteroid fields."

choice.text: Why not go and live a reclusive life away from the fighting?

event.text: "And do what, go back to picking trash? No way man, that sucks! I changed my mind, the Coalition is better!"

choice.text: Why not go be a freelance warrior? That's better than the Coalition surely.

event.text: "And what, get hacked to bits like Oertiss? I want to get away from the fighting, not plunge myself into the thick of it! You Feds are clueless, maybe it's a good thing we want to get rid of you!"

choice.text: You're just a puppet of the government like you were before.

event.text: "What? Tyrdeo might be a pansy coward who collects song birds, but he's hardly intelligent enough to be a puppet master. I signed up for the Coalition willingly because I thought it was better than picking up trash. You Feds are clueless, maybe it's a good thing we want to get rid of you!"

choice.text: Life is simply full of thorns.

event.text: "I couldn't have said it better myself. This place is hell. I don't even like the Coalition or the Republic. Why do I bother? Why the hell don't I just sell to a Federation ship? Does it matter? WHY DO I EXIST?!" The Leech captain starts sobbing, but you manage to convince him to sell to you as he mentioned.
"Great. Let me show you our waress. It's not often I meet patient alienss, have this complimentary fuel as well."
"Great. Let me show you our waress. It's not often I meet patient alienss, have this complimentary fuel as well."

"During our discussion, my man hass taken the liberty of disabling your weaponss to prevent any complications while completing our... transssaction..." You suddenly register multiple weapon locks, but your own weapons are not responding. Get out of there!
Your weapon system is restored to full power.
"Thank you. If you could do me one more courtesssy... please die quietly." You suddenly hear gunshots aboard the ship. He must have been stalling for time while they boarded your ship!
"Very well... Impatient alienss..." You prepare to jump.

You prepare to leave but notice noises in your ship. It looks like the merchant was trying to stall you while they hacked into your systems. You barely have time to order a red alert before a military ship flies through the clouds intent on your destruction!
The Slug seems to give up. "Thisss never worksss. Whatever. Want to buy sssome ssstuff?"
The Slug seems to give up. "Thisss never worksss. Whatever. Want to buy sssome ssstuff?"
Furious it's not working, the Slug turns hostile and a Slug vessel comes swirling out of nowhere!

Your piloting skills are fortunately enough to carry you through to safety. No asteroids hit you, and you make both trips unharmed. As the saying goes, it takes a brave person to set foot on a Slug colony - it can take weeks to get the mucus out of your clothes - but there's business to be done.

You make your way to the colony just fine, but your journey back is rough. As the saying goes, it takes a brave person to set foot on a Slug colony - it can take weeks to get the mucus out of your clothes - but there's business to be done.

Your trip there and back are quite rough, but you've made it there in one piece (hopefully). As the saying goes, it takes a brave person to set foot on a Slug colony - it can take weeks to get the mucus out of your clothes - but there's business to be done.
To your surprise, everything goes smoothly! No tricks, no traps, nothing! You're let into the store and take your time.
To your surprise, everything goes smoothly! No tricks, no traps, nothing! You're let into the store and take your time.
Looks like it's nothing but useless metal. You try and take anything you think might service for bartering to make back on your investment.
Seems the salvage contains a large amount of fuel, as well as some material that can be broken back down into scrap.
Seems the salvage contains a large amount of ammunition, as well as some material that can be broken back down into scrap.
Seems the salvage contains a large amount of drone parts, as well as some material that can be broken back down into scrap.
Seems the salvage conceals a hidden weapon cache! You pry it open and take out the weapon, which appears to still be functional.
Seems the salvage conceals a hidden drone cache! You pry it open and take out the drone, which appears to still be functional.
"Oh uh uh er uhm uh uhhh uh er uhm uhhhh..." the pirate takes off and runs into another room, slamming the door behind him. You can't figure out a way in, so you head to the market instead.

choice.text: (Hacking Weapon) Unlock the doors with your weapon.

event.text: Your hacking is able to scramble the locking mechanism, revealing the pirate inside. He surrenders almost immediately.
Your hacking module opens up the doors, revealing the pirate inside. He surrenders almost immediately.
"Don't ask questions you don't want to know the answer to." You might have pressed further, but the pirate hands some scrap to you discreetly and walks away.
"You know damn well where we got them! And now, you'll be our next!"
As you prepare to leave the system, the station suddenly turns aggressive - apparently, pirates don't take well to being ignored!
You ignore the refueling platform.
You ignore the refueling platform.
Besides the fuel, it looks like the station also has a market.

choice.text: Ignore the fuel and head to the market.

event.text: Looks like after the attack, the platform was damaged. You can likely steal as much fuel as remains, though the pirates won't be happy.
You hijack the fuel dispenser, taking as much fuel as you can before the pirates catch you.

choice.text: Ignore the fuel and head to the market.

event.text: You dock and signal the fuel station's newest 'staff' to begin refueling.
As you dock with the refueling platform, there is an explosion from your engine room! Warning lights flash in your ship as pirates from the station swarm aboard your vessel!

choice.text: (Blast Doors) Seal your blast doors, one can never be too careful when docked.

event.text: Pirates hidden on the station are confounded by your security locks, turning an attempted ambush into a fish-in-a-barrel firefight. You take control of the station and take its fuel reserves.
You dock and signal the fuel station's newest 'staff' to begin refueling.
To your surprise, no trick ever comes. The pirates finish refueling, and once they're done you're allowed into the store.

choice.text: (Blast Doors) Seal your blast doors, one can never be too careful when docked.

event.text: Looks like there was nothing to be worried about. The pirates finish refueling, and once they're done you're allowed into the store.

You feel somewhat odd about bowling with sentient creatures, but the Shells don't seem to mind. They were genetically engineered for the task. Unfortunately... you aren't very good at this. Strike beats you every single time. "Tough luck, but you tried your best. Feel free to go shop or whatever it is you came here for."

You feel somewhat odd about bowling with sentient creatures, but the Shells don't seem to mind. They were genetically engineered for the task. Unfortunately... you aren't very good at this. Strike beats you every single time. "Tough luck, but you tried your best. Feel free to go shop or whatever it is you came here for."

You feel somewhat odd about bowling with sentient creatures, but the Shells don't seem to mind. They were genetically engineered for the task. Somehow, you manage to pull through and best Strike! He's dumbfounded at first, but eventually he recovers. "Huh... you beat me. You are truly a bowling legend. I've bowled with all the greats, but none have ever beat me! I shall come with you, for you are a legend in the making."
To your surprise, one of the Lanius are so surprised by your kindness, they offer to join your crew!
It appears your kindness will not go unthanked. The Lanius offer you a weapon in return.
It appears your kindness will not go unthanked. The Lanius offer you a drone in return.

As you're getting ready to leave, you hear numerous sirens and a very threatening elite Duskbringer ship reveals itself. A Duskbringer squadron, armed to the teeth, rushes in and orders everyone to the center of the station for a mandatory inspection.

You and your crew follow the soldiers and other citizens to the center of the station. A Zoltan wearing a dazzling set of medals and other distinguished awards paces back and forth before the diverse crowd, shaking an electric baton in his hands. "Alright, listen up! Command's received word that Federation insiders have boarded this station! The Federation has come to defile our lands, and undo the dream that the Zoltan race has worked so hard to fulfill!" The crowd murmurs amongst itself, and suspicious eyes dart across the crowd. This could get nasty if you're found out - but chances are they're looking for the group you saw earlier in the market.

choice.text: Throw the other Feds under the bus.

event.text: You step forward and point towards the other group. There's a commotion and the Feds, with no other choice, draw their weapons and try to stand their ground. Clearly, they were't a combat group, because they don't last very long before they're arrested. The Duskbringer captain nods towards you. "Thank you, good citizens. Heheh. For helping create a better galaxy, I think a reward should be in store! Down with the Federation, glory to the Zoltan race forever!"

choice.text: Reveal yourself to save the other group.

event.text: You aren't sure who these other Feds are, or what they're here for, but you decide it's worth standing up for them. You step forward and draw your blaster and fire it at the Duskbringers. As the crowd runs away, you notice the Feds from before make it back to their ship and take off safely. You can only hope this good deed will go a long way.

choice.text: Stay silent and see what happens.

event.text: With such a rushed and ill-prepared action, it's no surprise you don't get very far before you're spotted. Get ready to fight for your life!

When no one steps forward or volunteers information, the Duskbringers are forced to resort to physical searching. They march up and down the isles, turning over boxes, emptying pockets, and frisking people. The scene quickly becomes mayhem, and the only reason it doesn't become full-on rioting are the bomb vests around the guards. Eventually, the other Feds get found out, and are arrested on the spot. Satisfied with the discovery, the Duskbringers finally let everyone go, your crew included. Looks like you got out, just barely.

When no one steps forward or volunteers information, the Duskbringers are forced to resort to physical searching. They march up and down the isles, turning over boxes, emptying pockets, and frisking people. The scene quickly becomes mayhem, and the only reason it doesn't become full-on rioting are the bomb vests around the guards. Eventually, the Duskbringers make their way to your crew, and it's no question you'll be found out. With no other options, you draw your weapons and get ready to fight your way out.

The store owner begins glowing with... joy? They seem to be done speaking, so the Harmony captain takes the opportunity to address you. "Your decision: [erroneous, harmful]. Federation ally value = negligible. Goodbye."

The Harmony ship jumps away without another word the moment you side against them, leaving just you and the store's owner on the comm. "Finally, thought never leave! Here, thought about violent approach, but no need now."
"Gah, now both you take same side? Fine, fine, everyone come shop."

"Great, now you bring friend to help scam? No believe trick! Get lost!" The store closes communications, but the Engi captain starts speaking again. "Gratitude value: moderate. Ineffective assistance = demonstrative of character. Query: your purpose at this store?"
"Understood. Beginning maintenance protocols." The Engi dispatch a drone to patch up your ship's hull, then jump off without another word.
"Understood. Transferring payment for attempted assistance." The Engi jettison a hunk of scrap from one of their airlocks, then jump off without another word.
"Understood. Transferring combat drone schematic." You aren't sure why they assumed this was what you needed, but they're gone before you have a chance to ask them.

Your Rockman shakes and smashes the machine, but nothing comes out. You stop before you destroy it beyond repair. Maybe you'll get something out of it eventually.
A single punch is all it takes to knock some scrap out of the machines.
Your Rockman punches the machine so hard it spits out a fresh new weapon!
Unfortunately, it appears your Rockman also caused irreparable damage to the machine. Oops.
You await your reward, but the machine buzzes and an X flashes on the screen. Better luck next time...

The Ghost is confused, but quickly seems to adapt to their predicament, and joins your crew partly out of intrigue and partly out of fear.

To your shock, out of the portal comes one of the members of the Haunt! However, they're much more docile than they were when you last fought them, and seem willing to join your crew.

A brilliant light fills the ship, and you feel a great joy overtake you. Everything feels like bliss, like everything will be ok. When you snap out of your trance, you find the ship has been remarkably better stocked than it was before.

A dark gloom consumes the ship, overwhelming your senses with the sounds of screams and the scent of rotting flesh. When the gloom has gone away, the ship is in horrible disrepair, and you are haunted by a feeling of regret.

removeCrew.text: Your crew does not appear in the Clone Bay, and it seems their records have been wiped completely. Whatever has happened to them cannot be undone.

event.text: A new foal is born.
A new foal is born.
The Beacon Eater nibbles away, careful not to damage the beacon too much so that you can't interface with it. After he's had his share, he drifts back carrying an extra lump of fuel and scrap.

The Beacon Eater nibbles away at the beacon, but suddenly it begins to spark, and then collapses! The Beacon Eater is thrown into the hull of the ship as the beacon dies. You're stranded, and the fleet will likely catch up a bit until you can hypercharge your MV drive enough to get you out of here.
